0vdUr-T2Qgx5_98F8N1rEg.review_text: 5 stars for the location, view and ambiance on a sunny day. 3 stars for the food and slow service.  4 sold starts overall.  Highly recommended for a brunch on a beautiful sunny day in a big group

0UmLTnN-W6rfwqfwPsHyUA.review_text: Went here around 1:30 on a Friday afternoon, day after Thanksgiving.  There was a 30 minute wait that ended up being more like an hour.  When we were sat we were told that they were out of all soup and crab.  If they knew this when we were waiting that hour it would have been nice to know.  My sister and I ordered a drink, she a sparkling wine and I the Sangria.  The sangria was about straight red wine...with a straw.  I contemplated drinking a bit more and asking for some sprite to take the edge off..but I didn't.  It was just potent. We both got the Louie salad with lettuce, avacado, egg, shrimp and crab on top.  Dressing on the side was more of a thousand island.  The salad was very good. The host was the most apologetic you could be but they should update their time estimating practices.

3EIc7WAoiojTFdy3TGOMfQ.review_text: Not sure if this joynt used to be called Lou's Pier 23, back when they used to have lots of bikes, parked 3 rows deep, out front, on any given Sunday afternoon.  Either way, it's a good spot to relax and enjoy a beer and a bite.  We popped in there on Saturday, parked right out front and grabbed a seat outside, with nice views of the bay.  We munched on fried calamari and a cheese platter, while sipping Blue Moons and soaking up plenty of that Bay area sunshine.  Then we tore it up across the Golden Gate and into Marin Headlands, then looped around Sausalito and back into the hood, just as the chilly ass fog started to roll back in.  Good times.

SB99H6_FKCiTOvqYyYqueg.review_text: Excellent lunch, great outdoor seating and a perfect sunny San Francisco day.  My husband had the fish & chips, and said they were the best he's ever tasted.  I had a hamburger, with some of the most tasty french frys, ever.

8vOYRdOpxEcxK17DA4-6eQ.review_text: This cool little place may be right in the middle of the touristy venues in SF, but you can definitely do worse than stopping here to rest your feet after a long day walking around SF. Small craft beer selection that is a little pricey.  You expect that on the Embarcadero.  But, you can sit outside, rest, and reflect on the day.  Always a good buzz with the mix of locals and tourists.  Def worth the time to stop here.

oIDV_HNYQRowjt80at-CLQ.review_text: Yes. Every single yes. Drinks, olives, crab and shrimp sandwich and bacon Mac and Cheese. The perfect ending to a day by the bay. FYI the seafood sandwiches come with fries... And a lot of them. The drinks are strong and the views are great in good weather.

xy6nD4IOlne5HTaVb2OLtA.review_text: The first time I came to Pier 23 was for a Native Elements show, (native-elements.com/www.…), and it was PACKED! But I like this place because out of the hundreds and hundreds of clubs, bars and lounges in San Francisco, Pier 23 is one of only a few that feature live reggae music all night. There's no place quite like it, I mean really, what other club, bar or lounge can you go to in San Francisco and see people passin' the dutchie to the left hand side? Yes, people were smokin' fatties like it was legal. Good thing there is an outdoor area in the back or else we all would have suffered from secondhand smoke and came out high as a kite! May I give you a few suggestions before coming to Pier 23? You might want to get your drinks in beforehand because the bar inside is always packed and it tends to get very hot in there, which makes waiting in line for a drink like one hot, smelly day in hell. There is a diner across the street (Fog City Diner) that has a full bar where its easy to grab a few seats, have some drinks and go. For shows, there is usually a $10 cover at the door (can increase to $15 after 11pm), but whenever there is a special performance, don't even try to get in the long line outside. Tickets are sold in advance either at Pier 23 or on the website. There is no dress code which is great. One drawback is that there are no ins & outs. So other than the fact that it gets crowded and hot, and beside the fact that people smoke weed inside (which can be a good or bad thing for some of you people), Pier 23 is a cool spot to hang out and listen to some good live reggae music.

XobVOrLM7CmA250pKfVTpg.review_text: What a world! Pier 23, all about guys and girls having fun.  Highlights: anything on the menu, Native Elements on the last Saturday of the month, Hot Pocket - used to be every 3rd Sunday of the month (bring them back), pictures of nice tushes, copper lined bar and great service from et al. with SHOUTZ @ Patrick the bartender.  One of the only places in SF that doesn't adhere to it's neighborhood stereotype so if you like the laid back, no BS kinda party, check out Pier 23.  Great views as well.  Dunn.

kGn_wjFiw1HrdfVHvkULCw.review_text: Pier 23 has a cute little bar with a kitchen, plenty of seating outside and the great view of the bay! The best part is the live music on the daily. My friends and I went to Pier 23 for a special event on July 3rd to see Reggae on the Bay. It was a great sunny day great people, good drinks and fabulous music. I hear the food is really good too but I will haven't got to experience that yet but will. We all had such a great time there this evening but at some point I had lost my phone. I thought that at a venue as busy as this it was gone for sure. Finally I decided to call there to see if by chance it was there. I spoke with the owner Flicka McGurrin who had informed me that she did find a phone, but drilled me to be sure it was mine. Which was just great to know she really wanted to make sure it got back to the proper owner. Well Flicka, yes it did and i want to Thank you!

yD-6TEgxUIZirRj5TJGnHA.review_text: The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because I have been here before for reggae Saturday nights with Native  Elements and that was a fun time. No question. Otherwise, good luck with getting good service.   We went there Friday after work around 6pm, prime time dinner time or at least HH time. We were both super hungry and the waiter came to us and asked if we wanted a drink. We ordered gin and sodas and those were brought back to us in a decent amount if time. Not bad. Can't mess up a gin and soda really. Then, he never came back. 5-10-15 almost 20 minutes past and he never came back to take our order. We were starving. Did he go home? Take a break?  Forget?  WTF??!!  I had to get up, walk around and look for the guy. Still couldn't find him. Finally, I had to ask our hostess to find him and send him to us as we have been waiting for so long and physically looked for him. Horrible. Why should I have to get up and look for my server??  By the time he came back, we were hungry and irritated. Sorry but we asked for the check for our two drinks and told him that we waited way too long and that we were way too hungry to wait anymore.   We paid and left (lucky for him that we are honest people because we should have just left). Horrible experience. HORRIBLE.

-FhWNXl3Xecvdas9Fhkxwg.review_text: I feel conflicted by the experience I had at pier 23 today.  I am kind of bummed in fact.   My friend husband arrived from Switzerland a few days ago and we anxiously waited until the weekend to enjoy the Crab season.......which started a week ago.  I suggested these folks because I have had many outstanding experiences here.    Our table was great. We had a reservation so I thankfully sat out back at a nice big table for five. Drinks were ordered..... They were great.  Love their bloodies.   But the bread didn't come.  We asked three people...it came AFTER the appetizers.  We ordered appetizers....shrimp cocktail and oysters.  These were not brought to the table for at least 2o...25 minutes. Two cold items should not take this long.  Not only that but, the shrimp turned out to be bay shrimp ....not the nice prawns I have been served in the past......HUGE disappointment. Another big bummer......NO whole crab.  She even told us ....'oh it's not crab season yet....'  I said ....'yes it is..... It's a week old!'   She then back peddled and said that this is what they say......and really they just ran out on Friday.   They offered Alaskan king crab legs baked?.!  NoT!!!! Our food was good.  The fish was tiny for fish n chips though.  I have also ordered the crab/shrimp Sammy in the past.....it was grilled.....but, not today,  they don't do this any more.  The bread is yummy though so it was good too.   We were really sad about the crab.....but we were hungry so, we stayed.  But I still want crab darn it!  My friend and my dad both had clapping.......it's red sauce now!  Good to see that:)

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: A great outdoor location to enjoy the bay view (as in the water, not that hood no one wants to go to and surely wouldn't be eating al fresco if ventured).  Large beer, wine and cocktail selection to make the scenery even more enjoyable.  The food seemed uneven despite the promise of a new chef that overhauled the menu.  Probably won't get anything as good here as at Pier 5, Pier 3, Pier 1.5 or the Ferry Building.  Might be some gems hidden in the menu, but I wasn't lucky enough to discover them.  Clam Chowder: Creamy, thick and huge chunks of clams.  Not terribly complex, but definitely comforting.  I really enjoyed the oversized crostini smeared with minced garlic as an alternative to overdone oyster crackers or saltines.  Crab & Shrimp Louie: I was excited about this dish because it's an old school San Francisco original and this joint looked pretty old school.  Sadly, only the crab and the dressing seemed to fit the traditional Crab Louie profile.  They used peasant quality iceberg lettuce instead of romaine.   No asparagus, tomatoes or cucumbers.  The shrimp actually detracted from the dish since they were the micro, limp cheap bay shrimp variety as opposed to something nice and hearty.   Mac, Bac & Cheese: I need to spread some mac hateration here.  No redeeming qualities.  The elbows were overcooked and soggy.  The cheese was bland and in short supply.  There were no bits of crusty/crumbly topping.  The bacon was in small bits, barely declaring a presence.  Linguine with Crab Sauce: This is the dish that saved this joint from dropping one star lower.  I was worried about the term "crab sauce", but was pleasantly surprised by nice large pieces of crab instead of those crab flecks some places like to try and pass off.  Hearty linguine with a complex tomato, tarragon and cream sauce.  Proves that placing large fresh crab chunks in any entrée can real improve it.

U9Jg3UtFrvYhuoz3j2i3Mw.review_text: Fun place on the pier, fast service, food was wonderful. The clam chowder is a MUST, with the sourdough bread!

u3gNq6zAO6wrq6DCgG-qvw.review_text: I'm a fish taco fanatic and I'm constantly searching for the best. San Francisco has a lot to offer in that department but I have to say that the fish tacos at Pier 23 score an 8 on my scale from 1-perfect. And let's be honest, perfect just doesn't exist so an 8 is pretty amazing!   If the food isn't enough to get you here, come for the setting. Pier 23 is right on the water with a great view of the bridge, the bay, and Coit Tower. It's also a great location for taking a walk down the embarcadero after a delicious meal!   This place is just the right amount of funky and divey. It's authentic and refreshing and you won't find anything else like it! Perfect for grabbing a bite with friends or gathering a group for special occasions. Definitely perfect when the weather is nice because they have a great deck for outdoor seating right on the water. It's my go to spot for dinner on summer nights in the city!

F_qav8BAOSjZt6TyV4XPTA.review_text: You walk in and are confronted by a bar and not much else. To sit  you need to go around the bar, and out back. There is a sitting area with views of the bay and piers. Low key, good food, a little overpriced but it is on the water. We went on a Sunday in November during rain showers. We visited out of season, and a Sunday, so there we're plenty of places to sit and no waiting. Clam chowder was good. The one huge negative is the SFPD have decided to ticket people parked on the other side of the Embacadero, by The Fog City Diner. I thought you could park there on Sundays, but they have the new payment stations set up and no signs to tell you parking fees are collected all week. The City works extra hard to upset visitors.

5s-jnZjO4tuNQFm4rPdBoA.review_text: Good view to enjoy a drink, but not -that- good. So definitely there are other places along the water for views and that means this place needs to try something else to be better than so-so.

raoeC8NEfYoksZ1LMBYeqQ.review_text: Great little seafood place to stop for lunch right on the Embarcadero.  Pier 23 overlooks the San Francisco Bay and if you are lucky you can get a table outside along the water (the alternative is inside under a clear tent).     Food is exactly as I expected - fresh seafood, lots of sourdough and good flavours/portions. My companion LOVED her fish tacos with the pickled red onions.   I didn't see any Cioppino on the menu which is what I was hoping to have but I still enjoyed my Shrimp/Crab sourdough sandwich with sweet potato fries and generous side salad. The place has atmosphere and is definitely casual dining (check out the slightly naught t-shirts the waiters were wearing).  When spending the day walking the Embarcadero or heading up to Fishermans Wharf this place makes the perfect lunch spot.

QFmdR-u6DZO1r5VQ8AnwEQ.review_text: Diagnosed with Salmonella after having the burger. Both my husband and I shared the burger and no one else in our party got sick.  To be fair, the food is decent, service is decent, and ambiance is lively.  It's going to be a while before I ever head back, in the meantime, SF visitors and tourists should not be deterred.  It is a great place to grab a drink and food.  My only advice..order something well done or fried..it's not a place where you should order the burger done medium.

mA3Os9shPwJj5CIsGFmpjg.review_text: EVER LAST SATURDAY OF THE MONTH!!  REGGAE NIGHTS!  BAND: NATIVE ELEMENTS LIVE ON STAGE!   $10 COVER, BUT SO WORTH IT!  Drink prices were Over $5 for beer, but hey seems like everything is going UP UP UP these days....   Do not park on the streets of Embarcadero, street cleaning at 12:01 a.m. to 6 a.m. I would recommend parking around fog city dinner.   When we went last night the night was perfect. Not too cold for SF and the heat lambs made a difference.   Get there early because it gets PACKED!!! They play about 3 sets and each set gets better and better!

yrP6iyhUrfKUKV_8R3c_nA.review_text: I usually dont write any reviews, but this has got to be one of the worst experience ever!  Thought that I should share this and wonder if others felt the same way as well.    Prior to being seated, the hostess told me that it'll be 10 mins for outdoor seating, which I was fine with.  But she started to seat people outdoor that came in after me?  How is that possible?  I was ok with that.  My friend and I sat there and our waiter came pretty quickly to take our order.  We knew what we wanted so we ordered everything, starters, entree and our drinks.  Got our drinks...waited...and waited...for a good 20 mins for our calamari to come out.  We slowly at the starter...to wait for the entree to come out but it NEVER did.  We asked our waiter and he mentioned that he wanted to "course" our meal out.  As we look around there were people who came in after us...a good 20 mins after us who got their starters when we got ours.  Soon after they received their entree and we still havent received ours yet.  So we asked our waiter and he said that he'll check on it.  He didn't go and check on it, he went up to another table and started talking and talking for 5-10 mins.  Then he comes back to tell us that we were the next ticket.  We waited and waited...and others were getting their food and we werent, so we decided to just leave.  Is it because I'm Asian and young looking they didnt want to serve me?  Of course I will never know since I will NEVER be back to this place.

x9l7X-i8GzT5XqZRi71M1Q.review_text: Let's start, View - go to google map, pier 23 and that is the view. Not the best, I think Sausalito one is way nicer.  Sitting outside - I was wearing a sweater and cold even though it was sunny, so hit miss.  Drinks - My beer was flat, my wife had a cocktail. The drinks were expensive $7 a beer.  Appetizers-  I had the crab bisque, it sucked, I can make better soup at home. Bread -  It is ok bread, sourdough not fresh baked.  Food -  my wife had a sandwich and she got plenty of sea food in it. Too much according to her. I had the roasted crab, it was too much crab and $40 so I ended up throwing half and paying a lot.  Service -   slow, very slow   Cost -  $110.  For $110 I can drag my wife to a Michelin star restaurant and have better food.  So, I won't be coming back. I doubt I'll be taking anyone there etc. Still, if you can't cook, you are a tourist and want the "view" and you want  some "local" sea food. Then go for it.   I was going to give it a fair 3 stars, then I remembered their menu has a stupid foto of 12 naked women's butts which I thought was very tasteless for my daughter to see. So I gave them my opinion on that, which they disregarded.  So 2 stars.

JzmJ6U20uJ9pZonwKGvMuA.review_text: Not a bad little joint if you're over here in the land of tourists.  I hardly ever come to this part of town, but when a buddy mentioned that he was there and invited me over for a few drinks after work, I headed that way and was glad I did.  Cool little bar on the water, though I wouldn't really call it a dive at all, just a normal bar.  They had a small band playing ragtime for the tourists and it wasn't too crowded.  The drinks were nice and strong, and the fried artichoke hearts were great (nice and crispy crust and perfectly cooked in the middle).  Is this a place I'd make a point to come to on my on?  No.  Is this a place I'd stop by for a few drinks and some food if I was in the area?  Yup.

TfLQ2GiP5aXKJakL0Ic2xw.review_text: I went to Pier 23 last night with some family and was very impressed!  From the street, this unassuming little shack doesn't look like much. You may pass it by everyday not giving it a second thought. I thought the same thing until I stepped inside out of the cold into the warm, small bar area.   The bar is nice and inviting with quaint theming. They had a Blues/Jazz trio playing that night and they were great! I play in couple bands myself and I really enjoyed the groove these guys had going.  We made our way past the bar to a small outside patio that is enclosed and shielded from the elements with see through plastic tarp. A bit odd at first, but once we were seated it was easy to get used to. They had heaters blazing so it wasn't long before I took my coat off and was nice and cozy. The patio offers some nice views of the Bay and on a hot summer night I imagine they dial back the enclosures.  For drinks I ordered the spice island mojito which was flavorful and tart. For food I ordered the crab & shrimp sandwich. My brothers both ordered the whole Dungeness crab and my mom ordered the crab & Shrimp as well.  The food came fast, our server was quick and attentive. My sandwich was fantastic! It also came with seasoned fries that amazing. I helped my brothers finish their crab which came cooked and cleaned with a nice broth in the empty shell for dipping. The crab was amazing, just perfectly seasoned and sweet. The broth was great as well.  This is not the cheapest place in town but great seafood comes at a price these days. This is really a great restaurant if you just want to grab a drink and listen to some live music or have a great dinner.

CExE3kMxN3qPuNkGtm0DMQ.review_text: This place was good. Their bacon mac & cheese was really good, as was the mussels and clams.  I liked that the fish & chips had seasoning on the chips, but I think I would have liked tartar sauce instead of the jalapeno sauce that came with it. But overall I really enjoyed eating here. I will definitely be back, with friends and family.

OK9CZaItaiUV0TW8B9viwg.review_text: Dreamed about sitting outside with a view of The Bay sipping an Ice Cold Stella and thats exactly what I did at Pier 23 Cafe on a warm Saturday afternoon.  Had the fish a chips, (cod i think) hot, white and  fluffy. Outstanding. Fries, green salad and a view of the bay thats unmatched. Excellent service too. I''ll be back.

E8U_KiTtvN4nK_Qk5y-suQ.review_text: Food was good but the crew was better.  I mentioned we were in a hurry for a quick dinner before our trip to Alcatraz and they HUSTLED FOR US!  The guy at the door initially wanted a $5 cover but let us pass when we told him we were giong to be in and out quick.  He told the servers (or manager) and they all jammed out our order and were very friendly about it.  I would definitely come back but probably not on a night they have a band.  It was a little too loud for my taste.  Everybody in our family got something different and we all loved it.  ESPECIALLY THOSE FRIES.  Would love to come down and hang out on the patio with a few beers next tim.

ECHwgN2yes8IQaCoN_JHPA.review_text: Great food. This place was on diners, drive ins and dives, and we thought we should try it. Delicious!!! A little wait time, avg 30 mnts, but it's totally worth it!

O9MT2vDk5FvPezVb_0D5Uw.review_text: We decided to check out Pier 23 for dinner after seeing it on Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive Ins + Dives". I don't know WHAT we were thinking... but on the show the food looked so good!  (We are locals - not tourists- so we really have no excuse here...)   We ordered fried calamari (average), fish tacos (meh, nothing special), and the crab shrimp sandwich. It was gross and a complete waste of my $17.50. It looked like some sort of a salad, with shredded 'crab' and tiny shrimp. It was drowning in mayo and the sandwich tasted like lemon. Only lemon. I couldn't take more than two bites -- it was that bad. The beer was good - but it is hard to mess up blue moon in a bottle.  This would be a great place to go for beers / happy hour. The location is right on the San Francisco Bay and the restaurant has a nice outdoor area. The view is perfect. Just skip it for dinner. Prices are high for what is essentially not very good bar food.

mjMN4kpfrcXuF3RKinMwxw.review_text: Walked in here for some clam chowder because it was along the path back to my car on a time crunch. They didn't have bread bowls which my girlfriend and I were looking for, so we just ordered  bread on the side.   The chowder was delivered quickly and was very good. It included a piece of toasted sourdough bread with garlic butter. Nothing beats Fisherman's Grotto chowder in Monterey, but very good nonetheless.

ttC21tYWje99-twhibbs3g.review_text: Fun on a warm sunny day...ok under the heavy awnings even on a coldish day. I'm always up for any place on the water with a view across the bay [even if constricted by the surrounding piers. Service was a tad slow and confused, but not as bad as some recent yelpers have apparantly encountered. We were pretty sure that our food was sitting on the expo counter for a while before our server came by to assure us it was almost done and coming out soon. Drinks were good; nothing notably good or bad. Clams were a little light on the juice, exacerbated by the fact that they came with bread under the shells, soaking up what little juice there was. Calimari and fish were good. I'll definitely be back, especially since they welcome dogs on both parts of the patio. My wife is not so sure she will.

fVh5YZ4acN8mLqJBS8Q_Kg.review_text: I would have given this place 3 stars but the service there is awful.  The hostess does not check for a table.  We waited for about an hour when they told us 30-45min.  When we sat down, we saw there were 4 tables empty.  The kitchen was slow as well.  Took forward for the food to come and we had to ask for bread.  When it did finally come, it was tasty but wasn't sure if it was due to the hunger pains or if the food was actually good.  I ordered the crab omelet and it was filled with crab and corn.  The corn was old, it had that shriveled and super yellow look.  I would go again if there was no wait but would not go back if there was a wait.

HkLS_1x_CGf6SxqBme6dRg.review_text: Go only if it's a beautiful day, sit outside, order your margarita. Also good for eggs benedict on Sunday for brunch. But again, only if it's nice enough to sit outside. I never tried them, but my aunt loves the bloody mary's.

JpGeoK0Yt2UfscjxdZSz1A.review_text: if i could give 0 stars to this place i would!!!DONT GET CALAMARI!!!Food poisoning!!i ate calamari at about 6pm and when i got home i felt pain in my stomach!i was throwing up the whole night and still didnt recover from those calamari!!if u dont wanna spend the next 2 days in your bad,dont go there!!!!

HWI2bI9Xh0aMWaJOKaDmAA.review_text: Last Saturday of the month = REGGIE NIGHTS!!! Live band (Native Elements) + Breezy night + People slapping your face with their long hair (guys, not girls) + Hurricane drink + Long lines for the ladies bathroom + Herbs in the air = PRICELESS!  =)  $10 for cover.  And of course pocket change for booze. That's really all you need.. and let the "magic" take over.  HAHA.  Okay, no really.  This place was coo.  Hella chill place.  No dress code.  No need for sweat b/c its outside even though the dance floor is packed.  And mixed crowd just swaying to the beats of that Reggae vibe.  "JUST CHILL."  =P

1qcq_VTO9fYIslCUwudlOA.review_text: I haven't been to Pier 23 Cafe in a LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG time.  I usually sit inside at the bar, have a couple beers and share appetizers but it was too pretty to pass up sitting outside.  My sister and I went there for lunch yesterday after visiting the Exploratorium.  The service seemed to be a bit slow at first but once our waiter came to assist us with our orders, he checked up on us a few times.  It was a gorgeous day to sit outside and look at the bay.  My sister and I waved to the water police officer, who was kind enough to wave back at us.  Good times!

_lbyIC9kqE6VVUy5Zzqk6w.review_text: Giving it one star because I can't give any less. Went tonight for reggae and it was terrible. The entire venue stunk like marijuana. DJ played too much backyard reggae and not enough roots.

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: The food is decent and it's always fun times to go and sit outside when the weather is nice.    I ordered the mussels, which were just okay.  The bloody mary's were just ok as well. I wanted them to be real spicy, which they weren't, but that's ok.  I wouldn't go back to eat as it's a bit pricy for what they have, but I'll def be back with friends when the weather's permitting, for a Sat or Sunday Funday!

ZlJtLWqVeQ5sTfIUr7FwIw.review_text: Absolutely gorgeous day and meal. We had the Crab and shrimp cakes Benedict and a Chicken Bacon Avocado sandwich. Both were absolutely fabulous.  We love Patio seating.

LiNx18WUre9WFCEQlUhtKA.review_text: This place was a cute little Diner with a great view of the water. They had some live music as we walked in which was good for ambience. We got to sit outside and it was nice to watch the sunset. We got the calamari and the chips & dip to start which were both pretty tasty indeed, with fresh fried chips instead of tostitos from a bag (hey, its the little things!). For dinner I got the Fish & Chips which were just ok. Not really what I was expecting, like a typical fish & chips meal, the fries were just meh and the fish was a little bland. Nothing 'horrible' about it, I've just had way better. My friend got the Crab Cioppino and loved it, some friends got the Shimp & Crab sandwich and didn't. It was a toss up, we came here since we saw it on D.D.&D., but I suggest you don't have that as the only reason.

8CDxLgZ64GOMCS_ikvNnqw.review_text: Just ok. Pier 23 was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives a looong time ago, so we thought we'd finally check it out. They have fairly lively shows at nights on the weekends so that's fun if you can come with a large party to chill for a bit.   We had the mac & cheese, which was overly cheesy (yes, there is such a thing!) and there wasn't enough mac... it was almost like cheesy macaroni soup. We also got the carnitas sliders, but it wasn't anything to rave about. I will say that I liked their clam chowder, though! Service was decent. Would I come back? Maybe if someone else really wanted to check it out, but it definitely wouldn't be near the top of my list.

YjlY8yMw8f9EMzIM9i9Pew.review_text: I created my Yelp account because of this place.  I've gone to Pier 23 Cafe twice now, and I will not go back again.   Trip 1: The first time was after a Giants game, around sunset. The place was quite crowded, and I had to act like a vulture and try to track down chairs to take away from tables as people would get up. For the first half of the meal some of us had stools from other tables that were too high for our table. The service was nothing special or bad - just what you would hope for. The food was OK at best on this trip, but I didn't order anything too complicated (fish & chips and clam chowder). The food was overpriced though. Our group sat outside and an obviously drunk guy two tables away, over the course of about 10 minutes, chucked his empty glasses of beer, plates, utensils, etc into the Bay from his seat - and he wasn't exactly sitting near the water. Somehow, the people working there either missed this or just didn't care.   Trip 2: A buddy of mine and I went there to grab a late afternoon bite to eat. The place was not busy at all and we were seated in about 5 minutes in the smallest table in the place. The table could barely fit one meal and a drink on it if we tried. A bigger table, happened to open up next to us after a couple got up to leave, and I asked the waitress if we could move tables. She said no problem and sat us at a table made for 4. After waiting about 10 minutes the waitress finally came back and took our drink orders. Before the drinks were brought to us, the hostess comes up to us and makes us move tables because we are a group of 2 sitting at a 4 person table. I thought it was ironic since two people were just sitting there before us, but we went along with it.   Without going into too much boring detail, the server was as slow as you can be and was quite inattentive (never asked how we were doing, water glasses were not filled unless asked, etc.). For the meal we got nachos and clam chowder for appetizers and chicken breast sandwich and fries for the entree. The nachos were AWFUL and overpriced. The nachos at any ballpark taste better, and I'm pretty sure they use the same liquid cheese. How can you not use real cheese on restaurant nachos? The clam chowder was good, but nothing special. The chicken breast sandwich and fries were not bad, but it too was overpriced. While serving the entree, the bus boy dropped a plate and some sauces on my buddy. It turned out to be less of a mess only because we both caught some of the flying debris in midair. I made the joke to my buddy, well we have everything we need - no way this get worse. A minute later, the person at the table next to us starts to smoke. The staff there did nothing about it, and let her smoke.   Once our meal from hell was over, we just wanted to leave. We had been done with our meal for a good 20 minutes before we ever saw our server, and had to flag her down to get the check. I got the check, and guess what, apparently soda refills aren't free.   Oh, and by the way, parking is a hassle. Mark this place down as not a place to visit.

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: Fun bands! A great way to spend a sunny afternoon on the patio.

r2vJMJG46yQ-iU6rF2tBhg.review_text: Even thought I found good reviews for this place on Yelp, I was bit dubious when I walked up. It looked like a diner that had been transported from Route 66, and I was afraid it would have 'bad' blaring music. But I was immediately seated at patio counter with a commanding view of the water. The service was swift and pleasant enough.  I decided to order what the guy next to me was eating--their crab/shrimp sandwich. The price may seem a bit steep, but the quality and quantity of the fish makes this a fair deal. I can just imagine what this would be like at some place that was trying to economize.  Go for the food AND the view.

feXqDToFWaY94kIHyXN0-Q.review_text: Amazing. Sit out on the patio and have beer and appetizers and there is nothing better.   You should ask for Kimmy when you go because she is the best server that cafe has. Great Saturday crowd and the food is great.

DFENl5W4GgwGshWSgP3vbA.review_text: Yeah, so I think this place is crazy overpriced and not that great.  I give it the 3 star rating for location and service and that the food was pretty good.  We went there expecting to get duck poppers, but they weren't on the menu.  That was a HUGE disappointment.  They were on Food Network so I was just dying to try them.  Instead we had an order of the garlic chile prawns.  There were 6 little ass prawns over some spinach for $12+.  It was not what I was hoping for.  On the upside, the view was very nice and the server was friendly and timely.

7-MrMSg77A5_8a5fJTJQUg.review_text: Disclaimer:  I have not eaten here yet.    The reason I wanted to write a review is because my cousin from Arizona saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives, and since she was in town, she wanted to eat dinner here.  So we call the restaurant at around 7:30pm and they tell her that they close at 9pm.  I look up the Yelp hours just to make sure, and the hours said they closed at 10pm on Mondays.  We get there at 8:15 and they tell us they're closed. Um?!!  How do you not know what time you close, and how do you advertise your hours and not stick by them?  I just checked their actual website and it does state 10pm.  They had a billboard with their holiday hours that night as well, and there was nothing stating it was closed or would close early.  I would've given this place 1 star, but I still want to try their food - I mean, it is a restaurant and they should be judged fairly on what they serve.

Ytq1HaAK4Dc84UnShCnI6g.review_text: This place is a perfect example of me being blinded by a fun patio.  Upside: The patio is awesome.  They make Dark & Stormy's.  Downside:  The food is mediocre at best.  Sadly, I will return to any place with a kick ass patio.  So, much as I hate your food, Pier 23, you will see me again.

Expm6-8o15O0-HQnGTEtrw.review_text: This place has gone downhill rapidly since I last ate here 2 years ago. I came here with my family and brother visiting over from the UK. Food was bland and overpriced. We started with the fried calamari. I've had much better, I found it to be over-battered and over-cooked, quite rubbery.  The steamed mussels and clams tasted gritty and like they had not been washed, I had at least 2 or 3 unopened ones which made me question the quality of what I was eating. The crab and shrimp sandwich was bland and the clam pasta was literally a ton of cream sauce poured over yet more gritty clams. Even my two year old son turned his nose up at the mac and cheese. The only thing that had flavor were the fries - which were cold!  I was embarrassed to pay the bill for what prices they were charging. I'm giving it 2 stars as we may have caught them on an 'off' day. Last time we went here we were impressed, so our high expectations were let down.

vvwjm3McQ9PffWhM-1AiqQ.review_text: Seen on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives!  The view from Pier 23's outside patio is beautiful, and they also have a tented area outside with heated lamps where you can enjoy the scenery as well as the artificially created heat.   Girl had the crab and shrimp sandwich with seasoned fries.  It will definitely get you full and in food coma heaven.  I had the fish tacos and LET ME TELL YOU, it was not your average beer battered tacos stuffed with slaw and cream sauce, oh no.  It was sauteed, moist, and superbly fresh.  I think they had some sliced onions and poblano peppers (not spicy) in it, and it also came with some melted cheese on the corn tortillas.  Add a squeeze of lime, some of the red sauce, and some of the green, and you've got yourself simple satisfaction at its finest.    We got there around 2pm, and there was an hour wait, so go on a nice day when it's sunny out so you can cruise up and down the Embarcadero while you wait.  There's expensive ass parking across the street with cheaper metered parking on the outskirts.

XWhXY9Xk-4JQE0Z96EvGqQ.review_text: Pier 23 is, indeed, an awesome location.  We went there for lunch yesterday on a glorious, sunny day.  That said, we have some criticisms.  The food is terribly overpriced.  $17 for a 6-ounce flat iron steak sandwich.  $16 for two prawn tacos.  Lunch with one beer and two iced teas was over $40.  We also found the food not very tasty, not as good as some of the other Embarcadero food/drink shacks, like Hi Dive or Red Java.  The chairs are plastic and not very comfortable.    However, the service was very good.  The busboy kept coming over and collecting my empty Splenda envelopes!

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Pier 23 was a great place to watch game 2 of the 2012 World Series. GO GIANTS! The staff was really great - organized, kind, ready to handle boisterous patrons. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and nice atmosphere all the way around.   But boy oh boy the food could really use some improvement. The fried calamari was sooooooo greasy. I sent a couscous dish back that was uncooked and unflavored. Granted, it came back better...and we had a fairly decent salad. The french fries served with the burger and fish & chips were seasoned, which hmmm....I don't know....it didn't make them taste any better.   Anyway, I look forward to coming back to see some music and have a drink, just not for a meal.

knNVycEWg63d0mlZgJGbgA.review_text: Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  Place was pretty busy and we were told the wait for 2 would be 35 minutes.  No problem...a couple of bar stools opened up so we passed the time with some beer.  Once seated outside with a great view, we shared the calamari for a starter. The breading on the calamari was seasoned nicely and was crisp and warm when served.  The dipping sauces were very nice.  I thought that the calamari was just a tiny bit over cooked.  But all in all a nice app.  I ordered the Fish and Chips and my husband opted for the Crab & Shrimp Sandwich.  The fish was cooked nicely and I loved the Jalapeno Sauce that came with it.  The portion of the fish seemed a little bit smaller than I was expecting but it was plenty for me.  Husband's sandwich was packed with seafood and served on nice toasted sourdough.  I would said it was like a crab and shrimp salad sandwich.  Seemed a little under seasoned but overall a nice lunch option.  Good service.  Hostess and Server were very personable and attentive.

iaXhoVVIwcU_AFm8oSeBlQ.review_text: The last time I was there, had the seafood sandwich, which was amazing! Tons of seafood, fries, small bed of greens. More than I could eat!! Presentation was great, service very good.  Today, not the same experience.  After a long day of sitting through lectures at the dental convention, I was craving nothing but Pier 23. Greeter wasn't the friendliest, but "Eh", whatever. When I was ready to order, I told the server what I wanted (their version of a Reuben, the Corned Beef on Sourdough). I was going to ask about also getting a few oysters on the half shell, but she darted off before I had a chance, right after I finished saying the sandwich I wanted! So much for add-on sales, to add to her tip also!  After having been blown away by last visit, I was disappointed in this one. The presentation was boring... the sandwich on a wood plank with a pickle on the side. No greens, no fries. The flavor was good, but the corned beef a fattier than I'd have liked. I had to pick a lot of it off. I was still wanting to get the oysters, and had decided I'd like to add a beer also, but since my server NEVER ONCE came to check on me while I was eating, that never happened. I had ordered iced tea. No checking to see if I needed another. No refills to my water glass. I felt completely & totally ignored.   Another solo female diner to my left seemed to also be less attended to than, say, the male solo diners that were seated to my right. They were all asked if they wanted more beers, checked on, an offer to put the bib on the diner who'd ordered roasted crab. I left a 22% tip because that's just who I am, but hated to leave anything, given the utter neglect I was shown. Just think... if the server had done her job, I'd have probably ordered at least another $15 in food/drink, and probably another $5 in her pocket. Given my observations, however, only her male customers ordering crab and Oysters Rockefeller, as well as beers from the get-go were worthy of her attention.   If you don't care for seafood, and love corned beef, get the "Reuben". It was good, their house-made sauerkraut less tangy than the purchased versions usually used. If you're on the fence, go with the seafood. I should have. At least then I would have been happier with my food as I was being ignored & treated as if my $ wasn't as good as my male counterparts'. Ladies, if dining solo, I wish for you to be treated as if your hard-earned money was as good as your male co-diners.

_FeNM_O6IhKHXLJBiGiu8g.review_text: Clams & Mussels with sourdough bread, awesome, peel & eat shrimp, overcooked. When the shell doesn't peel off the shrimp, they're over cooked. Nice view and good service.

ks6ocHkiUmwTHY6hzjhVdw.review_text: I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago after seeing this restaurant on TV. It's a small but scenic joint on the Embarcadero pier. I ordered the steamed muscles and clams, and it was perfectly cooked. I wouldn't recommend the calamari, there was too much beading and the dipping sauce wasn't too good either. I actually came here for their bacon wrapped duck but I was told they don't make it anymore.

547yp7aK-bu2w3Yn9V2CzA.review_text: I've always came here with my husband & always had a great time. We also decided to bring my sisters with their husband & had a wild fun night. ;)

6p8o1rwU3NvVfGS72cxiNQ.review_text: Being a guy from Boston I found this place to be just like my hometown Pubs. The bartenders are moving and shaking and always have a smile on their face. The location is fantastic and the food is very good. A bit of a small environment, yet that is part of the fun since it gets everyone together. Would highly recommend to those out of towners who are looking for a cool place right on the Pier to hang out.

thN6J0phXSgzbwmjjwYQWA.review_text: Perfect place on a perfect day.  The drinks hit the spot, the sun was awesome, and the views of the water were to die for.  The food?  Meh.  I ordered a chicken sandwich, and it was just ok, and pricey for what it was.  The server was friendly, and the bathrooms were fun (definitely worth a look-see).  I would go back just for the atmosphere, and I'm sure tourists would really dig it.  Just plan to wait awhile if you're there for lunch, but that's fine if you can find some outside bar seating.

S1Yu4McDc-ecjMO5PgW2dQ.review_text: this is a cute spot on the waterfront with a KILLER outdoor seating area that overlooks the bay, with views of marin county.  a friend and i stopped in for lunch on a sunny weekday.  the food was good and the staff was very  nice.  i would love to come back on a weekend and enjoy brunch there, but i am sure it gets crazy busy!

cap1v8o7pjt2c-ictqXkgw.review_text: Awesome music and drinks, overpriced mediocre food, less than attentive staff .

zfOPAforyvoEyO_KwTjFhw.review_text: THERE IS NO HAPPY HOUR HERE.  "drink specials" occasionally, BUT NO HAPPY HOUR.  bah. on to the next one..

3addBkDs3LAAnD-51M6n5w.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!! Its the best to go when its a beautiful day out and you can sit outside by the water. The specials are always changing but trust me when I say you wont be disappointed. Every time I am there i make it a point to get the clam chowder because its SO BOMB!! Love this place, and even has live music and great drinks. YOu wont be disappointed.

YxTHF-LQy_8fPboHQQ6lWA.review_text: Had a nice lunch with some colleagues during a business trip to San Francisco. During the meal, the waitress lost control of her tray and spilled beer all over my suit jacket. She apologized profusely and helped clean up the spill. She returned a few minutes later with a note written on the manager's business card offering to pay for the dry cleaning. I explained that I was from out-of-town and she invited me to send them the bill.   After returning home, I had the suit dry cleaned. I emailed an image of the card and receipt to the restaurant, fully expecting them to ignore the entire matter. Instead, I received a check in the mail less than a week later with a note of apology.   To me, any restaurant who owns their mistakes and follows through with integrity is worth my recommendation. And they have great food to boot!

IfSgqMsIBiADxvLJRHu6wg.review_text: I was hungry and looking for a place to eat at the embarcadero. I didn't want to walk to Pier 39 so I settled on Pier 23. They have tables at the back with a good view of the bay. However, food was ok but overpriced compared to other restaurants.

fQPX2QrnxmS35ALQmnnIsw.review_text: When we first sat down for dinner at 7, the place was pretty lively and it was hard to get our waitress' attention.  I have not been back to this place for many years...I remember the Fettuccine being very good but it was no longer on the menu.  Food is very, very average...my Fresh Blackened Snapper was very fishy tasting.    That said, it is a FUN, fun place to hang out and have a couple of drinks...the sun was still out and you're on the water.  We were able to stay til closing and be as loud as we wanted.  Our experience would have been better if the heating lamps actually worked...and we would have ordered another round of drinks had the server been around again.    Good happy hour spot. but don't expect to be blown away by the food!

lgR3cgVI9ZHMpcABIMuvvw.review_text: Impressive! I took my husband there for father's day along with our 3 month old, and we had a great time. The food was perfect, the service was friendly and the atmosphere pretty laid back with a scenic twist. We sat in the covered patio area which was perfect because it had an 'outdoor' feel without having to experience the cold wind but still able to appreciate the wonders of Embarcadero.

fUSsb6zgdAWAAYxvTapr2g.review_text: Another Triple D spot that Guy was able to convince me to try. I came to Pier 23 with my friend for lunch on one of the most beautiful days in San Francisco since I've been here. Pier 23 is right on the water, but unlike most places in that area, gives a bit of more of a locals feel, though I'm sure a lot of tourists check it out too.   It was a Friday afternoon and it was pretty busy, but we only had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. We grabbed seats at the bar to have a drink while we waited and the bartender immediately greeted us with high fives (lol). I unfortunately cannot remember his name but he was awesome. I ordered a pino grigio, which came in a water glass...odd but I didn't really mind.   We then were seated at a table directly on the water with a gorgeous view of the bay. Our server greeted us promptly and was also really awesome (can't remember her name either, dammit). We ordered the cheese plate to start, which came with grilled garlic cloves, almonds, and honey. It was a good app - but it doesn't really take much effort or culinary expertise to make a cheese plate. I was between the seafood louie or the fish tacos, so our server helped me decide by recommending the tacos, which I discovered were snapper. They were really just eh. Having lived in Florida for 5 years, I have had some really amazing fish tacos, but these just didn't compare. The sauce they came with definitely added great flavor though and they were not horrible by any means. My friend had the clam chowder and a caesar salad and seemed happy with them.  If I was basing my review on food alone, Pier 23 Cafe would probably get 2.5-3 stars. However the view, ambience, and service boosted me to 4 stars. Well, let's say 3.8.

S0pIi8h7xLs1g2d1EERSDQ.review_text: Overall disappointing.   We came to pier 23 on the recommendation of a local and ultimately we left disappointed. After putting our names down for a 45 minute wait, no big deal, we went and sat outside in the sun with a couple of beers. This was the best part of our time there.   An hour and a half later we had not heard from the front so I went back inside and they had forgotten to call. After many apologies we were seated only to then be told that there was no crab, the one thing that we had come for.   The 5 flavor chip dip was very good but not what we were hoping for. Also the staff was very slow and seemingly uninterested. Overall just not a great vibe about the place.   Might try it again someday but I wouldn't come back for the food. If you're looking to have one or two beers in the sun however this would be a good spot

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: My company hosted a going away party here. They had all of the food preordered, we had sliders, fries, and fish tacos. I didn't try the tacos but the sliders were really tasty little burgers and the fries were sweet potato.   I order a few of their specialty cocktails. I tried the Sangre Peligroso, which came with Peligroso Silver Tequila, solerno blood orange liqueur, lime, and a chile salt rim. This was a strong drink, but it was tasty. The chile rim gave the drink an extra kick.   After one or two of the Sangre Peligroso, I decided to switch over to the Sally Rand. Served with Ketel One Vodka, pear liqueur, ginger, and fresh lemon. This cocktail was REALLY excellent. The pear and ginger flavor combination was incredible.

FjMzwdvC8VEsrUu7E_76hQ.review_text: Perfect place to do lunch on a sunny day. I went with my friend and we both ordered the SF shrimp and crab sandwiches. I also ordered a lemonade which they make on location. Everything was wonderful. I thought the sandwich would be full of filler, but I am happy to say the whole thing was stuffed with actual crab and shrimp meat. My drink was good too. The view was beautiful and service was friendly. The one downside to this place is that service is painfully slow. Be sure to go when you aren't in a time crunch.

4qQGdBImCy1zd-2l5GMaIg.review_text: Triple D with Jerry, Deb, Sara n Joe.

ZYzTFcDhkv1vL1uhjmoV6Q.review_text: We went there not expecting much. The place had a view of the pier, it wasn't the greatest view because the water was brown/grey but it's a city. Service was good, the food took a little longer than I expected, probably because we were in a hurry.  Clam chowder- great,lots of clams and fish. But they charge you $3 extra for sour dough bread. I though it would be sour dough bowl but it was just literally 2-3 small pieces of bread that other restaurants give you for free. Big rip off! Fish and chips- fish was very soft and lightly breaded. Fries were standard.   Overall a decent place, but nothing exceptional.

pY5qXTQEYj3n2GzU3q-cfg.review_text: Truth be told, Pier 23 looks like a complete shithole from the outside, but once you walk inside, it's actually quite clean.  The back deck is nice and the drinks were strong, but not too strong.  So why did i give them 2 stars?   RUDE STAFF  My company rented out the back deck for a client event (read: we spent a ton of money) and the cocktail waitresses (more like bar maids, really) were so unbelievably rude that it was hard to hand over the sure-to-be-pre-determined tip.  I know navigating a group of close to 50 may have been less than fun but suck it up, it is your job.  I didnt think we were too demanding of patrons either.    Also, the food we ordered was pretty gross. Calamari - battered bits sitting in grease, Buffalo wings - dry and the sauce was congealed and nasty.  Lastly, they put all the food in the hot sun and the crudete plate was warm and soggy (limp carrots and broccoli = not good) by the time I got to it. GROSS.

XpuNEgQPFBe0se9Agpprgg.review_text: CINCO DE MAYO! That's where I went for early dinner celebrations with the amigos. The outside seating was nice, but not glamorous by no means. But still nice with the view of the water.   I shared a crab and shrimp sandwich with my friend - it was A-OKAY. Honestly, nothing special. I was actually pretty disappointed because it was kind of pricey. The fish and chips tasted pretty good though.  The service - whack. I understand it's Cinco de Mayo and there's a lot of people, but cmon...our food took like half an hour to come. And when inquiring about the status of our food, our waitress was rude and pretty much told us to be patient and that it's coming. Then she gave us the EVIL EYE.....oohhhh...

GTtHe3-9Tnqz4YGQzhKcqQ.review_text: Cozy little place to hang out especially on sunny days.You can sit out side on their deck on the water. They have live music during the weekends and on the last Saturday of the month, you can dance and listen to the great tunes of  NATIVE ELEMENTS. The food is not bad but we mainly go to this place to kick it and enjoy the music. Only disappointment I have is that there is one bathroom for the men and women so the line can get really long.

TvpR1U9JSwcUufR_N8SNDA.review_text: the only reason i gave 4 instead of 5 stars is due to the sucky service we had today.   the foods were great. atmosphere were great. previously we had an awesome waitress who went out of her way to make sure everyone was more than happy.   the waiter we had seems to disappeared completely until the end of the meal. we had to wait 15 min to get someone to fill our empty water glasses and take away our appetizer empty plates. (i hold them high for at least 7 min before the hostess took them away from me)  make rsvp. will help on the waiting time. or come early.   will definitely come back for the foods and atmosphere. hopefully we get better service next time.

7np9Mav_Jgzi4TiYOV64mQ.review_text: I almost don't want to write this review cause I don't want a bunch of idiot bucketheads ruining my favorite little gem.   But if you like to dance - this is the spot. Dance under the bay moonlight! Grab someone easy on the eyes and swing them through the bay front fog. Fun will be had.    And bring you have friends that don't like to dance too - this joint will change their opinion on that matter.

qAcXY-PTP4vW43wlidNaUg.review_text: 12,50 for a burger. the waiter offer you gor extra avocado, bacon and cheese. the total is the 17!

VEZ1q_gfjwEjW19Two8plg.review_text: Some of the freshest seafood I've had on the pier. The fish and chips were exceptional and the cioppino was outstanding. It was worth the 30 minute wait.

0mTOg1uOB6cboB8C_aqUKQ.review_text: Good eats!  Calamari was good, had a nice kick with the jalapenos.  Crab and shrimp sandwich was massive, fish and chips were good.   Live music was playing in the bar.  Nice atmosphere...... I'd come back.

-R_tE7WO0S0fFU-rVzQvqg.review_text: Worst service ever! Bussers were cool, and way more attentive than the bitter, hungover waitresses. Too bad it's got a nice patio but don't recommened it, unless you like waiting for 30 min with your menu trying to order while the waitresses walk right on by without so much as a hello.  Bad service=bad dining no matter what. And to the waitresses good service= good tips (get a clue!) Oh and I work for big hotel right by this place and am friends with many concierge's and all the recommendations for this place went out the door for our guests.

pSRZzFxiVVeytMjdKf90Jw.review_text: Great time, great waitress,  great bacon wrapped oysters,  great mussels n clams, great drinks, great desserts...everything was GREAT!!! :-)

oA4ompknoW6XrONKYXQ_jQ.review_text: Best sunny day drinking spot of all time.    I don't even care about the tourists, the club promoters, the d-bags in sushi inspired leisure-wear or the Marina Chodes in aviators who decided to take a break from Sunday Funday Football at Mauna Loa/Bus Stop/Bar None/Balboa Cafe and get some color on their hairy chests.  Everyone is welcome at Pier 23.  Even blonde girls who use their boobs to get what they want...  Namely me.

2h1B3IUp1TejELkxfffEkg.review_text: We love Pier 23!   I've been a regular customer for 18 years.   They've had a great new chef the past few years and the food they are putting out is top notch. Excellent seafood, salads, burgers and apps. Their seafood sandwich on sourdough is amazing. And love their seasoned fries too.   The drinks are great, and service is good too. The restaurant & bar is always busy and the staff does their best to keep up with the demand.   Check out their live music too!

oamQssrTwym4Kftv7ubRnw.review_text: Fish tacos and clam chowder are delicious. Will be back.

F_5_UNX-wrAFCXuAkBZRDw.review_text: This was the 2nd stop of my birthday food crawl (12/31/11).  I went in hobbit mode and had my 2nd Breakfast on my birthday. I'll have to admit that it was seeing this spot on an episode of Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives which made me decide to come here.  The Pier 23 Benedict looked really good when they made it on TV.  So that's what I decided to order. And just as expected, the P23 Benedict was amazing!!!  All, if not most, Eggs Benedicts that I've had look really delicious and this one was no exception (yelp.com/user_local_phot…).  Made up of Crab & Shrimp cakes, Poached Eggs, covered with Roasted Poblano Hollandaise.  Nothing but the good stuff!  It also came with mixed greens and fried potatoes which had a nice spicy kick to them. I would say that Pier 23 is a little down the middle when comes to Tourist Attraction and Local Joint since it's like a small diner on The Embarcadero where you'll find a diverse combination of locals and tourists.  It's not something that first comes to mind when you mention San Francisco, but they did get a lot of exposure with their Food Network spot.  Great food and great atmosphere (especially if you can land a table on their back patio).  I would definitely come back here again in the future.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: View for a kill.  The view: Stunning bay backdrop. Made impossibly better with each degree the temperature ticks up.  Somehow it was one of those rare warm August afternoons.  The kill: $13 for what was little more than egg whites and layer of black beans on a taco shell. Those huevos rancheros don't come cheap.  Single cod and shrimp slider was a better deal for $5.  Comes with fries on the side. Use them to bribe people with a better view to swap seats.  Fish tacos did look good. Server letting each member of a large group pay separately was a nice gesture.  Maybe I will be back. Especially with warm September afternoons coming up.

5Wr4pwoIaqyTDNsyY0j8BQ.review_text: The bar itself isn't anything to be crazy about but I did love the live music they had in the back. Went there for the live reggae band and the place was very live and had a energetic vibe to it.

RdFLWtGebIBbW1DN4BtFqQ.review_text: Pier 23 is a bar and restaurant located along the San Francisco Embarcadero. It's a welcome oasis between the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf - each 1 mile away. The location is excellent. In the Bar and front seating area you can watch the parade of people go by on the Embarcadero. The back seating area is large and has great view of the water. There is even a side beer garden area that's also a smoking section.  After that, this place moves to a mediocre rating. There is jazz music on various nights. The place is small and they use incredibly large speakers, which make talking impossible. Which would be okay if there was another activity like dancing, but no.  The food is okay. Some dishes are good, others are not. Nothing is steller. The burger and seafood sandwich are good. The steak sandwich varies from tender to tough. The clam chowder is thin and not very tasty. The oysters are okay - a good deal when on happy hour. I live 3 blocks away and have been to this place many times trying to make it my local. I never see the same bartender twice. They give adequate service - not chatty or engaging, but okay. Final word = This is a great place for tourist. If you know someone who works there, they are clearly allowed to spend time with you over their other customers. For locals, there are plenty of other places in SF I would rather be at. Once I move out of the neighborhood, I will not return.

QOVyUmxWv3n48jyedtS9IA.review_text: on tourist row, but plenty of locals hideout here after work.  One of the few restaurants on the water in SF.. this place has the old dock , feel with amazing food...

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: Saturday Night, late night dancing, live reggae music, watching the lights in the distance while overlooking the bay, nestled in a little cove - it's not windy, it's perfect. The music, the atmosphere, the company... I'm feeling it and it's all good.  We ordered drinks from the bar, relaxed by the bay and danced until last call. Loved the live reggae and the cool San Francisco relaxed vibe. It felt like summer and I loved it. I can't wait to come back.

tWdnu1PmbETZP8xYTri46Q.review_text: This place is whack.  Do NOT go.  We ordered: - miyagi oysters on the half shell (fresh, but not worth it) - fried oyster slider (blah) - calamari (disappointing) - angus burger (didn't try it but the BF said it was good) - seared tuna sandwich(B-) - crispy fish tacos (fish was not crispy and i HATE catfish) - the only good thing were the fries.  light, crispy and very flavorful.    I would never go back here.  The service was HORRIBLE!!!  They forgot about is several times.  We had to wait forever just to order.  Nope, never again.

efIJCmF7G2BoSEosqQiP8w.review_text: This place has the BEST bloody mary's and fried calamari! It's the perfect place to spend a sunny day since they have an outdoor deck right on the bay. Hot Pocket performs on the third Sunday of the month. They cover Hip Hop, Funk, Reggae, Soul, Rock, Dance, and Latin songs.   SUNDAY FUNDAY!

Wm2VNSNKXilGrwApVpO0NQ.review_text: I'm not a big fan of seafood, but I would definitely try this place again. The fish and chips here are phenomenal. Not overdone and they're so soft. The fries though oh my gosh. I would come here JUST for the fries. They're that good.

9QJ-wpP36cFmiwhkeeugGw.review_text: Checked out this place - only because we walked by and I said to hubs "Wait a minute, I saw this one Anthony Bourdain's layover episode. Haha so touristy I know. We stopped in for a beer to check it out. The bartender was a little less than friendly. He didn't seem like he was happy, and it seemed like we were bothering him in the afternoon when we ordered two beers. Other patrons came into the bar and he seemed more than happy to serve them. Maybe because we were tourists? I'm not sure. But we had one beer and decided that the hospitality was less than accommodating and we decided to walk bar the Nob hill area for better service/drinks.

713rMFi0JPeHeQfmoerRug.review_text: Been going here for years..... great out of town feel with casual seafood and style. Love the calamari and the crab and shrimp sandwich is a must.  The drinks are so so; this place is more about the atmosphere.  The outdoor patio seating right over the water is great when the weather is nice however they do also have heat lamps. I absolutely love their Sat night live bands; the Reggae nights are my favorite however do come prepared because the place gets packed. Sunday afternoons with the live bands are good too- check out their calendar as they have a wide variety of music played on different days.

drvVOxJxdakl_sQhr28uJA.review_text: Go for the food, but expect mediocre service.  The food is certainly above average.  Fish tacos were great (they are served in pairs for $12 - which is a great deal in these parts).  They aren't as 'full' as other similar dishes, but still great.  The calm chowder is also good (I ordered the cup).  There were whole clams in some spoonfuls...  yeah.  Whole clams.  The service is certainly below average.  If you manage to get a seat (many seats are open but they always seem full.  It took 3 visits to get a seat, usually during non-peak times.  They are slow to great you, slow to get drinks, slow to order (food comes out remarkably quick), and slow to check on you (my Diet Coke never got a refill).  The view is also nice.  They are building the new cruise ship terminal.  Not sure if the view will stay nice with those behemoths blocking the it...  In any event, it is worth a try.  Maybe it was just a bad service day?

7W10ai9wXpjeV5IElzq3bg.review_text: I love Pier 23 Cafe because it's got that small town feel. It's a locals joint where you often can find live entertainment. Don't go here if you are in a hurry tho - you need to be in a kick back mood to just sit and relax, talk, drink while you wait for your food.  I give it a 4 stars for one reason - the amazing oven cooked garlic crab. It's my favorite crab ever. I have never even had any that compares. Be prepared to get messy! =)  It also is a great ocean side casual place to dine. Not too many of those nearby.

yX6miszwwodkYGLBg7UEmQ.review_text: Mediocre food in a great area for tourists.  Parking is difficult and there is almost always a wait. Sitting outside on the water can be super cold, even with the heat lamps. This place has been on Triple D and several other shows on the Food Network, but I did not find it to be anything memorable.  Overall, the bar is fine for drinks and the food is decent, but could be improved.

tn9J2lERXLTcsLJ8isqHiQ.review_text: Food was good and arrived at the table quickly. Service was fast and personable. Great view - what's not to love?

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: If it's sunny in SF, you should run here to hang out.  I think the food is a little expensive for the dive bar atmosphere, but it's worth the fact that if you are here, you are outside and in the sun.

XYc6FmCJlEeGgdreWYHd_Q.review_text: Returning to Pier 23, everyone's favorite place on the water for a beer and lunch on a sunny day - or so it seemed when I went.  This place is perfect for hot days, near the water. San Francisco needs more affordable restaurant/ bars like this one, because there are not enough seats (30+ minute wait) or sit in the smoking section, next to the garbage. Meh, I still love it! Have a beer for me!

BYV_SMrNfsRIeE2ZaJDUrw.review_text: Within walking distance of the Exploratorium. Great option for food for family with their children's menu. We had the crab and shrimp sandwich and it was excellent.

QeXpm3JN06UwCNWm9V-puw.review_text: Asked one of my buddies on where I should eat one day I was in the city and he said you need to try out Pier 23 Cafe and order the crab sandwich! So let me start off by saying the atmosphere here when we walked in and it had a very nice feeling to it. The bar was full of people having drinks and a good time.   After a 15 minute wait, we got seated outside and got started with drinks and appetizers. We ordered the calamari and the carnita quesadilla and wow I was impressed with both. Highly recommend getting either one or both. I really enjoyed the view, the nice weather, and the crab sandwich the most! Portions were great and it was very delicious. Go visit Pier 23 Cafe and have yourself some great food and drinks.

rsf9fxfHFeNWSkzYF9CS0g.review_text: this place is a nasty dump with lame plastic chairs and seagull crap everywhere, slow service, noisy, nasty bathrooms that'll make you puke, urine smell you can't imagine. a nice view ain't enough to polish this turd.

-oHua9-DSzzIHRjI_WRQrg.review_text: This place is great especially for happy hour. $1 oysters all the way!  They have a wide selection of seafood but I always prefer to get the fish n chips. It's not a beer-battered fish, more like shallow-fried with a rub. It's still a great option.   You can't go wrong with what you order in terms of taste although when you're finished you  might feel like you overpaid by a couple of dollars. In the end it's all worth it because I think sitting on the pier, eating fresh seafood gives you a quiet feel that you can't get anywhere in the city.

upRh352VwnipRRWsnJP8SA.review_text: The food here is much better than i expected. So much better that I've found myself telling more than three other people this week. It looks like a total dive, but they have beer, spirits, sports, great food and all conveniently located on the bay (that means a great view). Nothing beats this sports bar atmosphere, but be prepared to wait for a table on the weekends. Good diggs

C-VGKUKcEKblEPiUokx8bA.review_text: Looks like from the other reviews, I'm not the only one who has gotten horrible service at this place! My mother, sister and I showed up around 1 on Sunday. We were told we could sit in the patio and that a waitress would be there in 15 minutes because they were really busy. The hostess said we could order drinks from the bar and bring them to our table while we waited. This was no problem at all. We ordered our drinks and sat down. After 15 minutes a girl named Kara came outside and told us to leave because they were too busy. We were really insulted! For a business on the water and on the busiest road in San Francisco, they should be prepared for busy days. They even explained that they were busy because of football season, even more of a reason to be over staffed, than under staffed. For a restaurant that has been featured on the Food Network I would expect a lot more.  Horrible experience and would not recommend this place! They will typically be busy in their location and you never know when YOU will be the one kicked out. There are so many great places in SF with great service, try those restaurants out! Not this one.

usXY7Ev2DOmURncEhNdtjg.review_text: This place is near my office so we go all the time and the food and drinks are consistently great. They make an excellent bloody mary! Probably my favorite in the city. I love the fish tacos and the poke tostada! The place is casual and down to earth. Nothing too fancy but the view is nice  from the back patio.

Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ.review_text: Reggae. Reggae's the first thing that comes to mind when I think of Pier 23. They've always hosted the coolest live reggae bands (i.e. Native Elements) on Saturday nights. To this day, it still has Reggae on the calendar. Nice! native-elements.com/www.… Besides live reggae, it's a fun & cool little lunch spot! The resto is a no-frills, clean, casual spot to grab grub. The view from the patio overlooking the water isn't too shabby, either. Being that Pier 23 is located in SF, along the Embarcadero, it's usually pretty chilly. The eats we ordered were pretty comforting. -Clam chowder bowl ($4). This was the perfect choice as a starter. Not only was it warm and delicious, but the toasted sourdough bread on top added the perfect touch. yelp.com/biz_photos/3f3m… -Fish and chips ($13.50). The fish was meaty and fresh. I would only expect fresh seafood from the Pier. The coleslaw w/ jalapeno dressing was delish, as well as the nicely seasoned string fries. I double dipped in the aioli sauce and then in the malt vinegar. Either sauce worked best! yelp.com/biz_photos/3f3m… Tips: -Saturday nights the cover is $10 at the door. -Their Long Island Iced Teas are STRONG. Be careful! -Be cautious of after hour-parking times. Your car will get towed. -It's located between two big warehouse buildings. yelp.com/biz_photos/3f3m…

Cm-MYn9PcmurbePF-HBc5w.review_text: "The Sam's of the City"  This place is solid for a weekend lunch (or weekday if I didn't have a full time job in the East Bay). We pretty much just go for the back patio but the food isn't bad. In fact, the cheese plate and calamari with white wine make for a very nice afternoon.

Lm1GoUvzPpPY9w46IFLzBg.review_text: Even a cool looking spot on The Embarcadero can turn a sunny afternoon into an unpleasant experience. Such was the case this past Sunday at Pier 23.  Having found a parking spot right on the Embarcadero across from Pier 23, I thought was a good omen. My first clue that this may not be the case, was when the parking meter (now needing to be fed on Sunday) charged $2.50 per hour. Nonetheless, since it was such a nice afternoon, my girlfriend and I decided to pay tribute to the meter and cross the street to Pier 23.  We walked in and found two seats at the bar (which was not crowded at the time). Although there were two bartenders, service was a bit slow. Finally getting one bartender's attention we ordered a Virgin Mary and a Diet Coke. We then asked for a menu and my girlfriend asked for a glass of water. Bartender 1 delivered the menu and the glass of water along with a comment, " You sure ask for a lot." I took the offhanded remark as simply a poor attempt at sarcastic humor.  After perusing the menu, we decided to order. Keeping in mind that the bar is not crowded, that there were two bartenders and that there is less than three feet between me and the bartenders, this should have been a simple task. Not so.  I attempted to get Bartender 1 who served us to take our food order. I said "Excuse me!" not once but three or four times --- nothing. I waved and pointed to the menu, indicating that we were ready to order ---- nothing. I stood higher up on the bar stool to gain attention --- Bartender2 saw me and indicated he'd be right over, but as soon as I sat back down he went to the opposite side of the bar. Bartender 1 although there, was mute and kept his back to me.   Finally, I said to my girlfriend that I didn't enjoy having to beg for service so we decided to leave. I then asked for the check saying, "I'd like to settle up." NOTHING. So I said it again. Bartender 1 still with his back to me remained mute. Bartender 2 saw me and said, " I don't know what you had." Why he didn't bother to ask Bartender 1 who was less than two feet from him I don't know. I said, " A Virgin Mary and a Diet Coke." Bartender 2 said, " Oh, twenty bucks!" Incredulously I replied, "What? Are you kidding?" At this point I was angry and I showed it. Bartender 2 then said, "Ok. Forget it. It's on the house."  We then walked out, NEVER TO RETURN!!!

2l0O1EI1m0yWjFo2zSt71w.review_text: Always a fun time here whether it's a work related Happy Hour (I used to work a couple blocks away) or a last minute idea to grab a drink. Always dine or drink outside since you are sitting over the bay literally. Service is always great even some of the staff look a little tough sound the edged.  Oh and they have PBR in a bottle in case you like that sort of thing.  Even if it's frigid I akward sit outside since the outdoor heaters make it nice and toasty.

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: I'm not sure why DDD would actually come to this place. I've been here a few times (mostly because of company celebrations) and never really had a great experience. The last time I was here was one (unsually and doesn't always happen in SF) warm weekday afternoon with co-workers.  We were trying to get lunch and hopefully spend an hour of warm afternoon here. The service was slow and they didn't really take the time to help us. The food took forever and none of them were great. fish tacos were bland, fish and chips were soggy. hmmm..  I don't know about this place.

ZeiM3Uspn6CUThUBt03JSw.review_text: Its a dirty little smelly bar on the wrong side of Embarcadero ... but I do love this place. They pour a great pint of Guinness, the live music is always pumping and on a clear day the views are excellent.  It always seems to be a bit chilly here - even when it's sunny - I've left this place a couple of times with a sun burned heed so watch out for that. All in all, a great little dive bar on the bay.

eAPeZlnrKWhh2WfHKObO3A.review_text: They are located right on the pier so you have a great view of the boats sailing on the bay.  The food was good, we had fish and chips and crab salad.  I thoroughly enjoyed my salad, it hit the spot.  The crab was fresh and nicely paired with avocado and green salad.  The ambiance is very casual and comfortable.  After walking for so long it was nice to just relax under the canopy on the patio.  Prices are reasonable.

6AmDZ6_cHMMX1J00NaIHew.review_text: This place doesn't need anymore reviews but every time I'm here it's great so I feel compelled.  This place is quintessential SanFrancisco - a little gritty, varied socio-economic levels of patrons, filled with the sites & sounds of the bay, and gorgeous on a sunny day.

Mjy0RhsZg_OlWaYBPLiffw.review_text: My Shrimp/crab Louis salad was strange. The salad section wasn't really salad, it was more like shredded lettuce. The crab and shrimp were plentiful.  One avocado and a sliced egg. Like I said, strange. My sons shrimp and crab sandwich was a hot dog bun with the seafood in it, fries on the side. All tasted very good but the presentation was off

nLnv4bjU1VhkJkqSA5KZ2A.review_text: Came here on a busy Sunday afternoon for Fleet Week. Walked in through the bar, came back out and stood at the bar, waiting for ~15 minutes. One of the bartenders looked my way, then turned around to serve customers who came in after me, then took my order. I asked for Asti champagne and got in return "a glass of champagne." I get it, busy and plenty of business, okay experience.

om5ZiponkpRqUNa3pVPiRg.review_text: I kicked off a fun night on the town with happy hour on the back patio of this bar.  I took in the lovely SF view while enjoying a glass (ok, a few glasses) of the Oyster Bay Sauvignon Blanc.  I ordered a bunch of apps (nachos, quesadillas, wings, etc) for my drinking partners in crime. I passed on the food since I was saving myself for sushi later in the evening, but everyone seemed to enjoy it.   Highly recommend for a reasonably priced happy hr and seems to be an especially good spot for out-of-towners.

xT15DPvgtyU799LLXpKzIQ.review_text: Surprisingly great bar given the location, I don't know why tourists don't stumble in here, but I guess that is what make this a surprise.  Food is OK - passable, but the drinks and staff are solid. Great place to get a heat on in the afternoon and hang out by the water.

xTtKnaM816VqtRxhc_cBFg.review_text: This place was really cool. I could sit on their patio all day. Best ocean view for sure. I ordered their fish and chips and they were beyond amazing. Very thin batter and thick juicy fish. I just wish the portion could have been bigger for the price.

VnW8vdiY9vZ_HHiVA61g6g.review_text: Nice place.   Stopped by for a Saturday lunch. The receptionist said that the waiting time will be 20 mins but we could get a table just in 5 mins. Good.   FOOD 1) Mussels and Crams -Yummy! Nice tender steamed mussels crams and good balance of broth of crams, saltiness, garlics and peppers. I do not think they need lemon flavor (It had a bit strong lemon flavor...). I could take it though... 2) Fish and Chips -I always love fish and chips anywhere ;-) This one was -Crispy tasty chips and crispy and light fish. Yummy.
