DECOR/ATMOSPHERE Beautiful SF ocean view.  With nice weather, this place would be the nice afternoon brunch spot.   PRICE  Beer: $6, Mussels&Crams: $13, Fish&Chips: $13  Moderate pricing I think, for the location , view... and taste. It might not be cheap good eat but decent one.  I would come back here for nice sunny day again.

nbfyMmgqnxXIp7EDqTmkqw.review_text: The wait can get really long at lunch and dinner, especially on the weekends. When it's warm out, the patio and beer garden are great spots... but it can be really cold when the weather gets San Francisco-y.  Also, watch out for dive bombing pidgeons. No joke, at least 2 knocked me in the head and a few went after the food on my surrounding diners' tables. The service was slow and didn't go above and beyond taking my order and bringing me my food. Never came to check on us. Since I learned that wait staff in SF makes SF minimum wage ($10) because CA doesn't have a tip credit plus their tips, I have gotten very critical about the service I receive there. No more automatic 15% and 20-25% for good service, 20% will be reserved for great service. The clam chowder was okay but the piece of toasted sourdough they gave me was very thin and the soup was cold. The bacon wrapped oysters were fried (didn't say they were fried on the menu) but we're pretty good. They came with a yummy apple and watercress salad. Skip the field greens salad with champagne vinaigrette. For $7 it was way too small and lacking dressing. The mussels/ clams were extremely good and came with 4 pieces of sourdough as well as one that was already in the broth. It was a huge serving (as it should be for $17) and really great.

k-SLkmBi0OwwQ0oS1NS4lA.review_text: 1:00 pm on a Tuesday. Stopped in here for a beer after an interview in the financial district.   It's September, and the weather is gorgeous. Get to enjoy it on a nice, large patio that has both dining and bar seating. The patio extends over the water. East bay mountains provide a pretty backdrop, though foreground is industrial and bland.   Beer selection is poor, especially by SF standards. However, they have Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA on tap, which is a solid option. $6 a pint. A bit expensive, but I figure an extra dollar for the view.   Free wifi. Not touristy. Comfortable seating and service.   All in all, it's exactly what I was looking for. Got a decent beer, got a nice patio on the waterfront, and got wifi to send an email.  If you are looking for a similar experience, you won't be disappointed.

pc7m4UhzWKxpjV7yhMXGig.review_text: I will safely say their crab cakes are the best I have ever had. The salad and sandwiches are so fresh and yummy ( seafood). And of course their steamed mussels and clams was super tasty and huge! Split it between two people and were way full

q3x249UGWYz0x6FsYg9Zmw.review_text: We didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food but it looked and smelled good... And the menu sounded delicious.  However, nice little joint with deck and beer garden.  On a nice day it is a wonderful place to sit and enjoy some drinks.  Laid back feel and pleasant staff.    Average prices for drinks... Happy hour doesn't start til 8, though!

cDcy6a1MeUXvhLA3vcOrzQ.review_text: Sunday afternoon, 2 p.m....Seating hostess said let me check and then "You're lucky, there's been an hour wait all day." Well, I wouldn't have waited an hour, but then I don't wait an hour to eat anywhere! It had been about five years since I'd poked my head in the door of unassuming little place with its nice patio sticking out in the bay and mostly local clientele. With the new cruise terminal going in nearby that might change, but for now it's just a great place for a casual meal or afternoon beer. The steamed mussels and clams are my favorite...generous  portions, great garlicky broth and plenty of sourdough for soaking it up. Not cheap but what the heck you're on the water in a high-traffic tourist area what more could you want?

9mamX_rVEyitnWkvLY5rzQ.review_text: Happy hour ahi tostadas between 5-7......all you need to know.

yTk2D8Y6F-724x6pESLeCA.review_text: Note: this is for a visit from August after the first America Cup races in the bay...  Location: 5 Food: 3.0 Service: 3  Location:  On a sunny day, the patio location has a great view of the bay.  I would imagine that next year during the Anerica's Cup there would be a great view.  Food:   3 STARs: Good calamari appetizer.  crunchy on the outside.  Slightly more batter than calamari.   2 STARs (rating from my son):  Three fish tacos,  has a corn salsa on top with two sauces.  OK, not great.   5 STARs: Shrimp and crab sandwich was great.  The sourdough was grilled crisp, the shrimp were so plump and not too much mayo or other seasonings.  And the green salad that came with it, filled half the plate.  Service a bit slow ... and it might not matter if you're there on a sunny day.

HkfFnxDbyRtnyBinkRlzAA.review_text: Love this place. I think I reviewed it last time I was in SF.... The outdoor seating on the pier just makes the whole thing better. It's the perfect mix of kitsch and good food. The best part is sitting outside enjoying the sun with a margarita and your favorite people!

JXAgq5D-Zcmo1YEFoZhe5A.review_text: My hubby and I were there for the Dungeness Crab!! Great seafoods and great view of the bay.

qt5et3ciz0bNtuFVA_7kKQ.review_text: Have wanted to come here since seeing them on Triple D!!! We got the catch of the day which was blackened halibut with kale, fish and chips and calamari. I was really surprised that we had to pay for bread, $2.50, considering this is S.F. Our food came quick though so it wasn't that big of a deal. The halibut was a little spicy, but so juicy and delicious. Both the calamari and fish and chips were crispy and served with a jalapeño creme that was amazing. The coleslaw with the chips was nice and sweet and creamy and crunchy. Overall a really nice meal with a great view of the bay and live music!!! We will defiantly be back soon!!!

dXJ4gdu6Yo46e-cbk0vOxg.review_text: Food was amazing, especially the corned beef hash (which I normally do not like) and the grilled fish tacos. Service was good and view is stunning. Can't wait to come back

5eKPApTwEneO3Eih-uVO4g.review_text: Great place for brunch. I had the cod/shrimp cake benedict, and therpeople in our group ordered the corned beef hash, the seafood omelet and the smoked salmon plate. They were all fabulous but I thought the smoked salmon plate, with the dill creme fraiche, was the best. We took my mom their for Mother's Day and it was perfect! Had only been there previously for happy hour, but it's also an excellent brunch spot.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: I can't remember when Pier 23 hasn't been around. When I was a young pup working for slave wages as a media planner in a nearby ad agency, me and the rest of the demotivated concubines used to come here after work for pitchers and burgers. In the intervening years, I would come back for the occasional get-together usually for reunions of some sort. But I don't think I had been back for the last decade until Jamie W. and I decided to drop by with the return of Sunday Streets on the Embarcadero.  The sun came out for us, but it was still a bit nippy. Consequently, we were seated in the patio area under a plastic tent with see-through vinyl windows in order to savor the bay views. As we watched the tankers crawl by in the distance, we both recognized the menu looked well-geared toward the ignorant tourist trade, especially among the ones who were challenged by the concept of foreign currency exchange since the prices were on the furrowed brow side.  We were both drawn to the $6 Bac, Mac & Cheese side dish and decided to share one order (see photo). Both of us liked the mac part, and the gooey cheese was certainly not a source of complaint. But the bacon bits were charred beyond being edible and severely compromised a promising serving of comfort food. Jamie had better luck with the $13.50 Fish and Chips (see photo). The fish was light and the crust lightly crisp, while the accompanying tartar sauce had a nice kick of jalapeno. The cole slaw was good without being too vinegary, while the shoestring fries were plentiful and a bit spicy with paprika.  Mine was more of a tourist-targeted concoction, the $16.50 SF Crab & Shrimp Sandwich, which came with the same shoestring potatoes (see photo). It was OK, although I have to admit the amount of shellfish slathered on the overwhelming slice of sourdough was on the paltry side compared, for example, to the likes of Woodhouse's Lobster Roll, an unfair comparison perhaps but inevitable in this case. The service was spotty with some customers definitely getting more attention and faster delivery of food than ours. Perhaps we weren't charismatic enough for the boisterous waitress in charge. Well, at least, we could enjoy the view.  FOOD - 3 stars...Fisherman's Wharf fare for the tourists and priced that way AMBIANCE - 4 stars...well, you have the view during sunny days and the bar for any other time SERVICE - 3 stars...spotty and preferential, neither of which were going our way on Sunday TOTAL - 3 stars...still middling after all these years

Ep2u8Nu9rQq1mtTEL-wBIw.review_text: My Wife and I stopped her for Lunch on our way to the Exploratorium (which I highly recommend.  After a short wait, we were seated outside (unfortunately the fence was blocking the sun which made it actually kinda cold in mid September.  My wife got a Burger which she had well done so it being dry was mostly her fault.  While I had Chicken sandwich with Avocado and bacon, it was really good, I head the Mayo based sauce because I dislike. Either way both were good but a little expensive but what can you expect.  Would go again.

CQxZpXLyYIpya_zbKcq37A.review_text: Came here on triple D suggestion but maybe ordered wrong thing I had the cioppino  and it was fair as the prawns and muscles were tasty but not much other fish Place is supposed to be known for its dungy but my waitress said they were out! I over heard other servers stating the specials and catch of the day but mine did not mention any You might be better off with sandwich type dishes as I did not get fair service and no value on meal

cGj9mwClJncW5_X572qrYA.review_text: A local recommend this spot to my group and it did not disappoint.   This cafe is nestled by the water next to the brand new cruise terminal that looked like it was wrapping up construction and is convenient to many tourist spots without feeling "tourtisty".   We only passed through the interior of the restaurant quickly, but it seemed cozy, nice and casual. The outdoor patio seating is where it's at though. The furniture is no frills, but it is a great spot for al fresco dining and a waterfront view. They also have a beer garden area if you are looking to relax with a beverage.   For my entree I had the fish tacos, which were great. It was an extra charge to add on avocado, which I did and I think that really upped their deliciousness. There was a great sauce served on the side with the tacos that I really enjoyed. My only pet peeve is that it didn't come with a side of any kind- you just got two tacos. One of my friends and I ended up getting a side of fries to share to make up for this loss ;).   Service was laid back, but not in a bad way. Overall, this was an enjoyable lunch option for my group!

rpRydckyNdrnjrP8GufYJw.review_text: Met a friend for lunch. It was a beautiful day, but view is just as good or even better all along the Embarcadero (cannot call it Herb Caen Way, sorry) where food is better and cheaper. My friend and I each ordered the Fish Tacos, everything else on the menu was way overpriced. They were like two little street tacos and were dripping liquid and served with no sides for $13 each. All the sides were $7 each so we decided to share fries thinking it would be a huge serving. It came in a little soup cup and was barely even half full. My friend also had a lemonade and I had an iced tea, apparently with no refills. Our "snack" costs us $24 per person. That's right, total with tip cost us $48. We walked back to the Ferry Building, sat down and enjoyed the view with another snack that costs us about $5 total. You do the math and then decide where you want to go for lunch. (Service was also distracted and absent. Our server seemed in a hurry, like we were keeping him from something else. Maybe he was running back and forth to the kitchen to watch the World Cup)

4XIjdvV3bz-e_NYzJRJLHg.review_text: Pier 23 is one of my fav places to go on the rare warm sunny day in SF. They have a ton of patio seating, which is hard to find in the city. Even when its colder, they have tents and heaters on the patio. You will be surprised, but the food is really good. I love the crab sandwich on sourdough, yet everytime I order it, its a little different. The fish tacos are good and the chorizo bites are the best way to start. During the America's Cup, they raised the prices, which sucked for locals, but its still worth it. I have also been at night for concerts. We saw an awesome reggae band and danced the night away.

FTK5a5keAw9OqTg8Dn0jjw.review_text: Super glad we came here! I think I might be craving the shrimp & crab sandwich now!  Also had the mac and bac and cheese - yum! My fiance had the fish & chips and was satisfied. But oh my god, the sandwich. I need another one!

feIfoUgbgwZOAdW1tujPkw.review_text: So I have been to pier 23 cafe before. And the food is pretty good. Not fantastic but the food was enjoyable. They have this great covered patio that you could use anytime of the year.   The service was TERRIBLE! Our waitress came to take out order and then disappeared. I had to ask several other people for items and then our original waitress would bring it out. It wasn't even busy!   Long story short I accidentally left my phone there and when I called them they said they didn't have it. I turned on my 'wheres my iPhone' app and it showed it was at pier 23. I went back and they still insisted that they didn't have my phone even though you could hear it pinging. After persistence and trying to find it myself they finally gave it back to me. Shady business! I will not be returning...  ***see below for the full story***  The real kicker is I accidentally left my phone at pier 23. And I got all the way to the exploritorium before I realized it was missing. I called it 6 times and texted it. No response. My password doesn't kick in until after 4 hours. I used my friends iPhone to 'find my iPhone' and it showed it at pier 23 cafe. So I called them and they said no my phone wasn't there. We went back to the cafe and turned on the Ping sound. We went up to the bar and asked if they found a phone. They brought out a white phone from the back and a woman came out and claimed it. I asked if they had found any other phones and the bartender said no. Keep in mind this entire time you can hear my lost iPhone pinging. And I told the bartender that the pinging sound was my lost iPhone. And he was extremely resistant to help us find my phone until we started to look for the phone and started to get close to the phone and he jumped out from behind the bar and started to 'look' for it. Not until I started to look through the menus does he go 'oh let me look for it' and immediately pulls out a basket from behind the host stand and there is my phone pinging away.   I have worked in a restaurant for 9 years. And when someone leaves their phone or credit card you make a reasonable effort to find the owner. They never called any of my favorite contacts (the first one was the friend I was with that night and both my parents and my home number are on my favorites) and they never answered my many phone calls to my phone. My phone was not on silent. If someone calls a phone you found, you answer it! And if it's not the owner you ask the caller who the owner is and how to reach them!   So after all this shady business I will not be returning to pier 23 cafe. And I caution people to hold onto your valuables because these are not totally honest people!

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: This place is like an abusive relationship. You know you should walk away but then it shows its good side and you give it one more chance.   The good side, in this particular relationship, rears its head on the few day a year we have sunshine. You can get a bucket of overpriced beer while purchasing mediocre overpriced food and wearing a possibly disease ridden straw hat provided to you by the restaurant all while soaking in the sun on their outdoor patio overlooking the bay, and if you are lucky you will get some music thrown into the mix for a cover price you would not have to pay elsewhere to hear the same thing.   Sounds insane but every so often, when the sun graces us with its presence, I shamefully run into the arms of Pier 23 only to remember why I waited a full year, rather than a mere sunny day occurrence, to return. One of these days I really do need to break it of once and for all.

K20pjyfLfT505__MDe5Fng.review_text: Food was good but it was such a turn off when the server pays attention more on other tables and basically left our food probably seating on the counter... as it wasn't hot nor warm anymore when it got served to us!!! I'm sure she noticed my "evil stare"...  Everybody else got their food first... esp the table beside us whom this server (she) been talking to A LOT. Ok, we get the hint... it was nice that you clicked but really to totally ignore us?! Other tables even got their bread first... c'mon that just bread... n u can't even get that to us fast enough... what r we invisible?! really?!  Booooooo... seriously not cool =\

XqNBH2S4iv_3czHE4io1VA.review_text: Eggs 23 its the greatest breakfast ever made!   No kidding.   It's like eggs benedict on steroids.     Eat here!  And love it!

lDE38xrn2owM2u8HMJgCWg.review_text: SERVICE: Service was great. As soon as my daughter and I got there, we got seated right away. We got seated outside and the sun was too hot for my daughter so they gave us hats. In the end, my daughter was still too uncomfortable under the sun so I asked to be moved inside. The server was very nice and got us new seats really quick.  FOOD: Clam Chowder (cup) - a little too salty for me, but the bread was really good when dipped in it.  SF Crab & Shrimp Sandwich - came with garlic fries and salad. The best thing about this entree is the garlic fries. Really crunchy and just perfect for me. The salad wasn't that great and the sandwich is nothing special. A lot of crab and shrimp but the taste was very bland.  Hotdog + Fries (from Kid's Menu) - hotdog is like any other hotdog. The fries was good, but not as good as the garlic fries.

clJyCT0xPM3F2hBCsNnRVg.review_text: We went there after finishing a work conference!  Nothing like a few great beers, oysters on the half shell, roasted crab.  The food was incredible!!!

S9pIh2ti7qLIEzEfWnMUhw.review_text: At 9:30, people were still coming in for dinner.  I think this is one of those places that is popular because it's just plain been around forever.  Fish & chips were not great - we didn't finish them.  Clam chowder had nice clams in it, but the chowder was too cream-tasting, no flavor development.  I would get the shrimp and crab salad again, but I don't see myself going back.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Pier 23 "does the job." It's right next to work, so when the sun is out to play, so are we. I've been to lunch and happy hour. We've sat outside, and outside under the tarp (for those windy days).   The food is pretty decent. Calamari, nachos, sandwiches, mac 'n cheese. Wish there were more places like it to choose from, but I guess that's a good thing for Pier 23!   Just remember not to drink too many cocktails when you need to get to the airport to catch a flight. You might fall asleep on the BART like I did. :)

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: Food was ok. It was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives so I had high hopes. This place had bland food, the service was sub-par, and it took way too long for our food to get to us even during a non-busy time of the day.  I say, just go to Fog City Diner across the street instead. I was not impressed with this place at all.  Oh, also, the clam chowder is too watery.

S4PEANSUpxCRQun7BarSEg.review_text: There is nothing worse than being blatantly ignored by the bartender.  After waiting for an uncomfortable amount of time we decided to take our business elsewhere.  The decision was unfortunate since Pier 23 was our destination of choice for lunch. However, we did not want to gamble with the chance that our table-service might reflect the bar-service, which would leave us with the feeling of wasted time and money.

Y7Z5zDpyEfJ-Vsg5QfrRvw.review_text: I would give this place a higher star if they didn't run out of Dungeness crab. We came to try the crab and it was 11:30AM and they said that they ran out of crabs. How do you run out if you just opened?! Any how, we tried their mussels and calms and that was good so I am reviewing that.

ncE8rHmwpjx7D-w0N1fArw.review_text: Fun place with good food and drinks.  I had fish tacos which were yummy.  Bring some quarters and check out the vending machines in the bathroom.  Great view of the water!

Dw5k44c-nkOexdaqUtcWCA.review_text: While we experienced a lovely bay view, we sat through some pretty sub-par service.  Our food was noticeably slow from the kitchen, but our waitress never came by to check on us or offer us bread.  My friend had to ASK for bread to be brought to the table.  Started off w/ the crab bisque, which had an odd texture. Frankly, a bisque should be creamy, but in their attempts to give it crab flavor, I think they blended some crab shells into the mix.  The ahi tuna appetizers were good.  The hubbies had fish and chips, which they enjoyed and my bff had the mussels and clams.  Sadly, there was an obnoxiously loud patron whose bellowing laughter was louder than a foghorn.  And the person responsible for making him laugh so LOUD was one of the waitstaff.  Geez, tone it down.  At least their server actually spoke to them, which I can't say happened at our table.  Don't need to go back.

599lvnTQ2tLYEhkIbUeL4w.review_text: I've lived here 10 years and I'm always searching for sunny, fun spots to eat and drink. I can't believe it took until last weekend for me to check out this place! It's fantastic!  Great patio. Great bartenders. I even enjoyed the food, which I was nervous about. The shrimp po' boy was awesome.   I even found parking right across the street at about 7:45 p.m. on a Friday.   Highly recommended.

sRYC92ATdXOwGv15AqlcNA.review_text: Although the fish in the fish and chips is amazing the serving portion is sooo small that it just leaves you completely unsatisfied....   I don't expect huge servings but  beware, there is not even enough fish to be considered a snack.....  Sad because the fish was really tasty, all two bites of it....  A serving that small is just insulting.

JzDPb9rFVNHsMWqaCGWjHQ.review_text: It's kind of like Applebee's on the Embarcadero.  After a night out at the Exploratorium, we needed some food and also wanted to be able to get a drink without having to walk to North Beach -- and there's not a lot of stuff in this area that fit the bill. So we headed to Pier 23 figuring it couldn't be that bad. When we first arrived, we saw there was a small jazz band up front and the whole front area is red-lit to give it kind of a French bistro vibe.  It was crowded, however, so we sat out back, at night, and the views were wonderful. Out back there's a covered area as well as an area heated by individual heaters so even at night in August in San Francisco it wasn't too chilly. So far so good!  They kind of ignored us for the first ten minutes we were there, but our waiter came up when I saw him realize no one had greeted us, apologized and got our orders. We did drinks, apps and main courses in one order. We also asked for bread and butter.  About 10 minutes later the drinks come out -- two Diet Cokes for the ladies, a dark and stormy for my friend and an old fashioned for me. Except my old fashioned was pink and appeared to have club soda on top; there was something bubbly, at least. I sent it back, to which our waiter responded "what did you order again?" and I switched to a whiskey coke, figuring that was probably easier. Spoiler alert: it was.  We also asked for bread and butter.  So we drank our drinks and hung out for a while, long enough for it to occur to us that we were getting pretty hungry and then food came out. I mean, all of the food came out. We had two apps and four main courses -- I'd ordered some fries as a side, but we didn't get those and it was probably for the best. After they dropped off all the food, we also asked for bread and butter  The firecracker taquito things looked as if they had pulled off the rotating thing at the 7-11 and tasted vaguely similar (and I actually like those as drunk food). The cream sauce on the plate congealed pretty quickly, which means we didn't finish them. The mac and cheese was fine -- overly cheesy but, hey, better than being under-cheesed.  Our main courses were perfectly fine, but not what I'd call "good". I had the fish tacos, which contained grilled fish (which was preferable to fried) but the tortillas were pretty stale tasting (or undercooked -- I'm kind of unclear). One of the lady's sandwiches had enough cilantro to build a forest out of it . The salmon with asparagus was ok.  After we finished half of our main course, we got the bread we had been asking for. It was basically a small loaf of white bread that had been baked, obviously, but was cold and dry when we got it. It also cost $1.50.  Overall, this appears to be the tourist place you stop at for the view and don't go to eat, so good for us to know. Just kind of found it out the hard way.

Ee3iS0puAl0aQWl76fGLPQ.review_text: Have walked here so many times and I must have been a blind fool.  Somehow, never noticed it.  So glad we found it today!  From the moment we walked in to the minute we left, the great service and smiles on the staff never stopped.  They are very welcoming and very friendly.  We ordered...  Heineken and Calistoga Sparkling Nachos-great Carnitas sliders-the BEST I ever had!  Will be back for this for sure! Clam Chowder Soup-pretty good (never saw that many clams in a soup)  The moment we sat down, they brought water for our pup.  This may not be a big deal for some, but for us it's very nice.  I would have given it 5 stars if the bathroom was clean.  There were no seat covers and no soap.  The energy at this place is infectious.  The lively crowd and pleasant staff make you feel good for just being there.  No one rushes you out and lets you enjoy your time.    We had a nice dinner here and watched the sunset.  Everything was great and I can't wait to be back here again soon.  They have seating in the bar area, inside the dining room and outside.  I think it's a great place for groups to come and just enjoy the weather, talk and laugh!  It's a bit loud but so much fun!

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: Fun spot. Came here once and sat outside for a couple of beers. Recently stopped in for HH. $4 well drinks and some appies. $1 oysters is what you might want to go for. A little small and tasteless but that is okay. Enjoyed a few beers in the patio after a long work day. Can't complain about that!

D4IHMxZwxZRZMvkMEeSb1A.review_text: A nice spot to pop in for a drink, I came here for the food but was told Mondays they don't serve any food....till next week! Ok.....anyhow, the service was nice, and I may come back....3 stars for now.

qJYgqKxkT8InO8-865kfiQ.review_text: Mmm, great place. Good variety of cuisine.   I was pretty blown away by the eggs benedict. What kicked it over the top was the pasilla peppers in the hollandaise. Perfect amount of acidity, spice, and richness.   They do a good job on the fry station too.   It's a small place, so it can take forever to get a table, but it really is worth waiting for.   Beer selection is pretty decent too.

355W7iKObLwu3greKAJcqQ.review_text: I used to come here every single weekend when the weather was nice in SF, and only finally made it back since moving back to SF  Luckily, not much has changed!  I now like bloody marys, so ordered quite a few of those,  and at $7 each theyre quite a fair deal (however, my friends nachos were put on my tab, so the $38 for three drinks, plus secret nachos, threw me).  Tables were all full for awhile so getting one took a bit of a wait, and our service was HORRID (we practically had to attack our waitress in order to get her to take our orders, each time), and the music was so loud you had to scream to hear each other.  Also, the line for the bathroom was a bit insane.  That said, as long as you know you're coming for a relaxed, crowded, loud and preferably drunken saturday/sunday on the water, you'll have a good time!

f2e7kL5XUGFaCBppCQl0nQ.review_text: The best fish'n'chips!! And calamari was excellent too. Can't wait to go back. New favorite spot in SF. :-)

MUIoOSt5n9F6hcnQ4aUYRQ.review_text: We have gone here about 5 times now.. The roasted crab is phenonmenal! But since it's not crab season yet we opted for a few apps..  1) Chorizo firecrackers which are chorizo wrapped in a dough and baked (or fried) not sure, but are soooo good!! 2) Fried oysters are super yummy!  3) Tuna poke is fresh and delicious 4) Ceviche also fresh and very flavorful  The outdoor seating is wonderful on a sunny day, watching the boats on the bay...  The service is always friendly ~ the bartenders seem a little stressed as they are usually very busy..SMILE guys!!  I did try the Sangre Peligroso (drink) very popular here; kinda like a margarita but different in a good way and they are not stingy with the tequila!   **I have also tried the crab sandwich: super good ~ fish tacos are killer!  Cant wait to go back!!

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: This is another one that is really tough to rate; where I deal with the frequent Yelp conundrum of balancing food vs. other.  The food is good, nothing special, but a bit over priced.  It is an amazing place to catch a show, though.  Hmmmmmm.

OL2lDQMRt3BAaV--DASpUQ.review_text: This place was cool! Enjoyed a dirty martini that wasn't so dirty and a blue moon after walking from the farmers market down the street.  SD bay is nicer ;)

8BGd5lFUvPxHaWRFO4215w.review_text: AMAZING Experience!! We came here with a party of 15 at 11:30 on a Sunday brunch and the service was Spectacular!! Not to mention we LOVED our seating. We were over to the side of the patio where there's a tall table for 8, next to a bench and a waterfront seating for 4. this was great for our group as we could stand and chat but also all sit down when food came, which was scrumptious. the bean and cheese dip with chips was to Die For. We will be back for that alone :) Wonderful place, can't wait to come in evening for music! thank you Pier 23 for making my cousins bachelorette party a success!

DNhvwSFRpn9W9vs1URy0iQ.review_text: Starts out as appearing to be just a small bar with great atmosphere. This leads to the back patio area where the dining occurs with great service and a variety of seafood and combinations of other flavors which remind me of Texas Bar B Q and even carnitas. I recommend the tuna poke tostada!!

dyUwFl7ZvEylbw3doXVL_Q.review_text: 4.5..good everything, especially the cod sliders. crispy accompanying fries. Had a gang of juicy double Moscow Mules.. yelp.com/user_local_phot… Small but tasty mussels and clams. yelp.com/user_local_phot… Crab and shrimp roll does not skimp on either of the aforementioned. yelp.com/biz_photos/pier…

AECHgP0SycEtRS02nHMgTA.review_text: I've always enjoyed the night life, especially the last Saturday of the month when Native Elements performs...  Outdoor, mixed crowd, chill, no dress code...$10 cover...reggae music....  I had my party on a night i've never attended. It was an annual DJ battle night....DON'T GO!! They raised the cover to $20 last minute and the guards were jerks! The line was down the block, you were waiting for a good 2 hours. Inside, you felt like a sardine! It was the worst experience my friends and I have ever had there!  Other than special events, I always have a good time.

dX7PxBcmH9Gogx_qRKbifQ.review_text: This place has always been great for a drink and sandwich or a meal, Great views, friendly staff, good music and vibe. and they have the BEST sliders in the world, try the Carnitas slider. It is without question the best carnitas I have had anywhere and that includes a lot of places. The secret according to the chef is in the "secret" ingredient that he uses for baking the carnitas! (Hint: it's a flavored beverage with their world headquarters in Atlanta!)

NRrNQ5xHn_7Fu4ctlpKLbQ.review_text: I highly recommend the Pier 23 Eggs Benedict. This thing is full of flavor. I'll be back on a regular basis just for this and the Huevos Ranchos is rather tasty as well.  I came here for the first time on a Saturday morning with some out of town friends for breakfast. I had the Eggs 23 (potato patties, avocado, Swiss, poached eggs & sun dried tomato hollandaise and bacon). Also because breakfast isn't complete without a beer I had an Anchor Steam. I've been back a few times since and it's always great.  I give the amazing flavors of the Eggs 23 five stars, the ample friendly service four and a half and the character four stars. Come on a Sunday morning and get a nice table under the sun. Its almost always warm because they do have gas lamps.  DO NOT come here if: You don't like to eat sittin on the dock of the bay or if it's a rainy day.  DO come here if: You like unique flavor filled breakfast with great service and an awesome location sitting over the bay with a great view on The Embarcadero.

wnsMrmexToW49eN_reGDrw.review_text: This is a definite go to place strictly for drinks with a bayside view and party-like happy hour setting.  Food: 1/5 stars  Don't expect seafood just because your by the water. Everything is frozen & then fried.  Service: 3/5 stars  Even on a nice busy day they still seem to do a good job with over staffing and tentative service.  Atmosphere: 2/5 stars  The inside bar area smells, & bathrooms look like they need a good pressure washing with bleach. The outside patio area is probably the only reason why people love this place.   Overall Pier 23 is fun on a sunny SF afternoon or a happy hour meet-up. Expect cool down-to-earth peps and more often than not, some sexy biker boys.  I also hear they play reggae on weeknights or have live bands.

OZJBGWwy9WM9oCbuWyya9A.review_text: We had a Mai tai and a beer, calamari, fish tacos and the seared tuna sandwich...all amazing! I hate cilantro and didn't know the tuna came with it and they made me a new one no problem. Great service and lots of outdoor seating!

tkydrFVoh5h_E3ZHVz74qw.review_text: My sister and brother-in-law were in town and we were having drinks in the area.  With a little help from Yelp, my brother-in-law mentioned trying out Pier 23.  The moment I walked through the doors I was sold.  When I went it was late on a Saturday night and was not crowded.  Had a few Big Daddy IPA from Speakeasy brewery and was content for the night.  The bartenders were all cool, laid back guys.  The atmosphere was chill, relaxed, dive bar style which I love.  Later in our evening, there was some live reggae to enjoy.  The location is great and if you venture out back you can sit right by the water with an outdoor heater overhead.    I really can't give a great rating on the food.  I had a cold piece of a friend's quesadilla and it was all right.  I bet Pier 23 would be nice for brunch or lunch on a sunny day.    Either way I enjoyed my evening there and plan to return if I am in the area.

o-4Cp2Ji47H_wmbU1K9LNw.review_text: Saw this place on the food network.. so when I planned my SF trip this place was top on my list for places to visit. Food was Very Good.. not amazing, customer service wasn't great at all.. it takes them awhile to acknowledge you.. 10mins later they finally seat you.. took forever to take our order... I wouldn't go back

vLg4MRDT3k5WgHsaDrRtaw.review_text: I've been here a few times now. Usually it was pretty busy and we had a couple drinks then moved on but the other night I wandered in on a weeknight with a friend and we started drinking.   They have a decent enough selection of beer that I'm not going to get stuck drinking something awful but it was lacking a real standout. We browsed the menu and my friend got some clam chowder but I wasn't craving anything they had. I think the menu is probably priced per the location versus what you actually get.   However, I had a great time just drinking and hanging out. There was a ragtime bad playing, which was kinda random, and we sat and people watched out the front windows for awhile then moved to the deck out back. It was wet out so part of the deck was covered but there are still a couple tables at the edge outside. Even in the dark the deck still has a good view of the bay. It's worth return trips just for the novelty of the location and how recognizable the place is. Even people that just vacation in SF have probably been in or at least remember seeing it.

zQztjlg4WUXHTQH-z_ga4w.review_text: Meh. Went for brunch (we had reservations) and were seated right away. It took a really long time before our waitress came to take our drink order. The food was pretty pedestrian and our waitress seemed to not care about us in any fashion. It wasn't that busy and we rarely ever saw her. The bacon fried oysters and the view were great, but that was about it. Also, if you have a small child, they do not have anywhere to change a diaper.

_Sa4_viiZZyOrLiD9FnI8g.review_text: Whole lotta Crab going on. Our whole family ordered the crab dinner. Better be really hungry if you plan on eating the whole thing becaseu they give youy these really huge crabs.  Loved the garlic and butter, but maybe a little too much butter. If you go, you got to try it, however, order one and split between a group and then order some of the other items that are really good such as the grilled fish tacos. We stopped by in the evening, but this place really shines on a nice sunny day looking out on the bay.

8p-kv82J5uP3583thTPa4Q.review_text: The bottom line: Cafe/Bar/Outdoor Patio, great on sunny days. Live Music food and drinks are regular price.  I've gone here on 2 occasions, 1 a great sunny day, the other a deceivingly sunny day that turned into a freezer.   The first day was perfect, service was great The second day was cold, service was slow, all the waiters and waitresses were busy doing something else, possibly the NCAA sweet 16, anyhow, you figure u could give some level of service.   Beer is somewhat standards, food is American, standard pretty decent. I enjoyed the chipotle wings and mini sliders.   This is really a nice day kinda spot more than anything else, you're not coming for the food.  I would've given them 4 stars, but the service last time blew.

hhabD3IvEUIJkh7kFa2gbg.review_text: Came in late on a sunny Saturday afternoon. It was busy but there were a couple tables open, and we were able to seat ourselves.  Grilled artichoke with hummus and harissa aioli was Excellent!  Butter lettuce salad with papaya, oranges and meyer lemon vinaigrette was large and fresh/clean tasting.  Local crab/shrimp sandwich was tasty, and generous. The fries that came with it were thin and yummy too.  Service was good at first, but then it took our waitress quite a while to get us a box and our check.

T7c3DowkmlT7Tx_5WSxzKQ.review_text: Stopped here after a day of shopping at the farmers market. I made a reservation that morning because I heard the place was always packed. We were seated right away; our table was partially in the sun so they told us we could wait for the next shaded table, but it was a gorgeous day in SF and I opted to soak in the rays! I had the grilled fish tacos; there was some kind of spiced corn on them which I really liked. Our waitress was fast and food was delivered quickly. We will definetly be back to try the crab. The atmosphere, the service, the location, and the food, all deserve two thumbs  up!

6O_xe3phaFTiiFiXZ11FpQ.review_text: Great atmosphere.... perfect for drinks or a bite right on the water. Patio was great. $15 min for CC tabs. Has a beer garden as well.  Tasty fresh food and yummy drinks. Definitely worth a visit!!

JkxoyxHkykz4g-m9Fe4nIg.review_text: Good food. Good atmosphere. But $20 for a bacon cheeseburger and an ice tea? Not again.

6OUJPv9Dy-LUwStKDtEikA.review_text: Walked in and was seated.  I ordered a beer and a few cocktails to start. We then ordered our meals and 20 minutes later it was all served with the exception if 1 dish.  I asked my waitress about the order and it just so happened that they had forgotten about it.   10 minutes later they bring the wrong dish. After explaining so my waitress apologizes and tells me to wait a bit. I wait 15-20 ( while the rest of the party has completed their meals) the last dish arrives.   This time the proper order. Lol. Guess what?   The ribs I ordered were cold.  The spinach underneath the ribs were cold.  The potatoes underneath the spinach,  too hard to consume and the ribs itself were cold.  My waitress refuses to come by and ask about the service at any time and worse,  she refuses to even look my way at any point until I have to raise my voice to get her attention. A blonde-haired male waiter was helpful and assisted me with the visit,  got the manager, and manager tries to assist the experience. A slightly reduced bill and an apology was given.  The waiter was the only one who gave a f.......I tossed him $20 and the nightmare of an experience was over.

ZWU_4fCAnkhQ_O5ZtU5oPA.review_text: I'm usually loathe to say I don't like somewhere, unless the food or service doesn't cut the mustard. And I wanted to like this place because our friends really liked it - in fact, they donated a gift card they couldn't use. It wasn't worth our trip, though. Granted we didn't go all for seafood, which I think they are better known for, but still it could've been a lot better. I got the chicken fried ribeye (okay, pretty salty - worth $20? Umm, no way), my husband the scallop ceviche (light on the scallop, heavy on the sweetcorn, though tasty), then he tried the cheese plate (large portion of cheese, lots of garlic, weirdly, and four small crostini - would've been easy to improve this with better portions and presentation) and I had the strawberry chocolate cake cup (weird tasteless blancmange and chocolate cake - my own fault for ordering this without asking what on earth it was). The white wine my husband ordered was warm and tiny, our waters were never refilled and the service was pretty slow. But, it was a sunny day and we sat on the deck and that made for a nice afternoon at least!

7YandgFIQeIQP1IjmNFalA.review_text: I Love this place!!! Come here when it's sunny and get a table outside. The view is great and the service is always good. My girlfriend and I always order the sangre peligroso, which is delicious. Their ahi sandwich and the crab/shrimp sandwiches are great too. Will definitely be back soon.

gD9a4wXND51R3c9lpbf_Lg.review_text: I was torn between a four and five star rating and I went with the five star because I always leave this place with a smile on my face.  It's not a fancy place by any stretch of the imagination, but that is some of what adds to the charm in my view.  I love sitting out on their deck and it's great that they allow you to bring your dog with you, which is another reason I went with the five star review.  I've been here a few times and the food is good, the service is friendly, and the scenery is wonderful.  Fortunately, I've been out on the patio only on sunny days and have even had to borrow one of their loaner hats at least once.  I could see it getting cold out on their patio if the weather isn't great, but they have a section of the patio that's enclosed in clear plastic covers.  I've had the burgers which are tasty and juicy.  I just had the chicken nachos and they were large enough to share and were very good.  I enjoy taking people from out of town here and everyone I've taken has enjoyed it.  The only downside I can think of is it is a little expensive, but certainly not unreasonable, especially considering it's location.

reQcVFgEEFdFmFrFycMHXw.review_text: dont come here for the food...or the service....or a quick meal....that's not the point  come on a afternoon when you can sit with a bunch of yoru friends for hours drinking beer and soaking in the september sun.  when you do that, it doesn't matter that food is good/not great and that you may have to wait a while...

lfIOJ5tY1Qzdvq9O2VAJgQ.review_text: Love this place! The staff is great, friendly and knowledgeable. It's got a great little dive bar feel in the front and a nice patio dining area out back over looking the water. Food is excellent with large portions.  The crab and shrimp sandwich has not filler just fresh sweet crab and shrimp on lightly buttered grilled sourdough it's huge and comes with well seasoned fries. The chowder is a little thinner than I prefer but it makes up for it in taste, butter and cream heaven with juicy clams. Great place for a summer lunch or evening cocktails, trying brunch next time.

uqwtgePrSvPksLinexZm-w.review_text: This place  is amazing on a nice day in the city. It has majority outdoor seating on their back patio. It has a beautiful view of the water and is the perfect place to come and have drinks on the weekend. The food itself isn't the most amazing but for day drinking you don't get much better. They do have great wings though, I am not a wing eater at all but for these I make an exception. Their calamari is hit or miss, some days it is really really good and others its more on the rubbery side. The nachos are delicious though loaded with cheese.   Even on a windy day its not to bad because they have heaters on their patio. Their service has its ups and downs as well. We had Kimmy our previous visit who was probably one of the best servers I have had in the state of CA. On a sunny day it is a must. The only complaint I do have is the hostess was kind of a b*atch. She was really rude and actually told us that if she sat our table before our entire party arrived that we would have to order drinks and food as we were waiting...excuse me??? After a drink or two though its easy to forget about her.

kvV9jMRGRvan0mplIvPDOA.review_text: Great appetizers  . Could be a tad bigger.When the band started it got a wee bit cramped. but there was room in the back if you wanted to sit and it. Fantastic cocktails the bar tenders were on it and mixed them well.

VqL9Qx4hCDbim1UyMMg87g.review_text: I brought out-of-town relatives here on a beautiful, sunny, WARM day here in SF; I called ahead to make sure there was a table that would accommodate 9 people under the tent in the back, rather than directly under the sun, and the table was ready for us when we arrived.  We were greeted promptly and cheerfully. There was a lovely view of the Bay. It was great to see relatives that I hadn't seen in 7 years.  Now the food.  We ordered calamari pasta carbonara, shrimp and crab sandwiches, a kid's burger, and salmon. I ordered a side-salad with my shrimp & crab sandwich, to justify the additional side order of mac & cheese with bacon.  Although my relatives appreciated being taken out, I was not impressed at ALL by the food. Calamari pasta carbonara looked mediocre, and the shrimp/crab sandwiches were greasy. I can't comment on the salmon or burger, as they were served pretty far down on the other side of the table. My side-salad greens looked and tasted like a soggy mass ready for the compost pile; I hoped that this was just appearance, and that I would be pleasantly surprised. I wasn't.  The mac & cheese with bacon sounded VERY appetizing; the congealed mass with 2 strips of bacon carelessly thrown on top that appeared before me was not. How do you go wrong with mac & cheese? And with BACON, no less?! It wasn't seasoned very well, so that you had all of the richness of the cheese, with absolutely no hint of salt. I didn't get that gooey goodness of melted cheese, or a cheesy sauce, much like the amazing mac & cheese you get at the Fog City Diner...I got clumps. Tasteless clumps. Clumps with 2 strips of incinerated bacon thrown on top. Bleh.  When asked if we were interested in dessert, the reply was a quick "No!"  How did Guy Fieri get this place so WRONG? I'm saddened that THIS was what I brought my relatives to; I love my relatives, enjoyed their company, and wanted to share an amazing experience with them. The absence of anything good to say about this place spoke VOLUMES.  I have absolutely no desire to bring anyone else here. Unless I don't like them.

7ieIfRMjAbAvgbslpwRQOw.review_text: One gorgeous weekend, I suggested to have a day in the city to go on a foodieventure.  I was watching Triple D. aka Diners, Drive-Ins, & Dives, one afternoon and Guy went to Pier 23 to try out 'some of their killer meals'.  =) Tim had been there a couple of times since he used to work right across the street, so he was definitely game.  We parked next to the Ferry Building and I didn't realize how far of a walk it was!  Good thing we got all that exercise because we needed it after lunch AND dessert! It looks like an old shack...desolate... Once you walk in, there's not much action going on inside, but walk to the back and it's crowded!  It's first come, first serve and whatever table you find is yours.  Some people are really sneaky and will try to swoop up on a table even though you've been standing there waiting patiently for something to open up...tsk tsk! Both Tim and our server said the Mac & Cheese was really good.  I figured anything with bacon MUST be good, right?  Well.. I thought the bechamel overpowered what was supposed to be the cheese part of this dish.  I couldn't taste the saltiness of the cheese nor the bacon!!  The noodles were soft, but it's still a mediocre dish in my opinion. - - Recap:  Pier 23 in San Francisco, California.  It's probably one of the best places to have lunch, drink a few beers, and enjoy the SF bay.  That is if you're going on a nice sunny day, otherwise it's not the most ideal place to have lunch outdoors.  The food wasn't up to par and I left completely unsatisfied.  I love crabs, but there's something about the one I had at Pier 23 that didn't suffice.  Maybe it was because I didn't have rice and vinegar or maybe because I had to crack the shell myself when normally my dad does it for me.  Yes I know, I'm 26 and my dad cracks the shell of a crab, removes the exoskeleton of shrimp, and shucks the oysters for me.  No, I'm not spoiled.  I'm just lazy to do all of that... =) Full review: tumblr.com/xhbphsunf

yywdA_6KBgcqbO0I8c9EOg.review_text: So we had lunch here today, during fleet week. It was busy but that was expected (we only had a 20 minute wait for 4 people). We enjoyed some beers and the views from the beer garden while we waited. The food was ok, but not my favorite. The service was good. Not sure it was quite worth the $100 bill...  Would return for the beer garden and view only...

M10TyM4muucT7RQNsx1KqA.review_text: The only thing this place has going for it is the location and, from what I could tell, a fairly friendly staff.  Other than that, the drinks are expensive for what you get (two margaritas with *maybe* one ounce of tequila between them for $8.25 each) and the food is stupid expensive for what it is - namely, greasy bar grub.  Also, the vinyl like tablecloths on the outside patio are gross.  Seriously.  Pass, pass, pass.

EbxSviAUE8OcNxxJ0xsCIw.review_text: A friend mentioned they saw this place on Food Network's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives with Guy Fieri. On that episode, Pier 23 was featuring fresh Dungeness crab as well as a bacon wrapped oysters. When we arrived, we were excited that they have a open patio to dine out on a warm sunny day. They have good local CA beers on tap and the famous Dungeness crab on the menu. But wait... Bacon wrapped oysters? No where to be found on the menu. We promptly ask the wait staff about the missing item and their quick response was that it was taken off the menu. Why? They have new cooks since the show aired... 3 years ago! My friend still ordered the Dungeness crab and I hesitantly ordered the catch of the day which happened to be pacific perch. Moments when our food arrived we dug in. First thought... Bland. Probably the most unseasoned seafood I've ever had. Not just the perch but the Dungeness crab as well. For paying an easy Yelp $$, I would expect more. I've had better seafood in the Midwest. Clearly this place is still riding on the tails of their fame. We were better off going to Fisherman's Wharf and eating at the touristy Boudin Bakery. We would of paid less too for better food!  Food - 1 Décor - 5 Service - 5

LFybD5yz8eCWhlrfl-PcBA.review_text: We went there because we saw it on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  However, the chef that was on the show no longer works there.  The food was just average.  The service was lousy.  The view is not worth the prices.  I would suggest going somewhere else.

InCaK_Vyfd3x8XYVNf3tsQ.review_text: I would have given this place 4 stars if it hadn't been for the rude bartenders. Went here for lunch yesterday. I have to say the hour wait wouldn't have been a problem if the bartenders would have been doing their jobs correctly. We waited 20 minutes to order our two bloody Mary's. When we finally got to order I asked for the drinks one with no horse radish and let me tell you not only did the bartender ignore me but he made no eye contact; didn't even acknowledge me and made the drinks both with the horse radish. I then told the guy I asked for no horse radish and he needed to remake the drink. He remade the drink but still no contact. Then when we tried them they were awful! I was not happy!   On to the next part of our experience which was much better. Our waitress was nice and quick. We ordered the mussels and clams which I have to say are the best I've ever had! I also ordered the fish tacos which were delicious! My fiancé ordered the fish and chips which were ok. The fries were the highlight of the dish.   I would eat here again, but the management needs to do some serious revising with the bar area and the people working in it.

SsIJGTJkA3N5HQ9zCN6bgA.review_text: My friends and I stumbled across Pier 23 during our visit in San Francisco. We were so exhausted from a long day of sight seeing, and were thankful to get a seat right away.   We loved the atmosphere. The restaurant was of course right on the pier (hence the name) and the view was fantastic. Aside from that there was an awesome gypsy jazz band playing some great tunes.   The place was pretty busy, yet the servers were laid back and made us feel right at home.  We took a seat and ordered a million things off the menu. Everything was fantastic, especially the prawns and mussels.   If you want a great place to chill out in San Francisco check this place out!!!

QwMbQmeywX9cAb60T9TG5w.review_text: Cute little dive bar with a great back patio.  Unfortunatly we couldn't sit outside and enjoy the sun because there was no more tables.  So instead we sat inside by the bar and watched the horse race.  Fun place to stop and have a beer.  We tried the shrimp quesadilla and it was good.  Fresh and not greesey at all.  We'll hit this place up again on on our next trip into the city for sure.

NIX1_YlMYhIKJg2d9y_qzA.review_text: Great location, good service.  Food was definitely better than expected from an embarcadero spot. Would definitely return.

CIrXOIf6JKrsPRBH6R440A.review_text: So i saw this on DDD's on the food network and thought to go ahead and give it a try on our trip to San Francisco. We ordered the fried calamari, fish tacos( Diners Drive-ins and Dives recommendation) and the crab & shrimp sandwich.  We  sat outside on a windy cold day due to the lack of indoor seating they had. Sitting inside the plastic tent they had did not help much plus it had an odor maybe because of the wet plastic.  Overall, the food was okay and Service was pretty bad. It took a while for us to get noticed and served. Maybe they shouldnt have a sign that says to Seat Yourself. I would probably order the calamari again. the Fish tacos were good, but the side of beans and rice shouldnt be on the plate! the rice was dry and the beans were nothing special. The shrimp & crab sandiwch was PLAIN! I wouldnt go back or recommend it.

IdzlWHLd4fH6OKCS4M4eUg.review_text: I was a little disappointed due to the hype of this restaurant from the show Diners, Drive ins and DIves.  We had a couple of appetizers, the calamari, which was soggy, fish tacos, which were good, mussels, definitely fresh, but no flavor.  The Mojitos were very very good though!  I didn't try the Dungeness crab or the duck special which i may go back only because the food was not terrible, but just not what i expected.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: " It's the bar with the three B's: beers, boats, and buds. Doesn't that sound great?" "Are you having a stroke?"

q-9XDKIndn9dUDhDnXlonA.review_text: Location, Location, Location...perfect location to grab a bite while attending America's Cup, strolling down the Embarcadero or shopping at the Ferry building.  Live band, vibrant bar scene and great outdoor setting filled with Kiwis celebrating their  huge AC lead.   GOOD:  crab sandwich, chowder, coleslaw, salads & fries.  NOT so GOOD: the fish of the fish & chips and service.  Our server never delivered our entire order,  she never remembered & we never reminded her...hmmm!  We even ordered an additional item from the food delivery  person and that never arrived either!?!  Overall FUN place to go, service is POOR with a smile & we waited 30 minutes at a very busy dinner hour.

tlY0QMQDyfjQAEwHnzvFnw.review_text: A decent divey spot for drinks by the bay.  The crowd is a mix of different types, which is cool.  The food is hit-or-miss and pricey for what you get.  When it's crowded you have to be aggressive and assertive if you want table service - there can be a ton of people and not enough staff to help out everyone.

hoTqqjK8H3ItmCGDR0a4tA.review_text: Not as great as I'd remembered it but still a fun place to sit out on the bay. Clam chowder was delicious but the rest of the dishes were only passable. Solid drinks and a good wine list keep this place on the list, though. Let's hope the kitchen returns to form.

HJBDaJuqP_QHZeTDQI4lUA.review_text: Pier 23 is the spot! The fish tacos are good, the ceviche is even better. My bloody mary was delicious (made by Hugo). They also have some good beers on draft. The outside patio is awesome, really spacious. You can't tell how big it is when you see the front of the place. They also have live music here frequently. Love it.

sR_Em3nPzGY37MWjKei-Jw.review_text: They have outdoor tables and it's by the bay. That's the only good things about this place.  Drinks are not incredible and the food is overpriced.  Don't expect too much.

5rGn5Yu95WFg_9GY9VkOvg.review_text: Gorgeous view of the bay on a clear day. It's perfect for lunch outside when the weather cooperates. The fish and chips I had for lunch were good - crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and served with some tasty, tasty shoestrings. Mostly, just go for the view.

kGPnTVzWz_1MNTUudFKT4A.review_text: This is a review for the bar only, I didn't try the restaurant nor did I see it. We ordered 2 anchor steam drafts and 2 Don Julio tequilla shots (very tiny shots btw and hardly "top shelf")....$38.00 bucks before tip. It's not like we were at the Four Seasons, it was a total dive bar atmosphere! Bye...won't be back.

_em5gWgPCrB0bOMKeVWJSQ.review_text: This was one of the worst food experiences I've had in San Fran. Poor food, what we ordered they did not have. What we did get was mediocre. My friend got the clams and muscles and all that was there was shell. We will not return to Fishman's wharf for our dining needs!!

1dW1kLdcKuQprnhi4pC_iQ.review_text: The best day-bar hang out around!  This is a totally chill spot with all kinds of people rolling through.  Great Food, Very friendly staff (Hugo, Alex, Lisa & Co) Another great family owned business in SF. The live music is a huge draw for them, Hands down I will go out of my way to support a venue like this. Until we meet again P23, Thank you

Oc8xJNlMiOJnI9LOSHsSGg.review_text: I have always been curious about this place, so finally, my girlfriend, her brother and I tried this place. The location is by the water, which is beautiful!   There is an outside area that looks out to the water, but we could not sit there because of a party that day. The place seemed classy because there was also a pianist.  The food was just alright. We got the crab cakes, and they were not that good as the ones I've had. We also had clam chowder, and Boudin's is still the best.   The place was just ordinary and did not impress me as much.

qj1SScDQGTm00VDab1BQnQ.review_text: Excellent cioppino, great waterside seating, nice casual atmosphere. Our server as great and the food was very good (I'd give it 4.5/5 if that was a thing).

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: Oh, Pier 23...Back in the day (last time: last month), this place was (continues to be) my post-Endup Endup on Sunny days. Nothing beats a night of underground parties followed by a morning at the Endup followed by nonstop drinking on the sunny and less frenetic patio over at Pier 23. If you've made it that far alive, you'll be so out of it you won't notice the d-bags and their douchettes, the marina-ites, and crusty drunks. You will notice, however, slightly weak cocktails, overpriced food (who says you'll be able to eat?), and a view that that makes the whole big mess worth it.   On the other hand, if you're of the civilized persuasion (and yes, I CAN BE), this is a great place to start a Sex and The City style girls night out (Pier 23 is like the SF version of Staten Island) in order to enjoy the warm night's air, get some popped-collar to buy you a couple of those overpriced cocktails, and get your dancing queen on to live music. Just get there before 9. After that, there's an overpriced cover charge, too.

TeBkVYLv_tN0uFyudi-QAQ.review_text: Went with a group from work a few weeks ago.  The service was attentive, and the food was generally* pretty good.  It was great place to go with a group - we had a fun lunch.  *The calamari was cooked pretty poorly.  The burger was good.

6qruLSYk27BrOzDsIHlMHQ.review_text: I went here on the advice of my younger sister.  I made reservations as it was on the same day as a Giants game.  Being that it was my first time, I couldn't find the place right away and gave them a call.  They were very nice and said they would have a table available whenever we arrive - so nice! My friend had the chowder ($4/cup, $7/bowl) and she very much enjoyed it.  She asked for some bread (to accompany her soup) and was surprised we were charged for an order of bread on our bill.  No big deal, but writing for review purposes here. I "appetized" on the Tuna Poke Tostada (3 for $11).  I think they were ~3" rounds, a not too spicy tuna poke that appeared to spread on the tostada like a nice thick cream cheesy way, topped with a cilantro and shitake slaw that I thought had a nice flavor.  I really enjoyed the taste of the pieces of shitake mushrooms in the slaw, yumm! We shared an order of fried calamari ($11) served with both a tartar-like sauce as well as a cocktail sauce.  Slices of spicy jalapeno goodness and wonderful shavings of lime was found throughout, making a nice touch.  Unfortunately, I found the calamari to be a little dark on the fry, as well as a bit greasy. We shared the local crab and shrimp sandwich ($16.50) which also came with seasoned fries and a nice salad mix.  Boudin sourdough slices made up this sandwich and I have to say I would rather call the sandwich a "Bay shrimp and a little bit of local dungeness crab sandwich".  The sandwich was very good and had plenty of filling, but as mentioned, it was much more shrimp than crab. That was kind of a let down.  However, plenty of fries and I'm sad I didn't dig into the salad.  There was just too much food. Our server was very nice-top notch.  My friend was a bit indecisive throughout and we kept apologizing, and he kept checking on us all the while with a pleasant smile.  I'd go back in a heartbeat knowing how nice they were, didn't get sick, and I heard the Slow Cooked Babyback Ribs ($12) are to die for.  I can tell you they looked hella awesome, but will write a follow up if I get back to try them. Oh! Since I was driving, I didn't order an alcoholic beverage but I almost ordered a glass of their house made lemonade ($3.50). When I read "Small Batch Root Beer" ($4), I had to try it.  Ok, don't.  The root beer was a bottle of Henry Weinhard's.  I like Henry Weinhard's root beer, but I could buy a 6-pack at Safeway.  And if they offer that, why don't they just put that on their menu???

WKXQLBESJ10kn0kCczuBpA.review_text: It's new years and I can understand the service is not going to be great, but 40 minutes between we sat at the table and te tiñe the server took our order, then the soup was cold, I don't know how creative the cook can be to place a warm (not hot) pork ribs on top of a cold potato salad? Just plain stupid. Not a place I would reconend.

dXdXagdSU6od-w6TjBFKbg.review_text: Stopped here for lunch. On the small side but the view of the Pier is great. We ordered the sliders, Cesar with prawns, and the pork lettuce wraps. All were good, nothing incredible. I do appreciate the housemade pickles that came with the burger. Watch out for pigeons though, though I was going to get attacked.

gCx3IfBPhN10I3C7R73PMw.review_text: VERY disappointing.  Met an associate here for lunch, based on other Yelp reviews.  Took forever to get waited on, and then forever for our food, which was marginal.  High prices, small portions, taste: just "ok".  Too bad, because the location is awesome.  Not recommended for business lunches.  But if you have nothing but time on your hands, go for it.  (Oh, and the beer was not cold enough)

5o80NhNXzPwb4EcWAdjiqw.review_text: 2 stars because the food is good.  That being said, the service is a joke.  Sat at the bar 3 times, whether is was some older lady or some "wannabe rockstar" in some doucebag cowboy hat.  Lets start with the woman.  Rude would be nice.  I went to the restroom and the other patrons next to me told me she was talking shit about me. saying i was a nightmare.  Mind you, I've been in the biz for 25 years.  Im insanely polite and take care of staff.   Not sure how she even has a job there.  Now the cowboy. I sat there and watched him pour himself a rocks glass of beer literally every minute.  I guess it was his power hour.  The drunker he got, it was funny watching him make drinks.  complete mess. yet he has a job there.  Since I've been in SF, these smug service staff is just common thread.  I would spend another penny there.  My question is, is the management, ownership this clueless or is that just part of their training.

GWOf1oB2mTalRY_A-EjSiQ.review_text: We tried this restaurant after seeing it on DDD and the food is tremendous. I had the fish tacos which were flavorful and truly amazing. They were adorned with a tasty corn salsa and a fantastic salsa verde. I highly recommend getting at least one order of them. The Mac and cheese may have been the best I have ever had: creamy with a uniquely gritty texture. Every other meal was great as well, except the crab bisque which was average at best and for the price, definitely not worth trying. The service was fine and the view of the water lovely. An absolute must try for people in the area.

8w12dwRyA4KIqU8Q_4RgQw.review_text: My friends brought me here for a belated birthday dinner and I'm so glad they did.  It was the first time for all of us and we came here because it had been shown on Dinners,Drive-ins and Dives.  The place is cute and little inside, but there is a huge patio out back that is on the water with a great view of the Bay.  The waiter we had was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  Food: Appetizers- Tuna Poke Tostada (great flavor), Bacon fried oysters (a little blah), cup of clam chowder (yummy).  Dinner- Fish tacos (perfect with awesome salsa) Dungeness crab cioppino with crab, mussels, clams, prawns & scallops (great broth and the seafood was cooked perfectly, but there was not much crab at all) Whole dungeness crab in butter sauce (great flavor, cooked perfectly)  We are definitely coming back to try other dishes and maybe dessert too! Note to those who saw the tv episode, they do not have the duck poppers anymore :(

3j02JDTcMe-7yQMQcUkQIw.review_text: Came here in a hurry with a flight to catch.. We told our waitress this and the service was impeccable!!! She made sure to move everything along quickly for us and was more than accommodating to my picky eating friends!!!!!! She was very friendly and really made our quick trip to San Fran memorable.. Thanks Tiffany!!! Food was great too but the 5 stars are for Tiffany!

eixS1mCYcdIEdYx_xL-yvg.review_text: Out of all of the restaurants I've been to in San Francisco this has to be one of my top favorites.  Skip the seafood places at the ferry plaza and come here instead!  The crab and shrimp sandwiches on sourdough are just simple and straightforward, but amazing!  Great bloody Mary's and brunch.  Right on the water with a laid back front row view.   We Love it and try to hit this place every time we are in the city!

O9TXTBbZwgHJhGdt9BhQ6A.review_text: We hit the bar the first day, and came back the next day for lunch. Both times were great. Had a table out of the wind, but nicely in the sun. Which helped warm us up after Alcatraz. We split the chicken/avocado sandwich and fries. With a couple of Big Daddy's IPA, that's a meal!

sy2gM9C4vR8NHO7L0C1oSA.review_text: We really like this place- weve eaten here 3 times this month while working in San Fran.   We walk from our hotel in Union SQuare area, figuring we can eat something GOOD when we get there! HA!   Love the clam chowder and the mussels and clams.   ALso had the "Special" panzenella and ceviche last week and both were excellent.    The Panzella was very unique.   The first time we were there, a large party slowed the kitchen down and the wait staff had problems serving at the pace. Although we were enjoying the water view and our appetizer and cocktails, we were compensated for our extra long wait with a round of our drinks.  Nice touch! Hope to be back many more times.  Planning to have the mussels and clams with the macaroni, bacon and cheese for dinner THIS week.  ;)

eA5i8ETSww-M5TSYh87QZw.review_text: We came here because Hog Island was too busy to accommodate our group of 15 and well, Pier 23 Cafe is only aiiiiite. Disappointment started once we opened the menu.  RAW OYSTER There is only ONE kind of raw oyster and it's $2.50 apiece. Man, I'm missing Hog Island already.  SHRIMP + CRAB SANDWICH Meh. It tasted incredibly bland. At least it came with fries.  FISH TACO, APPETIZERS, DESSERT The fish taco was basically a bunch of red cabbage in a soft tortilla. No avocado/guacamole either... Had fried calamari, tuna poke tostada, crab cakes, strawberry shortcake, irish coffee and it was aaalllll just ok.  And this is with champagne, sparkling wine, beer, and a double shot of tequila in me. The best part of our outing was our waiter. He was awesome and treated us very well. Other than that, there's nothing that stands out enough for me to come back to.

tZv6tTjVSE6ct9qVnxqcAw.review_text: As a vegetarian, please be warned that me perspective is skewed by the plethora of seafood that cross contaminated all aspects of my meal. At least I was paranoid enough to think so because there wasn't very much care put into making sure that dishes weren't touching, etc, etc. The options were insanely limited. I had a quesadilla and they heated up the avocado. That makes me nauseous. I'm nauseous writing this.   The drink may be better. I had a gin something or the other and that was ok. But nothing to write home about. With all the options in SF, I beseech you to think about why you actually would want to come here.

CvGgPrBsXO-OkvkANi3HMg.review_text: We hadn't been back here for two years, so tonight was supposed to a special night at what was once a SF hot spot.  I don't have words to express our disappointment in the atmosphere, service, and food, so you'll be left with..."ugggggh."  We went during "non-peak" hours (5:30PM) to avoid crowds but I suspect crowds now avoid this place.  Service was slow, though there were not many people at the tables.  I wanted one of their signature dishes from the past, whole crab, but was told they were "sold out." Really?  At 5:30 you're sold out of your number one dish?  Moving on, we opted for the calamari which previously had been fresh, lightly battered, with a hint of spice and garlic.  What was served was a rubbery mess slathered in what looked like hot wing sauce and sprinkled with slices of jalapenos and a  side of tasteless white sauce.  Totally wretched in both texture and taste.  Squid everywhere are waving their little arms in protest over the needless massacre of their martyred brethren and we paused for a moment of silence.  Neither of us could finish this greasy mess and called for the check.  Having seen our waitress only once before (when the food was served) the wait was long and then she took care to clear the entire table before taking my credit card.  The remaining calamari carcasses were hauled off to what I hope was a far better place.  The card was  returned with the previously mentioned "naked ladies at the bar" post card which put the final dollop of poor taste on the meal.  What was once a fantastic place on the wharf (see Guy's review on DD&D) has now become a mortuary for seafood that couldn't make it elsewhere.  No doubt this place has changed ownership over the years but there really is no excuse for this place being what it has become.  So...if you're visiting in SF, save a lot of your money and go elsewhere.  We had better food on the street and so should you.  SF deserves better than this.

AWye-gCYuGO4oqYN2IrMbQ.review_text: Food: If I could, I'd label this a 4/5 stars just for the food. The fried calamari was good, especially if you like the heavier breaded kind. My friend had the mussels and clams, which came in an amazing spiced broth. And my shrimp and crab sourdough sandwich was amazingly fresh and tasty! The bread wasn't dripping with butter, it was just lightly spread with it and soooo tasty.  The good: Very fresh and delicious seafood, as promised by Diners, Drive ins and Dives!  The bad: The 3/5 is mostly for the service. Waitors were pretty blase, and I get it because it's a "divey" kind of place. Also, although the food was really good, it wasn't blow my mind I'd come back here with out of towners good.  Ambiance: casual, quirky seafood cafe  Good for: a casual dinner with friends or family  What to know: The outdoor patio has a nice view of the water, but it's freezing there unless it's a rare sunny day!  Overall: Pretty good, casual seafood place- good for a beer and some seafood small plates.

lqa_-pMCl-AbyQjE8OVLlQ.review_text: Mediocre food.   The waiter there left himself more tip than I put on the receipt. It really isn't worth the effort to call for a refund of $1 but just beware that sketchy things like this do happen there.

eJMPGgtrJENsYEBCgrBAsQ.review_text: Great experience overall! Calamari was great and I had the Thai prawns with rice noodles which was so delish. We shared the mac, bac & cheese as a table and it was a little bland, id definitely recommend spicing it up a bit. Other than that this place is a must try :)

goZ-kSTFH5Ujpf54GwbaRw.review_text: Pier 23 is one of those great places where on a rare, nice sunny day in San Francisco you can hang out and listen to live music and drink beers near the water.    However, the prices kill. Sixteen dollars for a burger, and $13 for fish tacos, it's not really worth it.

oyRKhwTODN_H21jTxIgEIg.review_text: I hate writing bad reviews, but this restaurant definitely warranted it and I was crafting what I'd be yelping while the food was still in my mouth.   Let's start with the bad stuff. We were seated in the patio which was beautiful. We sat there for about 15 minutes before anybody came to take our drink order. I had to flag down a couple of waterboys before our server came by. She was really nice. Took our orders breezily and wandered off. Came back 20 minutes later and said (verbatim), "ummm so I totally forgot what you ordered. Can you repeat it again?"  I'm like wtf. Who the hell does that? And she didn't seem the least apologetic. Maybe if I wasn't so hungry, I'd be less of a raging bitch. Although at that point, I had to try my hardest to be super polite just because I didn't want my food spat on.   The food came and was total crap. My friend ordered fish and chips and I had the eggs 23. It probably wasn't THAT bad in perspective, but I was fuming from the wretched service.  Now onto the good stuff - they did keep refilling my water and coffee. And the sun was gorgeous that day, so can't complain. But I'd stay far, far away.

jzSgXqbWysxyS0sR4lrSAg.review_text: Pier 23 is not set up for live music. There is nowhere to stand and watch the performance.  Additionally, Pier 23 will only seat you if you are dining. (Never mind the fact that we spent more money on alcohol than we would have on food.) We ended up standing to the side of the band... which made sound quality worse.   The alcohol was reasonably priced, however the bartender was stingy with it. Most of the pints of beer we purchased were a few inches short of the mark.

EJfgY3pj1HXCsJikWFZ1gQ.review_text: Went last night for the first time after hearing about it for a while...  Great, fast and fresh seafood (every single one of our plates was wiped clean!) Head-on peel shrimp, Fish Tacos, Pork Ribs and a side of their signature Fries...  Love the water seating and views...we were there on a Sat night, and sat in the back, outside (as most people have said, don't let the front part fool you, the party's in the back!)  It wasn't that busy on this Sat night, there was actual street parking...the wait staff wasn't the friendliest, so I docked 1 star...  Overall great place to take out-of-towners or include it in a staycation itinerary !

ppiPdyYrXgUYLZNQWx-qdw.review_text: Decided to have lunch here since we saw the feature on DDD.   We walked in and were seated immediately. We sat outside with a view of the water. Very nice and calming.   For an appetizer we decided on fried calamari. Nicely breaded. Not so oily.   We were going to order separate dishes but was advised that the portion size was enough for two people.    SF shrimp and crab  on sourdough with green salad, coleslaw and shoestring fries.    All of it was delicious. Dressing on salad was very good. Seasoning on fries was different but in a good way. Sandwich....yummy.  We will come again to try other items on the menu.

nGozHYFspeWe2DliD9GqcA.review_text: I have to come back here again. This place is totally worth a revisit.  Came for happy hour on one of those gloriously rare, sunny, warmish days.
