We were literally chasing the sun when the clock struck 5, hoping to find a place that would meet our three priorities: sunlight, outdoor patio, beer. (The first priority is hard to meet in SF)  With very little time to spare, Pier 23 became our answered prayer. The character of this place is undeniable: funky music, friendly service, cheeky posters and free cowboy hats. Yep, we would enjoy the last of daylight, San Francisco-style.  - To try: fried oyster sliders with fries. We missed the happy hour specials but these sufficed real nice. The thin-cut, crispy fries are dusted with cajun spicing that pairs oh so nicely with a solid beer and a fried oyster. - Sit outside with everyone else; they're friendly and will scoot to share a table with you. - I hear they have a bangin' reggae night on Saturdays - Park on Battery since the meters are free after 6!  I'm coming back for you Pier 23.

Xu3_Xi_dXeJzSQXLVtePZQ.review_text: Have been here before and know it's delicious. But service was terrible and crab was undercooked.

3Sk3JTr5USjtbdoWDHt6eg.review_text: If You're going to San Francisco, be sure to avoid Pier 23.  I have to tell you, that maybe, just maybe you want to have a cocktail here, but do not eat the food.  The oysters were tiny and dry, come on this is NorCal, plenty of awesome oysters at your kitchen door.  The crab cakes - shame on the chef, tasteless.  Fish taco, better at a national franchise,  Even the french fries were awful, and that's not easy to do.  The saving grace, for us, was the company at our table.  But wasting $100 still tastes bad, 3 days later.

jvPKzJ5bqA6QzB3p9PPzPQ.review_text: This place was awful. The clam chowder was watery and flavorless, the salmon was average and overdone, the side that came with the salmon was really just a heap of garnish, and the Mac and cheese was the most soupy Mac and cheese I've ever had. Service was fine but the food was just awful.

5-2T8ZwcI1Y5gQRiAZA9Nw.review_text: The hostess...the older one was really rude. Looked like she might be an owner, not sure. She greeted us like we were idiots. Told us there was an hour wait when in fact there was not. After she walked away the younger hostess was rude as well. Rolling her eyes, shaking her head and being generally rude. Needless to say we didn't want to eat there. Their only saving grace is that the bartender was very nice and he made a great margarita.  I hear they have amazing seafood dishes so it was a huge disappointment not to be able to try it.

MQbaGVfwGnddzrcABnS-Fw.review_text: This is SFO in a nutshell.  Great seafood, laid back fun servers, and an awesome view.  The fish and chips, YUM!  The crab fettucini was amazing.  I love this place.  So good.  If it is sunny go early to sit outside.  But the bar is fun too. CLASSIC San Fran

ev7LoVNY2o7XA9M3oSC_IQ.review_text: I had the fish and chips and here's what i think: - Definitely fresh - Sizzling hot - Portion is pathetic, three thin strips of fish gobbled down in 3 mouthfuls!   The fries were yummy and generous ...   The service was pathetic, Aussie waiter there was trying to get us to leave earlier. The 4 of us just decided to finish our beers somewhere else where we were more welcomed.   We thought that the prices were steep for what we got ... these are probably tourist prices

iLsfSX_JeNp7HgSYW2nZbw.review_text: Love this place...Fun Music & Entertainment. Great Crab & Shrimp Louie Salad...

DwTsuIDhPWtVpbIWVVZIiA.review_text: I had the same experience that John T had: not good at all and nothing special. My dad had seen this place on TV and has been wanting to try it. He was surprised to see that the duck was not on the menu. I had the catfish Po Boy and he had the fish tacos. Both were soggy and well nothing all that great. An extra star for an attentive staff and above average french fries.

rWwdBRdk93MLWN-GfNQl9g.review_text: This review is for the Maikel Garcia Quartet who performed here on February 21st, 2014.  Maikel Garcia is a truly gifted and talented sax player, along with pianist Don Alberts, drummer Art Lewis, and bassist Adam Gay. They played from around 8PM-10:30 with a set that included many of the popular jazz standards (including my favorite, Watermelon Man by Herbie Hancock), as well as a few original songs. They were professional, entertaining, energetic, and cohesive. Maikel was captivating and it was clear he knows his craft well. I love when you can feel the love that players have for their music, and how the music reverberates through your bones. I applaud their performance and look forward to seeing more of them!  The food and drinks were delicious, and both the hostess and our waitress were kind and accommodating. I highly recommend heading to Pier 23 if you are looking for some excellent live music and a good friday night!

9vH4X_xEyau3eZpfEd58qQ.review_text: The Dungeness crab was recommended and did not disappoint. Not cheap, but worth a try if you're visiting the city. Crab salad sandwich on some very tasty sourdough was surprisingly light and mostly meat (As it should be!) Friendly waitstaff, great outdoor view of the bay. Will be even better when renovations of next door neighboring buildings are complete.

pOD3NX4_ja2rW45c1TilqQ.review_text: Good for what it is drinks outside and light food..now that the cruise ship docks nearby not sure how often I'll be going back. Prices are good for the setting - Don't expect any great specials. Laid back joint.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: I love this place for their location. On a rare sunny day in San Francisco this is the place to be.   Unfortunately the sunny view of the bay and rockin music usually doesn't thrill the staff at Pier 23. My last visit to Pier 23 was a very sunny Friday around 6 at night. The entire staff had on black long sleeve t shirts and a look of anger I can not explain. Maybe it was the rowdy 20/30 somethings enjoying the sun? Maybe it was the Budweiser girls dressed like bad cowboys cheerleaders...idk?  Once our server acknowledged our presence we ordered a bucket of beers, which arrived shortly. We quickly killed that and it was time to order more drinks and this is when our waitress started to loose it. One of my friends ordered a margarita with salt only on half or the rim, insert crazy eyes from the waitress. No idea what the issue was with that. Next my other friend order a tequila w/ grapefruit juice, insert crazy eyes and shoulder shrug from the waitress. As the waitress made it around the table her crazy expressions got worse, to the point where one of my friends asked her if she was OK. She told us she had been working for 7 hours and was not pleased about it, we offered to buy her a drink and she just kept up with the crazy eyes.  Next came the seafood platter for 3....for 4 and boy did that suck. It was fries, 6 shrimp and a cup of calamari. Sooo Sad.  I love Pier 23 for the location, but maybe it is time to pep up the staff?!?!?

iaP8F3HlSpZAE8gB5mFj3A.review_text: Have always loved this classic joint. Every day is different at Pier 23. Sunny days the back patio is a great place to be. Be patient for a table and be nice to the servers as this place is really popular on a sunny day / maybe the most popular downtown spot when the sun comes out.  In the evenings when the sun goes down Pier 23 keeps cranking with great music (Piano player on the first Monday of each month is classic much like Pier 23)  Food is solid, bartenders are fixtures and my overall experience each time is satisfied per what an old time bar & grill can deliver.

doz_wwj6F6Ln9ykODiLtZA.review_text: the only reason this place gets 2 stars is because after leaving my credit card here while drinking myself silly on st. patrick's day, they returned it to me over a week later. the staff was exceptionally polite and even gave me a pier 23 souvenir pen to take home with me.   that's why it pains me to have to write this review. wakako u. and i decided to stay and have snack after retrieving my card. we ordered fired calamari and steamed clams. they were the two saltiest things i've ever had the misfortune of eating, and i LOVE salt. this was waaaaay too much salt, though. i hope the chef is in love. if so, congrats... but tone it down, man!   the best thing about this place was the bloody mary and the outdoor patio. stick to drinks here and you can't go wrong.

ZYZNcugF3xUEGyLOVGiZ0Q.review_text: People!  Let's get this straight.  You are not coming here for fine cuisine.  You are coming here to sit outside by the water, listen to whatever great band they usually have and drink to your heart's content.  Sure, I'm always a tourist when I am in San Fran, and this place is full of 'em.  But don't let that sway you.  We came here on a sunny Sunday afternoon and wiled away the hours eating crab, drinking beer and listening to an amazing band belt out the tunes all the while working on our suntans!  Out back is the place to be and if you see a table, nab it before anyone else does as there doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to getting a seat at this place.  The prices are reasonable, the atmosphere fun, and the line for the women's room moves pretty quickly (always worth an extra star!)  Want fine food?  Go somewhere else.  But if you are looking to relax with friends and do some drinking outside by the water, Pier 23 fills the bill just fine!

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: I've come to Pier 23 many times to see my friend's reggae band "Dub FX". When I first started going there a few years back, it'd be difficult to get a drink at the bar (bartenders seemed to have attitude) but recently it's been a lot easier (maybe I've learned a trick or two to get my drink faster).  I've had the food a few times and although not stellar, it did a fine enough job not to complain about it.  The main draw, of course, is the outdoor patio. As others have noted, this is one of the best places to come on a hot day/evening. And when you get a good crowd and bumping music going on here, it can be a real blast.

VfDSKitiUik-sIMYlcNdMA.review_text: Food was good but was disappointed we had a reservation for outside and no table was available. Sliders were incredible I loved the shrimp and oyster the best. A little more pricy than I would have thought for casual seafood.

KiwEl_OEhZjFRDMflwc8xQ.review_text: Absolutely amazing food, fun atmosphere, and top notch service. Try the Tuna Poke and the Crab and Shrimp Sandwich. Buckets of beer were a great idea. Definitely a must hit spot on the water!

sVPGTM8bnE43Pft7SblfDA.review_text: Great views, food is overpriced and average.

zNbvxu7wnxWemho5LQhadg.review_text: Great atmosphere, amazing patio, and really great bar staff. Plus, they give you really cute hats... Who can resist that?! :)

0AKBXk29KZqCkT5LDVvbWQ.review_text: this place was surprisingly delighful for a meal on the outside patio on a sunny day, we made reservations the day before for our party of 5 and probably had to wait an addition 15 minutes as the place was packed, we went there after seeing an episode of diners, drive-ins and dives. the only reason i gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because they had nothing currently on the menu that was featured on the show. aside from that the food we ordered was good: fried oyster sliders were fantastic, the fish and chips were great and the crab and shrimp sandwhich was ok, we all had a bloody mary which only half the group liked and a few other cocktails from their signature drink menu which we all likes. this was definitly a chill atmosphere with attentive wait staff on a very busy sunday afternoon.

QvJ77BM1gqPTlrfR0swp5A.review_text: I decided to stop here today for an early dinner. Asked the hostess if I could sit outside by the water. She stated that all those tables were reserved, and asked if I would like to sit at the bar. Looked a bit too crowded for what I like, so I politely declined. She asked if I was eating or just there for drinks. I told her I'd be eating, and she offered a table inside. I must've showed a little apprehension, so she said she'd show me the table and I could stay if I wanted. I agreed, and I'm glad I did. I was here for work and alone, so without having someone to chat with, I like having a view. The table she sat me at was just inside of the patio, behind sliding glass doors. So, still had a nice view, but without as much of the wind and chill. Kudos for honoring commitments to those with reservations, and still finding a way to show that you want my business and accommodate my desire for a nice view!  The waitstaff was very nice. The drinks came out a bit slow, but the food came out quick. Had a cup of the crab bisque-good flavor, but a few small shell pieces and not much meat. The seared tuna sandwich with sriracha aioli was great! Properly cooked (which is to say not much) and the aioli was flavorful without the heat of the sriracha drowning out everything else. Lots of fresh herbs and flavor from that as well!  Glad I came!

nVK5ZZ9IDjUX1WFJzzbYKg.review_text: For all of the negative reviews, you'd think people didn't understand you can get entire buckets of beer brought out to you and nachos while you sit on the pier and watch boats come and go all afternoon.  When the servers are busy I walk to the bar and get my own goddamned beer!

98uHVE66O4sgYTMM3EZcDg.review_text: Clam chowder was one of my favorites and the garlic crab satisfied my crab craving. Yummmm!

kHecrLi0Z_kpE5olZSSTfA.review_text: I'd spent the day in the car driving my college roommate and her husband around SF. One of the main stops on my SF tours is always the Ferry Building, especially if it's market day on Saturday.  If you've lived in the city long enough to have been here before the '89 quake, then you remember the best-forgotten Central Freeway and its subsequent demise. The post-quake metamorphosis of the Embarcadero is, to my mind, the single-most important beautification project in the city, at least in the years I've lived here. The palm trees, the vibrant atmosphere, the updating of the Ferry Building, the Farmers' Market, AT&T Park, the public art -- I love it all. Makes my spirit soar.  Which brings us to Pier 23. I was trying to think of a place that serves good food, offers a spectrum of draft beers on tap, and most importantly, has an amazing view of the bay. The fact that Pier 23 is semi-divey (in a good way) and calls to mind the kinds of places we frequented in college sealed the deal. The day was picture postcard perfect. You know the kind of day I mean -- cerulean blue skies, light balmy breeze, sunshine for days, with a delightful 78 degrees -- the kind of day where If you didn't live here already, you'd be figuring out how soon you could move here. Pier 23 was the perfect choice to enjoy all this splendor that is San Francisco.   We scored a table right on the water and watched as a cruise ship pulled into dock. Service was super-friendly and relaxed. Our meals were all delicious as well as generously portioned, and a draft beer was the perfect complement.   Yes, there are plenty of more upscale places to eat on the Embarcadero. But sometimes you just can't beat Pier 23. This was one of those days. Long live Pier 23!

BacsLOu7CvpnZpqeYz37tw.review_text: Fwow! I love this place. The outdoor seating is always great with the views. Bustling yet still retaining a laid back ambience. Locals, locals, locals and happy ones at that. Definitely not fine dining by any means yet good/better pub grub with a menu to satisy most peoples palates. Dungenous crab salad on the menu scored bonus points with me. Always fun. Great staff and interesting for people watching on the weekends w/ the classic cars/motorcycles out front, local bands, etc...

rP2wZCD-DnyxD1a5lkeAUA.review_text: Great food and service Awesome location

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Raw oysters.  Fried calamari.  French fries.  Views.  Views.   Views.  Pier 23 Cafe is a classic San Francisco establishment located right on the bay. Since 1984, they've been known for fresh seafood, strong cocktails and live music daily. If you want a true SF experience, this is the place to be.   I've got mad love for this place!

__tr37QhFc-nKxpKUzP63w.review_text: On a beautiful day in the City by the Bay, Pier 23 is a fantastic place to relax  for a leisurely brunch on their deck on the backside of the restaurant.    If you're in the mood for something a little more non-traditional, I would highly recommend the Eggs 23 special, which consists of these wonderful potato patties mixed with onions, topped with avocado, melted cheese and a poached egg.  Divine!   The tomato, mushroom, and jack cheese omelette was nicely done as well.  The egg was fluffy and soft, and the filling was generous.    Their bloody mary is also delightfully spicy and a perfect accompaniment with the meal.

UNbRVJql-hopPSuvYmsDmQ.review_text: This is a really great/fun place!!    We came during Fleet Week and it was SUPER packed! We hung out on their outdoor patio are which was awesome because it's right on the water and they have an outdoor bar!  I was surprised because they only had 2 bartenders out there and they were working that line super fast!   I was starving so we ordered the sliders.  WOW, they were freaking amazing! I definitely did not expect them to be THAT good! They were so flavorful, juicy (literally dripping)! Probably the best I've ever had.  Everyone was raving about the food.  Loved this place. Would definitely recommend it on a nice sunny day in the city! :)

rdzHAHI86xsOF3XRmvWkUw.review_text: I CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU TONIGHT!  I miss you!!!  Worth playing hooky for the afternoon and suffering the worst of consequences.  Perfect venue for afternoon happy hours and suntan development on a sunny day such as today.  Second only to Sam's Anchor Cafe, of course!!!

04JttCeiTpGmy-7XJtn2Gw.review_text: We came to Pier 23 on a warm weekday after work. We expected to find a solid crowd wanting to take advantage of the deck during the warm weather, so we were pleasantly surprised when we only had to wait 30 mins for a table to open up during.  Thankfully we were treated to a great table right on the rail and had a great view of the sunset while we had drinks.  For dinner, the GF had the amazing grilled fish tacos. The fish was perfectly prepared and the corn salsa was excellent  I had the roasted whole crab special. The crab was amazing! Sweet, savory, simple and delicious.  The only complaint and hesitation from a 5star review was prices. For the type of food and preparation, the prices are a bit high. I understand that is the cost for fresh seafood, but I think prices are a notch high, but still worth it.  Pier 23 is a great place to take in the sunset and enjoy a solid meal

X9F7DSi5eaXZiZdotfLjoQ.review_text: Great hot spot just to chill around cool folks. Great music. Nice funky fresh ambiance with the nice scenery right on the pier. Every Saturday - live reggae  Also open in the daytime. Didnt drop by in the day, but it looked pretty popular!  I know that i'll go here again when i go back to the city!

90NvbRx9qZwAzGlxD3qF5g.review_text: I was pretty disappointed with this place. After seeing it on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives I imagined the food to simply be amazing. I've been to a couple other places featured on the show and Guy was spot on with his review. However, the service at this place was AWFUL! We waited soooooooooo long for drinks. She messed up several orders at our table and told us that sodas did not include refills only after we'd ordered a few...shady if you ask me. To make matters worse, we'd been SOOOOOO looking forward to the duck poppers featured on the show...they said they were a special served Thursday - Sunday. Yea...they didn't serve them on the Thursday we went. Uhhh ok?   The hostess (and I think owner) was rude to a few of my friends for no good reason. I ordered the mussels and clams and a cup of clam chowder. First the waitress comes over and tells me they're out of clams...alright, no big deal mussels are my favorite! Then another 20 minutes goes by and a bus boy informs me they're out of clam chowder. My friend ordered the chicken wings as he's on a no carb diet...they're out of those. He orders a side salad instead of fries with the chicken/bacon sandwich with no bread...it comes with fries and bread, no salad. Another friend ordered the same sandwich...didn't even come with bacon on it so the waitress brought him a plate of under cooked bacon a little later.   The quality of the food was ok...my mussels were pretty good (although it didn't come with the bread it said it did on the menu). The roasted crab was pretty good but I think over priced.   Overall, I don't think we'll go back and I'm pretty disappointed with it being featured on Triple D.

PuY7DZmqCWledIF1FgGIgQ.review_text: The stars are only for the food.  Once again, Guy got us!  But at least it was a good experience this time.  The hubby and I started with calamari and octopus/cod ceviche.  It was good.  The hubby had soft shell crab sandwich, which came with fries and very much enjoyed it.  I had the fish tacos and it was good.  Only problem is it got soggy, very fast.  I do plan on going back and try the mussels and clams.  I'm a sucker for seafood!  The service was blah!  Our waitress was friendly up until she forgot my soda refill.  So after ten minutes of waiting, I had to get the busboy to remind her.  She came back with the soda and this dark, evilness on her face.  Did not even apologize.  Rude!

VvRQkhRG9UwQwnJWIMi8Ww.review_text: Patrick the Bartender is awesome, personable and fun! There was live music on Tuesday, December 2nd. A trio of a classy Dad and Daughter and their friend. Add in the piano teacher and it was on! So cool. Love the old school vibe of this spot. A great place to catch up with an old friend. Visit both restrooms and enjoy novelties from the vending machine.

wXLYtMi8UXmjd2o5pZ7QPA.review_text: Cheese plate and a bowl of mussels and clams... I'm good to go... every time I am in town.

Hw5riZfnB-B7G79vBTOssA.review_text: Came here this past week on a recent trip to San Fran. We made reservations (recommended) and scored a table on the patio right by the water! Very beautiful spot with great views.   They have a decent draft beer selection.  I ordered the crab cioppino. Hey, when in Rome! Absolutely huge serving of clams, mussels, crab, and shrimp in this delish red sauce. Yes, I ate all of it. Also, came with a side of sourdough bread to dunk in the sauce! Such a delicious meal!  Will definitely return on my next trip out here!

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: "N o t e  to  s e l f"  Anything along the Embarcadero is expensive, marked up and knocked up in order to attract as much as possible from busy road that tourists bump along in order to get to Fisherman's Wharf and other points of attraction.  However, despite the $60 tab in addition to the first tab at the bar, the experience was priceless (I know I know, Mastercard copycat here) because I got to spend a few precious hours canoodling with my sweetie under an errant heat lamp.  The front is deceiving, because once you enter the small yet welcoming establishment, you don't realize how long it goes toward the back and opens out to a partial tent-covered deck and the open wood patio, saved by a few heat lamps.  Quaint and casual, bear in mind that you can smoke here, so every puff of wind brought along an unwelcome stink of smoke I had to duck or wave away.  Patrons here were casual and/or business crowd in suits.  The Happy Hour specials were not really that special, and the bottles of beer/pints were a little too expensive (um, hello, Frisson offers $5 happy hour specials and it's nicer inside) but I was humming along on my $6.00 Gin and Tonic.  In addition, this little lady was starving, so not only did we make quick work of the Buffalo Wings ($8-9 or so for only 10 wings, please) or the Caesar Salad (priced around $9 for a wretched bowl) and the Calamari (around $8-9, good and crunchy but a little burnt) but A L L  of this did not matter because of the company I was in.  In addition, the waitstaff including the bussers were sooooooo extremely nice and courteous, it swept away any negative ideas of the costs here.  Great location, good live jazz (a bassist was plucking away with the pianist) and clientele that know to leave people alone in their own little worlds.

Zl1fJNTzNULZiqBRShxUYA.review_text: OK, we were stupid for coming here on a windy night and agreeing to sit outside, but seriously.  They have those heating things, but those things don't protect you from the wind.  Nor do they protect you from slow service long after most of the crowds have deserted this place for warmer climes.  I'd give this place another shot on a nice day, but don't waste your time coming here on a night that's anywhere near cold or windy.

At78xFTRNPfjR_pGD4ILKA.review_text: This music venue/bay side drink spot is one of my favorite in town.  The food is not the cheapest in the world but is very tasty.    My recommendation is getting a Daly Double.  For those of you who do not know what this is, it is an alcohol Arnold paler, but double the spirits.  These WILL get to you fast, so watch your yourself.  I am convinced that this place has the best plate of calamari that I have yet to taste.  Very crispy, and not rubbery.  Best of all it is served with a jalapeno tarter sauce.  This review is still in progress.  When I see some reggae live on the back porch facing the bay, I will petition to Yelp for the elusive 6th start rating.    Not too many tourists and a great friendly atmosphere, especially on Sunday afternoons with friends.  Come here and you wont be dissapointed.

4UkA6Sjw-RE-RuZQ1MIcTA.review_text: Nothing bad to say here its just and A-Ok kinda place. Went for beers after a soccer game on a Friday night. We were able to get a table and the waitress took our order right away. We had ate dinner already but felt like a snack and ordered the cheese plate. It was actually quite good. I would get it again.  Its not glamorous but there are 3 sections that could between them meet just about any ones needs. There is an outside deck area that is large and has a lot of seating. I imagine on a warm sunny day this would be a great place to have drinks and watch boats go by. Then there is a semi-outside/inside area that is very casual and can accommodate a group if you have one. This is were we sat. Unfortunately, they do not service this area all night but you are welcome to sit here as long as you would like you just have to go to the bar and get your own drinks. The inside has seating and the bar and when we were there it was also housing a live band. Could be fun to sit in there too I suppose.   I wouldn't be apposed to going back at all. Just know that its a very causal laid back kind of atmosphere and you wont be disappointed.

4dgcXadfX2wNAAvBEGpesQ.review_text: Cute place with great water views. Nice cozy spot that pulled me in with live music. Bartender was friendly and attentive. Great vibe

Jv9XnGcd9P8DeZQ4m7QWgg.review_text: Being a DDD fan had to try it, it was average to say the least. View and location are what saves it. The crab and shrimp sandwich was mundane and tasteless. The peel and eat prawns were a saving grace very fresh and the boil was outstanding! The staff was so/so they were at times frustrated and not really that polite and it was not even that busy. Maybe DDD was not a good idea for them.

krS-NZPgk-YUWA_EIVJF8w.review_text: I have always loved Pier 23...good to be by the water. took my Mum who just came from France and she loved it. She is a cook and she said it was the ebst calamaris she has had in a long time. non greasy crispy and with a spicy hot sauce. what not to like. It was raining that day but we stayed under the covered part of the pier...

QPhKwoNEGYzIeidIOh-5gQ.review_text: I'm pretty over this place but I still keep coming back for the location. The tables outside with the heat lamps, right on the bay make for a very nice heavy drinking session. And every night at this place somehow turns into a heavy drinking night. It may have something to do with the "bucket of beers", or the need for people in big groups to "get the next round", even if you didn't necessarily want another round.  If the weather's nice or you are sitting right under the heat lamp this is the place to be. If you just played a soccer game a couple piers away and need that post-game, we-are-the-worst-team-in-the-league drink, then again, this is the place to be.

RG8lVUFpZIP1SnNeSsAk2Q.review_text: I was excited to try this little place since I saw it on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.  We met friends here for dinner while visiting SF again.  The seafood is great!    Husband had the Steamed Mussels and Clams....great flavor and the brothy sauce was great for dipping in bread.   We tried the Tuna Poke Tostada for appetizers...these were delicious.  I had grilled fish tacos...light, well balanced flavors.

HAmYzzWGTqMHvUieDstuIg.review_text: I like the bay view from the patio. This place has a very relaxed vibe that I liked. Had a nice lunch and Bloody Mary on a sunny afternoon.  The Dungeness Crab salad was real good but a little pricey for the size. The Bloody Mary was decent though and the staff was super nice. I would go back for lunch again.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: I came here for brunch a few weeks ago.  I've been sick with the "kissing disease" so I haven't been able to swallow.  The skinny cow ate all my food.  I was sad.  The fish taco bite I had was good.  The bite of crab cake benedict was also really good.  The musonics play here on Friday nights once every other month.  woot!

S2K0CKviY_F_2tdO9EfQxA.review_text: I kind of *heart* Pier 23. Why, do you ask?  Well, you see, I am on Spring Break. (Why yes, this IS a great time to be in school- I'll see your RECESSION and raise you some STUDENT LOANS, bitches.) And being on Spring Break at my advanced age has lead me to reflect upon many things, mainly tequila drinking.  HI DAD! *ahem*  Anyway. Pier 23 is an EXCELLENT place to drink tequila, especially on Bay 2 Breakers Saturday while dressed up in obnoxious sailor outfits with 25 of your nearest and dearest- AHOY MATEYS!   Also you could come here in an unnecessarily oversized hat to watch the Kentucky Derby and drink bourbon and eat nachos!  What not to love, seriously?   Hmm, I sense another theme outing to Pier 23 coming on... ideas, anyone?

UVVn8JcvIZ5fX5tE6Ne4Tw.review_text: Saw this place on DDD, and since we were already in San Fran, thought we'd hit it up.  It was funky, fun, and crowded (always a good sign in my book).  My bacon mac & cheese was to DIE for, as were my pork carnitas and skirt steak sliders...yum!!  Hubby had the crab & shrimp sandwich, which was well sized and packed with goodness.  He also had the chowder, which he said was terrific (sorry, don't eat the stuff).  They have live music, and the band was playing great tunes ("Stomp" and "Don't Stop the Music" and "Ascension").  Just a super VIBE in the joint.    Glad we stopped by there...now I can cross this place off my DDD list!  If you're in San Fran, I encourage you to go here :)

r9O55r3TFzm_Sjc-E5jK9Q.review_text: Only been here once, but the food was Awesome! Looking forward to eating here again.

osKRlpB2pBdhbc1Qb7Xisg.review_text: Here the customers are nicer than customer service. The place is nice and the beers are cold. Live music.

fBdhA2Q1Y_lTR7_nje4PyA.review_text: Great bloody maries but not many vegetarian options for food. Plus they won't let you sit at a table if you aren't ordering food. So I am typically stuck having to stand because I can't eat anything. All veggie options are unhealthy.  BUT 3 stars just because they have waterfront seating and great margaritas.

mRFv6qrzXHFXvj_yDWkGyg.review_text: Incredible service at the cutest waterfront restaurant on the Embarcadero.   My friend had the fish tacos and said they were the best he had.  I had the seared tuna sandwich with the most amazing garlic fries.  The waiter (I think his name was Aaron) was kind, personable, and patient (and pretty sexy if I might add).  A+ professional service!

08YlNEdFoFBd3tl-k6n38Q.review_text: This is the second time I ate here, the first time being with 2 friends who live in SF and this time on my own.  I remembered it being much better the first time, about a year ago.  There was a long line to get in, but once I was at the hostess stand, they seated me right away outside.  The service is what killed this place for me.  They were so busy and totally unprepared for the nice weather - not enough servers for the outside seating area.  Also, they were so slammed that they weren't clearing tables fast enough to accommodate people lined up.  There were people in line staring at tables where people had left 5-10 mins prior.  I also watched a waitress bark at someone who walked in through the open side gate and mistakenly sit at a table.  She yelled, "There's a line for these tables, SIR!"  If it was me, I would have left, which is exactly what he did.  My server disappeared after she took my order.  The food runners and guys refilling my water glass were really busy and still very friendly and helpful.  However, I had to flag down a server more than 15 mins after I was done eating to bring my check and then my server dropped it off without saying anything, and acted as if I had offended her with the nerve to ask her to pay.  I mean, really?  I was warned it was a tourist trap, and for $18 for eggs & a small cup of clam chowder plus crap service, I will skip it next time for somewhere better.  (Especially if "better" means a bagel & coffee on the go.)

nYC8_Oo43ikuopD1w1krvA.review_text: No nonsense fresh seafood with a beautiful scenery. Food was not quite hot enough and that wait staff was a little too busy to be really attentive. But can't beat the scenery and fun vibe at a reasonable price.

OjBAPYaE9lcmTcRV3M75Tg.review_text: PIer 23 is an awesome place to hang out after work over some drinks and appetizers IF you feel like blowing all the money you just earned.  I understand that you pay for the view/location when you hang out at a joint like this, but you should also have a reasonable expectation that the oysters on your *expensive* fried seafood platter won't look like something the cat vomited up. My partner cut into one as we were snacking and I almost passed out from how horrifying the thing looked.  Other than that, the portion was SMALL for a $23 plate of fried sea creatures that supposedly feeds three. Prawns were also barely edible, but the calamari was excellent. Margaritas are nice, beers are $6. Personally love sitting outside on a nice afternoon, but be warned...it smells, of course, like the bay.  Come prepared to fork over twice what you would at a decent happy hour, and leave before it gets too cold.

-JwAH9vW1z4e00rVXW2QQw.review_text: Had the yellowtail crudo, oysters, and some chowder. It was nice sitting outside and enjoying the February sun and cold beer.  Much easier than trekking over to Sam's, although I LOVE Sam's.  Friendly service, and easy in and out!

QQUOgqJqzjLq9hjmpOrSiQ.review_text: I had reservation at 8pm which I don't think even matter because the lady in front was so rude and didn't ask whether we had reservation or not. This is my first time here so I wasn't sure where to go or what not, but quickly spotted the desk right in the front. Kind of hard to see people there were so many people inside, however I was patiently waiting for a worker to notice me. Saw a lady, didnt get her name...who did and she glance then walked away. She return to get something and finally say that she will be right with me. After coming back, she told me that there were seats outside, but it's very cold which I didn't mind at all so I kindly agree. What I thought was unnecessary was her tone of voice and how she told me that I cannot change my mind and move if it gets too cold. Thanks for the information, but girl, you need to be more kind. She also had me standing in the front while she went outside. Then expected me to see her from that little hall way, when she waved to come sit down. Aren't you suppose to come and walk with your guests so they know that you're ready and what not?  As far as food, the baked oysters were the best! Ordered two of that and wanted more, but stopped myself. Each contain 3 oysters for $9. I also ordered fish and chips and a crab/shrimp sandwich which I thought were just okay. Th fish and chips needs something more...kind taste plain to me while the sandwich was more on the better side. On the good not: the waiter and waitress outside were fantastic! Engaged with their customers really well!

gAJquBOPL9XGwH01GtrMDw.review_text: The first question I ask myself when sizing up a place I've never been to is, "Would I come back here?"  Undoubtedly, the answer in this instance is "yes".  We came here due to an overwhelming response online from friends when I was looking for a good lunch spot in the Bay Area.    The wait was 20 minutes on a Friday during lunch hour, which isn't awful and provided us time to grab a beer.  We were seated outdoors and it was an unreal day weather wise. After a a couple beers, an appetizer, and two entrees the bill was close to $60 which was totally OK with us.  I recommend the calamari because the sauce is fantastic and I dig the pickled jalapenos that come with.  The clam chowder I ordered was solid and the consistency of it was top notch.  Runny chowder is the worst. We also got fish and chips which may have been some of the BEST fish and chips we'd ever had.    I can't speak to how they make their drinks, or what the place is like during dinner or when nightlife begins and the freaks come out but I would come back for lunch and try it for dinner.

3VZK24Ro2H5qbWh7sz3MJA.review_text: New years day..had great brunch wonderful bloody marys and tasty food.. Fabulous service.  Liked it so much booked table for birthday dinner for 12 in a couple of weeks. .  It's about the whole atmosphere. I love this pla ce .  It's not fancy at all.. A bit gritty but old SF.  This old feminist finds their naked women logo so sexist but the whole place is a throw back. To days when SF had  thriving shipping and longshoremen abounded. The steak with eggs was good sized thick and delicious. The fish and chips,spicy and crunchy outside, light and delectible inside..only two pieces though. Eggs on the Benedict were a bit overdone for my taste so ask them to be runny if you want them so.  Oysters were fresh as can be .

AOBHl5XGRNWJ7MaatXsqMg.review_text: I have been to Pier 23 multiple times and It is one of my favorites for lunch in San Francisco, majorly for it's location, ambiance and view on the back patio.   My ratings below are on taste ONLY, not on price/value (I'll get there in a minute!).  Garlic Prawns- (4.5) Spicy and full of garlic flavor, perfectly cooked and succulent. Crab and Shrimp Sandwich-  (3.5) Served on thick toasted & buttered sourdough! Crab and (minuscule) Shrimp is mixed with plain ol' mayo, comes with lettuce and thin sliced red onion, still very under seasoned.  Fries- (4.5/5) DELICIOUS! Crispy and extremely thin shoe string Fries tossed in a garlic-parsley butter. The seasonings on the fries is not at all over powering, very light garlic taste. Fish & Chips- (4) Fresh and crispy served with a Jalapeno Reuben sauce. They don't have tartar sauce available but the JR is surprisingly good. Grilled Fish Tacos- (4) Fish + Roasted Tomato Salsa = Good Pork Carnitas Slider- (2) Average. Crab Cake Slider-  (4.5) My favorite but not always on the menu = huge disappointment.  Bacon Mac & Cheese- (1.5/2) Not at all impressive.  ***NOW, here is my problem.... PRICE! Garlic Prawns Appetizer are $12 for 6 average sized shrimp, breaks down to $2 a shrimp!!! Crab and Shrimp Sandwich is (1) not made with lump crab meat, (2) extremely small blah shrimp, and (3) it's just all in all EH, nothing special.... for $17! That's a joke right? Everything I've tried seems to be more expensive than it should be.***  Service is decent, food is good, prices are ridiculous, but back patio is nice and relaxing. Come here on a nice summer day and enjoy the Bay!

Ybl_H0by-GZVAxaulCgJew.review_text: I give this place 5 stars for the awesome view, atmosphere and the crab shrimp sandwich was off the hook! Excellent!

fiGqQ7pIGKyZ9G0RqWLMpg.review_text: We saw this place on DDD with Guy Fieri. Since we were planning a trip back to my hometown, I really wanted to check it out. Oh, the excitement about going to a new place (new to us, that is). Park in the public self-park area down the way near a tiny exercise field- pseudo soccer (sorta weird but hey whatever works, right?). There were people not paying and I would advise against that, but anyway, I'm just saying.   Borrowed sombreros and umbrellas shield you from the sun's warm rays. Near the water, it's windy. Nice vibe. Lots of people. Popular place. We moved into the shade because I was wearing a long-sleeved top and it was warm in the sun. My face was glistening. Uber-tiny bathroom for customers- it should be classified as a 1/4 bathroom, seriously. Seating in front (bar) is a tight squeeze.   I ordered the fish tacos- ensenada style (roasted tomato salsa) and my husband had the fish & chips- both $13.50 each. I liked that his fish was not soggy, or greasy, and was a bit crispy on the outside but tender on the inside. I liked my tacos; a bit of a fish taco enthusiast  (ok, the best ones so far, are in mexico and hawaii). I liked it but my husband was not really impressed and didn't think that it was anything special. The servers are kind of quirky but I like that relaxed vibe (attitude/personality, not in service, though). I noticed that many people ordered the Crab & Shrimp Louis Salad. It's not a big place but many of the seats were occupied. If we go back (if my husband wants to give it another chance, that is), I want to try the corned beef hash & fried egg on the brunch menu, as well as the strawberry shortcake (one of my favorites). Large menu- wine and beer- so many different selections. Also does platters for catering.

zPWkrOzNPewQ9z2n0A3DUA.review_text: So my honey n I saw this place on TV (dine, dinners n dive... The foodnet work show) it looked so delicious, we decided to try it. The only thing I enjoyed was their cod hicama ceviche, very tasty. There fish tacos were blah and dissapointing from what we saw on tv. On tv they showed these tacos with a corn salsa n our tacos did not come with it, instead it cane with a plain picadillo.  Lesson of the day don't believe everything you see on TV.

zokfv2tiS3NEaAl9IW-LiA.review_text: Tiny but mighty!    4th Saturday of the month, gotta give it up to Native Element making the crowd feel IRiE!!  Nothing like live music on a Saturday night.  Love the outdoor patio scene on the dock of the bay.

TD-rNbkBrfPs3miz1tScJQ.review_text: We had a fun lunch! Food was yummy and waitress super nice, i will definitely go back next time we are in town. Really liked the vibe of the place.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: I keep hearing good things about here...so we finally made a point to visit.  Perhaps we should try weekend or happy hour or night time when they have music.  Instead we came at lunch on a weekday and it was nothing special.    We sat outside at a table near the water, which is not really that nice considering the water around the pier is pretty disgusting.  Anyway, what we had:  glass of Gloria Ferrer brut - $8.50 - not cold enough Lagunitas IPA - $6 - not cold enough half dozen oysters - $15 - ok bowl of clam chowder - $7 - ok fish taco - $13.5 - not impressed tombo tuna poke - $11 - had better  Maybe a cool spot to come on a warm/hot day to enjoy the sun outdoor.

3TfQDuPq7taPCODS2z6eJw.review_text: I've been coming here off-&-on for years.  I'll start off with their only real shortcoming: the service, though friendly, is difficult to get.  Not sure if that's about how many servers they have, how the tables/seating areas are organized, or what.  Last time I was there (last week) my friend and I waited several minutes for a server to ask us for our order.  I waited with an empty glass for so long after that, that I was just standing up to go to the bar to ask for another when the server swooped in.    This time I made a reservation and am glad I did!  It was Labor Day and the place was about 90% full at 4:30.  I was seated outside, which I requested.  However, it was really sunny and hot so when I saw that a table was going to open up in the shade I asked a server if my friends and I could be moved.  He said I needed to ask the gal who had made the table selection at the computer up front.  I spoke with her and ~ since we hadn't ordered anything/had a server assigned to us ~ it was ok.  I thought this was really nice of them.  Although they offer the use of free, straw cowboy hats for those in the sun, I was getting burnt anyway.  I really appreciated that they did move us.    We ordered the app wings which were good (kind of Thai lime, I guess).  I also had a pint of Anchor Steam & the ruben which was hearty and tasted great.  The pickle tasted home-made and was just a little spicy.  My friends had ribs and chicken, both of which they enjoyed.  The server was good about asking if I wanted another pint and just brought us a refill bottle of water.    So, bottom line: the service is slow to start, pretty much every time and sometimes they're slow to check in on you, sometimes not.  If you're not in a big rush, I'd say this place is GREAT!  Terrific location on the waterfront, near cool stuff like the Exploratorium, very nice seating area out back (some of which is covered) and the servers are always nice.  They've never delivered the wrong order to me or my friends before, either.

ZPyQ1_ZpU17u532Ibk6Yww.review_text: First time at the Embarcadero, was excited and oh so very hungry. Pier 23 Cafe happened to be the first restaurant in sight upon the strike of hunger, immediately endeavored inside, and was promptly seated. Table for three! Ordered a bowl of New England Clam Chowder with a side of sourdough bread. Waited for what seemed to be hours and hours (in reality, about 45 minutes) for food to arrive. Felt ignored by the waiters/waitresses. Took some time to even place the order initially. Had to ask several waiters to check on our orders. Thus, either it was a bad day, or the service in general is horrible at this cafe. As disappointment and the look of dismay on our faces continued to grow, the manager came out and offered us bread  and water (requested some time ago). Eventually, our food arrived. However, we were so disappointed at this point, that it was not at all enjoyed.   I hope others have a better experience at Pier 23 Cafe. And honestly, if you offer Clam Chowder, you should offer bread bowls. Enough said. Two stars.

mc4RK5EPUq2Cws0oEyWK1w.review_text: Went there today for lunch. So good! We have been meaning to eat here for quite some time and due to the reviews looked up the DDD episode to watch.  We had the bloody mary which was perfectly spicy and a decent size! For an app we ordered the bacon fried oysters. Now its only 3 oysters but they are quite large. Still pricey for only 3. I ordered the grilled fish tacos. They looked nothing like the ones on the show but that didnt matter. Perfectly cooked and great flavor. My husband ordered the crab and shrimp sandwich. Those who said it was underspiced? Crazy. You could actually taste the seafood in it which is a huge plus to me. I dont order a crab sandwich and hope I dont taste the crab!  All in all we had a great time there and cannot wait to go back again. Service was fast, food was great and the view is fantastic.

OP8ZVZhDls7NY7oD-Q31Vg.review_text: Enjoyed sitting outside, but not as nice a view as I had expected. Food is mediocre and a little expensive. Had three recommended items and wasn't impressed. Came here after I saw on DDD.

RSlM8jFtIk1eJrEScTm1kg.review_text: i had never been here. all day my boyfriend, best friend, and i walked the wharf. he kept telling us we had to come here. so we finally arrived. we were going to sit in the front then the hostess told us they have a heated, covered patio out back, we decided to pick it and it was sooo super cool! we had great drinks and the have the best calamari i have ever had! the waitress was so very nice too! ill be coming back for the calamari. oh and as a parting gift they give you a post card with their signature picture on the front. i wont say so it wont spoil the surprise! :0)

jaE3xXZfU03fpLvRg4RFtw.review_text: On hot sunny day, get a table out back next to the water (BRING SUNGLASSES) and just chill out.   Great food  great for lunch  If you go for dinner, only eat outside when it's hot.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: Had dinner here last night with a group of friends. The weather was warm enough to sit outside on the waterfront patio. I ordered the cod and shrimp slider and a cup of clam chowder. Loved the clam chowder. Wished the bun was toasted though. The cod and shrimp patty reminded me of a crabcake. I tried the ceviche. It was good, but I had better.   I'd rather come here for drinks and live music.

Y7M5baxByxUs8qBcrOyoqA.review_text: I only ate the oysters (stop by to use the restroom and min bill for credit card was $15) and sat at the bar. The oysters were DELICIOUS! Hostess was SO friendly. Bartenders were rude and didn't really want to be there.

iRun7Wy0frkfQPTe6ZUnMA.review_text: Came here for the Native Elements concert.  The venue is pretty cool, right on the water with a great view of it.  It was a bit cold, but there are a couple patio heaters.  Didn't have any food, but the service seemed quick for late night.  The only thing that sucks is the parking on the Embarcadero; your car must be moved by 12:01 AM otherwise it gets towed due to "street cleaning".

cDUaCLEFrM2qOlCSsJDHJQ.review_text: Yesterday was my second time to Pier 23. The first time was OK, but it was a cold and rainy November night and the only place to sit was in the cold and damp back dining area with a faulty space-heater. However, yesterday was a beautiful and sunny November afternoon, so we decided to sit out back on the deck overlooking the bay, ordered a couple drinks and dove into the menu. We decided to get the sardines on bruschetta, and fish tacos with a side salad. Man, we could have eaten twice the amount. I say this not because the serving sizes are scant, but because they are dang good dishes! The tacos came with a roasted tomato salsa (not too spicy) and an avocado sauce. The tilapia is grilled and the corn tortillas are warm and slightly crispy. I don't remember the other ingredients, but don't worry about it...try 'em! The bruschetta came with grilled sardines (not from a can, novices:) and was topped with chopped kalamata olives, tomatoes and parsley...and I'm pretty sure there was some olive oil and/or a vinaigrette drizzled on top and served on toasted slices of sourdough.   Overall, the place is trendy and touristy, but worth checking out just for these two menu items. I've heard a lot of good things about other items too...which is enticing. They could increase their menu options, and I would love to see them incorporate sustainabiy, local raised products as well as more vegan, vegetarian items. That would push them from 4 to 5 stars in my book.  There's expensive parking next door if you're driving.

IMilxXeQkwdg3ShjgQ85xQ.review_text: Absolutely gorgeous outdoor seating -- very fast and friendly service. Great beer, and excellent down-to-earth seafood selection.   I tried a swordfish entry with mango salsa -- delicious! The price wasn't cheap, but cheap and seafood rarely should seldom be used in the same sentence.   This place has some history to it, so that's cool as well. Bonus for tourists: they give you cool old-timey photo post-card with the check.

RqaWBjobKKFD6NjOG4WOVw.review_text: On the water, good service, very yummy food, prices are a bit on the expensive side but you're paying for the great location and good food (overall its less pricey than other places in the same area).

g-Syeh2bLwbV3MNbjKvp8w.review_text: M-E-H...just Meh. Way over priced and the service was OK. If I am paying $10 for a glass of wine wherein the whole bottle probably cost 10 please at least bring it to me in a chilled wine glass not a whiskey tumbler. The food was decent the service was good but a little slow especiallly for the forced 20%gratuity I had 15% service tops.  Love the locale. and the nice sunny eating spot outside. Other than that the Meh monster ate two stars.

2y32EtuYfVQinaLjfBopGA.review_text: I always loved eating on the bay - great views, fresh air - especially when it's sunny.  We went to Pier 23 at 1:10 pm yesterday and had to wait 25 minutes to be seated because we asked for a table in the shade. The hostess tried to seat us in the sun though she had our request written down - We waited a bit more, no worries.  2 of us ordered fish and chips - The fish and the fries were so salty, they were all inedible.  Really gross.  ( the portions were really small - 3 tiny pieces of fish - but they weer cooked just right ).  The waitress offered to bring us more food, but I had to go.  They probably should have just credited us for the fish and chips.   The waitress was helpful and courteous, but yuk! What a waste of money

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Sitting right on the water, looking at the East Bay:  a sea of twinkling lights,  heart thumping reggae beats pounding with my tapping feet.  I am at pier 23 and it is the place to be.

NE0Mx9NLNUi9eVUpM5v1Gw.review_text: This place rocks!  I went here for the first time 2 years ago and saw Iration play on the back patio. I've been coming back ever since. They have awesome bands play here, real kick back crowd and just a spot I always enjoy coming to!

TLnwWc0TS4N5t1vH60vueA.review_text: Came here with a bunch of people on a Friday night. The place looks small from the outside, but inside, towards the back, it is quite big.  I ordered 1 beer, 1 cider, cranberry-vodka, 1 long-islan, and a $17 shrimp and crab sandwich. Total including tax and tip was $55 for me! That is expensive. But I guess this was at the pier/Embarcadero. The food was not all that special. Although it was nice to have some crab meat. Their fries are delicious though; they were thin and fried just right!  Any who, I cannot justify the price tag, pier or no pier. Aside, the bathroom was not very appealing. There was a puddle or god-knows-what next to the urinal. =T  I would not come back again. I should just stick with Gordon Biersch.

OGRQMORnSz2stH4Ypz9vxg.review_text: love their fish n' chips and clam chowder! the coleslaw that comes with the fish n' chips has to be one of the best that ive tasted and i hate coleslaw. the only thing i hate about this place is that its always so packed, but hey! that happens when its good.

5Nwi9fjZ2NpPzpuKfpBFvg.review_text: The best place in the city to order a drink & have the staff grab it & take it away 2 seconds & 20 bucks later.

9Nv2095mBYwFRDFa1IGBRA.review_text: Cozy little bar with Live music (jazzy salsa music), nice little place for a date. Yep.  Parking isn't too far but still a bit of a walk though.

d4NZ62Jirx_LSik6KGAF3A.review_text: A San Francisco establishment, I expected a pleasant lunch experience on a sunny Friday afternoon.  I ordered the Shrimp Taco's with Cole Slaw and Dad ordered the Crab Louie.  We were lucky enough to garner a table outside in the shade, keeping us safe from those tacky but thoughtful straw hats.    My Shrimp Tacos arrived and to my dismay I discovered that the shrimp was breaded and fried, the menu in my opinion should have specified that.  The coleslaw was too spicy bordering on inedible.  Dad's Crab Louie arrived with half the amount of Crab and Shrimp.  Upon discovering the mishap the server proclaimed that she had our bill adjusted to reflect the Shrimp Crab Louie instead of the Crab Louie he ordered.  I would think she would have offered to provide him with what he ordered but I guess not.  The Shrimp and Crab in the salad tasted like it hadn't fully thawed out from its former life of frozenness.  Dad asked for a refill on his coke and I asked for a bit more water...but received neither.  Planned on ordering some coffee after eating our disappointing meal..but received a check without being asked if we wanted anything else.    Poor service, poor food and a lovely location....lunch would have been a complete disaster if it weren't for my Dad's entertaining company and the beautiful view.

l9u1pzBJRkEkmZhadnzinA.review_text: The snakebite band were excellent but unfortunately they ended at 11pm, 10 minutes after we arrived. I had the Bloody Mary which was extremely spicy and needed a topper of tomato juice. However, my compadre had the Pirate's cove, with gin, cucumber and lemon and it was refreshingly delightful. The ambiance was friendly and welcoming.

rpwP_RZDRfnnsk8OX8ha_A.review_text: Disappointed in that I reviewed the menu on Yelp prior to going...had two items picked out and was the reason for going (both the Firecracker dishes) only to find out once I looked at the menu that these items, as well as others, were not longer offered.  In fairness, what we did order was very good and the service was great, but must admit that I was had my mouth set on these two offerings and bummed to learn of their removeal. Not sure if it's Yelp's or the restaurant's responsibility to insure the menus advertised or up to date, but a major disappointment in either case!

qNYUp9gYtC20NkN0XhzaFQ.review_text: Yummy garlic/spicy shrimp and my hubby liked the clams.  Also had red velvet cake with cherry filling. Great view of bay and great service.

A2mx9xsHoIDNnd81_lxiFA.review_text: I think that this place has much more to offer as a restaurant than a bar. When I went there a Friday, the place was quite dead. (You now that a I place is dead when the band has more people than the public). A great tough bartender didn't spend a word more than the necessary ones with me. Cool guy, a mix between a hipster and a fisherman of the old days. Drinks are cheap, which is a good point too. In summary: Come here during the day and enjoy the views. Other than that, go elsewhere.

01txLohWf7VPrHAkd_YP_Q.review_text: So I ended up coming here on a Friday night to see a friend's band play.  The first thing I see when I walk in is Mr. Fu Manchu mustache bartender who I had heard about from the hate-storm that yelp have been throwing his way.  It wasn't too crowded so I decided to take his side of the bar to see if he was as bad as they say.  I was really excited to jump on the hate-train with everyone else with a new story of his terribleness.  Unfortunately, he promptly proceeded to take the orders of the two groups there before me and then took my order while waiting for the previous girl's check to clear.  I was pretty bummed out by the good service but then I got my drink and my vodka redbull tasted like watered down redbull.  So even if his service is getting better his drink pouring is crap.  The place itself did have a cool outdoor area and fortunately it was actually a really nice night out so that was cool.  Some other things that lowered my opinion of the place.  The sound guy there wasn't that good and the singer of the band couldn't even hear himself.  My friend and lead singer's girlfriend's purse got jacked which totally ruined her night.  I called before I left and asked where to park and they recommended the street right in front of the place.  I got there and found a spot like 50 feet away checked the signs to make sure it was legit but when I came back had a $50 parking ticket.  The mustache man failed to give me a good story while maintaining a general vibe of doucheness.

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: I love going for a walk along the embarcadero with a lady friend, day or night, then stopping in for a drink and bite to eat.  They make a great bloody mary and probably the best french toast I've ever had.  The patio looks pretty crowded usually but I love sitting at the bar anyway.

RPot52ZdMLplSc_3Qn0qqA.review_text: Walked past this place and was greeted by the hostess. She told me there would be a 10 minute wait for an outside table which was fine with me, I told her not to worry and I may return later. The vibe drew me back to this place, a busy environment but still very casual and friendly. When I retuned the hostess remembered me, and I was seated at a table. I ordered a Mai tai and the fish and chips. The waiters were attentive - maybe a little too much (where I was seated they were constantly walking past and checking up on me, but some people may like this service). The food and cocktail was also great - fish cooked perfectly and a generous serving! Would definitely return/recommend.

GAiftyBhDhhf4jnadUjKNw.review_text: My 1st here on the Valentine's Day with my boyfriend. I made the reservation thru Yelp which is convenience.  It's not hard to look for parking but we have to pay for meter even it's after 6pm...($0.5/hr not too bad) We got seated right away! We sat at a table at the patio with a heat lamp~ love the atmosphere~ Staffs are friendly! Food came out really fast!!! it's a plus coz we were hungry~  So we ordered the Bacon rapped Fried Oysters- I loved it~!!!! the Cod & Shrimp cake - it's alright~ Crab & Shrimp Sandwich - AWESOME!!!! (especially with the horseradish which come with the sandwich) Fish & Chips - it's so so .....   both main course comes with salad/coleslaw and.....YUMMY FRIES!!!!!!!!!!  my boyfriend had 2 glasses of Pinot & I had a glass of Rose. the bill came out to $103.XX + tips.....$120 out the door~  It's a little bit more than i thought but we were FULL!! we could've just order one appetizer...but we wanna try everything!!!   When we were on the way out, we saw they have Live Band playing!!! It's really cool!!! We will definitely come back!!!

rj_h7rG70hizxD5HQeqA9w.review_text: Pier 23 looks like a dive from the front, but they have a large outdoor seating in the back which overlooks the harbor. It took ~ 45 minutes for our hamburger and tacos to come out. The food was pretty good. Prices are pretty typical for the wharf.

gOBkinOIsBUSNP8byXKsrw.review_text: This place rocks!  Great location and really good food.  We try to make it out to the city at least once a month and when we do this is the place to eat.  If you are a local or a tourist this place is a must.  They have the best shrimp crab sandwich in the city!

ylnlAS9bCbxEcPRfxuhJCQ.review_text: A place you can go and feel like a local!  Casual atmosphere, live music, solid service and decent prices. During daylight, awesome views and awesome outdoor seating.   The signature cocktails are all on the sweet side. If you like things less sweet, order what you like (full bar and good bartenders).  Now, the food:   - The Chorizo Firecrackers were unexpectedly delicious. - The steamed mussels and clams (I'm sad to say) were sandy....not sure if they're always like this (but we wish we wouldn't have ordered) - The bacon fried oysters are a must - really good (and something you don't see too many places) - The crab and shrimp sandwich is not what we imagined it to be - the way they chop the crab and shrimp (and coat it with a dressing) leaves you unable to enjoy delicious crab and shrimp as they should be enjoyed (plus the dense bread is overpowering).   Service is good. Will definitely be back to try other menu items.

vPWjHU0ZFjy_9tEtk-8_pg.review_text: Stopped by this place for a drink and some clam chowder recently. It is truly just a no-frills, casual dining place with alot of room out back to eat under the tent and overlook the bay. If you're looking for a dressed up, expensive dinner, this is not the place!  The atmosphere was very laid back and the staff was helpful and friendly. Just took a seat at the bar and downed very good clam chowder with a beer. The prices were very reasonable too, especially for along the water.  I would definitely try this place again.

PnAtbf9IdEEOI6CbzjLJzA.review_text: We came to this place after seeing it on DDD. U know to see these places on Tv, and ur all hipped up cause it looks so good. Then u get there and ur always let down. We ordered the bacon wrapped oysters app, the shrimp and crab sandwhich, and the ahi tuna sandwhich. The oysters were ok, they tasted a little on the older side, but ok. The shrimp and crab sammy was very bland, had to add alot of S/P and hot sauce. It was a very large portion though!! The ahi sammy was good. The fries were just average. Its was nice sitting on the patio in the warm sun, with a great view of the bay!!! The food was nothing to write home about though!!!

vDJS2CZa--PYwdBJ9tKAKg.review_text: This was a good find on our trip to San Fran this month. We sat outside (they had quite a decent amount of outdoor seating, more than I expected when I walked through the place) and enjoyed happy hour drinks and dinner. View isn't the most amazing thing I've ever seen, but it's right on the water which was good enough for me! Food was pretty good too. Good stop to sneak in a little less expensive dinner on the Wharf!

rR-oVXbIOLxVvFaPtK7loA.review_text: The location is awesome and the food was great...the waitress however was horrible. She didn't put a damper on my experience, but she did not do her job well at all. I couldn't tell you her name because she never told us but I would say she was the oldest waitress there. We sat down and she gave us our menus and then walked away. After several minutes she took our order and we never saw her again. When she did show up she was talking to what looked like her friends at a neighboring table. She laughed and joked with them and even did shots with them. The whole time we were sitting there trying to get her attention so we could order more food. She then came with our check which we didn't ask for because we wanted to get a cocktail. She was always in a rush and then when we wanted our bill she took a long time to return with it. I would suggest not to have her as a waitress anymore but other than her everything else was great! I would definitely go there again, I would just ask for her not to be our waitress.

JqKh5ja8py-26JanAvn28g.review_text: Not much to say, except,  you're paying to eat/drink on the water....but you pay too much for what you're getting. The eggs benedict was a cold heap of disappointment but the bloody mary was nice and spicey.

fPtlf-qommJ3mZXvurkMiw.review_text: Steam mussels and clams were the best I've had in a long time. Combine that with views of the harbor and a cold anchor steam draft beer and it just can't be beat.  Service was a little slow and our waiter was not the best but it's hard not to have a good time with great food, good beer and warm spring day on the bay.

w3GfzsgtPAYZM67ZnWHxNQ.review_text: This joint is spunky, fun and laid back.  I came here after doing the trails at Murr's valley, and boy, was I starving. I saw this on triple D, so I figured why not? I ordered the crab and shrimp sandwich with sweet potato fries. One word- DELICIOSO! The sandwich is huge! The portion is huge!  The service was friendly and efficient. There was a live band. The food came out fast and hot. Definitely my new bay area spot.

taU-uxYwYs3nywMkVm3ELQ.review_text: I came here today with my family in the late afternoon. We had a total of 7 people and we were seated immediately. I didn't like it how we didn't have the choice of being seated inside or outside, but maybe that's because it is an outdoor seating..I don't know. But other than that, our waiter was nice and the food came out in a decent amount of time.   Appetizers: We had the Fried Calamari and the Bacon Fried Oysters. Both were really good especially the bacon fried oysters. Though sadly, there were only 4 small pieces for the price of about $12 which is really expensive for an appetizer for such a small amount on your plate.   Entree: My dad and I had the SF Crab and Shrimp Sandwich ($16) and the cup of Clam Chowder (~$4). My mom, brother, and sister had the Crab Cioppino ($28). And my brother's gf had the Prawn Quesadilla ($?) and the cup of Clam Chowder. My sandwich was delicious and I loved how they gave so much shrimp and crab in it. The fries I had with my plate were really good too, seasoned well, and it also came with a salad which was good as well. The chowder was alright, I've had better. I tasted some of the Cioppino and it was pretty good for having it the first time, but according to my brother it had a different taste than the other Cioppinos that he's had that were better.   Overall, I enjoyed my meal and I was really full to the point where I almost couldn't finish my sandwich but I did. The only thing I didn't like was that this place is pretty pricey for a college student like me but it's understandable since it is a seafood place.

szIZ_U6QG8lTWtctfuqvQg.review_text: This place was awesome! I was in SF with my dad and we decided to stop here for some beers. We sat, overlooking the water, and enjoyed our brews. It was pretty busy but a nice view nonetheless! Great atmosphere.

Yl_18gd37PvdL655ExtU-w.review_text: Maybe it was an off night for them.  I'm not usually one to complain to servers or even on Yelp, but tonight was pretty bad.  I came here for a friend's birthday.  It started off with our nice server informing us that they couldn't serve a certain type of beer because a keg exploded.  They also said that their fryer wasn't working, so no sweet potato fries were available.  No prob, stuff like that happens sometimes and it sucks but it's understandable.  I got there around 615pm, and ordered a few minutes later.  I ordered a $5 cod/shrimp slider with mixed greens (the usual fries were not available due to previously mentioned broken fryer), and a cocktail (the Spice Island Mojito).  It's pretty busy, and my friends and I are chatting, so I don't mind the long wait.  I am a patient person.  I understand that restaurants get slammed on Saturday nights.    6:50 rolls around and I still haven't gotten my drink.  It's been over 30 minutes. We mention it to the waitress, who checks on the status of this drink....and comes back to tell me that they were waiting on ingredients.  ???  Couldn't someone have told me this earlier, so I could order a different drink?  Maybe the staff don't communicate with each other about the status of different items on the menu?  I don't know, maybe something like "We can't serve anymore mojitos until the mint arrives" or whatever.  I tell her that's okay, I can wait.    I continue waiting.  Finally got my drink 45 minutes after I ordered it.  Still waiting on my tiny $5 slider with mixed greens.  Other friends at my table, who ordered 30 min after me, receive their food (which they also made a mistake with).  I mention this to a server.  They apologize, and at 7:20, a FULL HOUR after I first ordered, I receive my one little slider.  It was pretty good.  The drink was pretty good too.  But a whole hour?    Fast forward to the end, where we get the check:  nothing has been comped.  Interesting.  I work at a restaurant, and when we make a mistake, or take A FREAKING HOUR to serve someone their food (which does not happen), we apologize profusely and either bring them a complimentary dessert or comp them the item that was forgotten.  Especially when it's someone's birthday.  Maybe this place gets most of its business from one time tourists, so they don't need to make any efforts to have good customer service or make sure that people have a good experience and return in the future.  Maybe they have a restaurant policy where they don't comp things when make mistakes are made.  I understand very well that mistakes happen, but in the restaurant industry, you can't just say sorry as you're walking by and not do anything to make up for it.      Whatever the reason is, that experience was enough to make me not want to go back.  There are other places in SF with a water view that have better service, are not as grungy, and have equally good or better food.

WFz1Rtv31XJSVduwGa4TZA.review_text: met up with a friend for a quick brewskie...happy to report this place is legit!   sweet view of the Pier, beer pong tables set up outside, nice selection of brews on tap (I snagged a frosty Blue Moon myself), and pretty chill 20-30 something crowd. Drink prices aren't too bad either -- $6 each for our beers.  There's also a huge covered patio out back, as well as quite a few tables to post up at inside. There was a jazz band playing this particular time I was there -- overall, not too bad of a vibe at all! Definitely would come back here for some day raging or happy hour.

tiIIWu4ei2wH1n9bCZEEDw.review_text: People, this establishment was on "diners, drive-in's & DIVES"... were you expecting a 3 star Michelin experience?  For what this place is, I thought it was fabulous.  We sat on the enclosed patio, which was nicely heated.  Décor is totally kitsch, and presentation is what you would expect from a place like this.  The food was fantastic!  Calamari was wonderfully crispy and seasoned.  My vodka martini was delish!  Clam Chowder wasn't the best I've had, but I enjoyed it.  The bacon wrapped fried oysters had a bit of a sweetness about them that I didn't care for, but other than that, they were excellent.  Will definitely be returning to this "dive".  Trying the fish tacos next per Guy Feiri's rec.

Ojg3ZTvon7x6nb25E8IlLQ.review_text: Mediocre food and HORRIBLE service.  We took my dad here for his birthday and it was sad. We made a reservation and got a decent spot outside but the service was so so so bad. After being ignored for at least 15 minutes someone came up and asked, 'have you been helped?, No? ok, I'll do it then". Um way to be organized. My boyfriend had to ask for coffee 4 times. The food was not good at all, a little better than Denny's quality. Worst of all, they added $10 to their tip when we reviewed the bill later giving themselves a 25% tip!! They deserved maybe a 10% tip or less. Also, the atmosphere outside is that of a trailer trash picnic area. Broken & wobbly tables & chairs, sticky plastic tablecloths, and tables so jam packed together that my dad had to get up so a large woman could access her seat. No thank you. Please do yourself a favor and keep walking.

neIih87ohH1sf1WzUrpfzw.review_text: The food here is good but it's kina over priced. The cioppino was good and a decent portion. The crab sando was bland. Drink prices r good as well

lR5iuTKPjYIr0daP6hCd5Q.review_text: huge fan, how could i not be, i met my wife here!  Enjoy the sunny deck and bay views, and keep an eye out for an occasional hidden gem of a live performance. food is good, although a bit pricey.  A San Francisco Classic

ynNqMJDHT-Dwh7K1v8WTZA.review_text: Great outdoor area.  Very hopping crowing in the afternoon

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: Great outdoor patio area but fills up quick during HH and warm days   Daily deal drink $4 is a steal as long as you are flexible on your drink options (normally $7 for a draft beer)   Overall Thoughts  If this place wasn't so far from work I could see myself coming here more often (very similar to Hi Dive)

_0WAdWO7wNr19wqYYgDfIg.review_text: Great drinks (full bar), perfect atmosphere for visiting family & friends (right on the Bay's water), perfectly cooked shoe string fries, wide range of menu items (surf and turf American cuisine) and live music most days of week. Always a fun spot to hang!

r1AVLdGIUI4pMjnTZgi1aQ.review_text: This place is ok. Went there for Brunch on Sunday. Sat outside and the view was ok. Not a WOW view. We had Eggs Benedict, and they were ok. My Gfriend had the same. They serve you some potatoes and some garnish. The price was ok. We paid 12 bucks per plate.   MIght do it again. They are literally across the street from my place.  Shannon was our waitress and she was cool and attentive.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: This place is still one of my favorite happy hour spots in SF on nice days.  Far enough from Pier 39 not to be totally swamped with tourists.   Far enough from the Ferry Building not to be totally swamped with FiDi douche-bags.  Great drink prices for any area, especially THIS area.  Phenomenal views. (ask for outside but slightly covered or risk wearing one of the free cowboy hats)  As for food, the crab and shrimp sandwich never lets me down.  the chicken parm. slider is good and the fries are delicious.  the oyster shooters are interesting. I'd get two micheladas and one cucumber vodka if you're feeling brave. they pack a punch. the dark and stormy is not very good. opt for a ginger beer with light rum and a squeeze of lime. swirl of simple syrup if you like that. and the whole roasted crab is kinda decadent but equally delicious (hurry before the season ends later this month)

Yx1JT5Re_Zs0pWnNw9CtkA.review_text: This place was featured on the Food Network, so had to make a stop off and try it. I made a meal of the grilled fish tacos. Delicious and filling with good NorCal flavor. If it's sunny and pleasant, be sure and be seated outside on the deck. But once that sun goes down, it is quite cold and you'd have to move inside. Also good choices are the Tuna Poke Tostada and the Lettuce Wraps (with pulled duck).

ToVyBm-kFFR6z_USApS7pw.review_text: We had the shrimp and lobster sandwich. It was served on white bread.. Nothing fancy. The clam chowder had great flavor, but was a lil runny. i prefer a thicker chowder. THE FRENCH FRIES WERE AWESOME!  seriously a must order good seasoning. This could be a tourist trap.. du du duhhhh.. beware!  Cheers

nG5AXAdj0L6lzMzNVoT3vw.review_text: Love this place! I used to work with Matt the chef and he makes amazing food!  Cocktails were good and I love the outdoor space on the pier. Great vibe, super casual and love the live music and televisions.   Our cocktailer wasn't the friendliest, but she took care of us well nonetheless. I will definately be back many times. Love to send out of towners here :)

m15L3WqwcoE1yU4ZDuOeAA.review_text: What had happened to the hospitality of this place?? I used to come here alot back in the day and had a lot of fun!  Servers and bartenders were very helpful and friendly!  well, i guess times have changed....and for the worst too!  I came here Saturday to have a late lunch and ended up sitting at the bar because the place was packed and didnt want to wait an hour for a table.  The bartender was rude and totally ignored me the whole time.  I waited for my drink and wanted to order food but he totally ignored me and proceeded to help others that was there after me!  Its not like he didnt see me, I was right in front of him and was trying to talk to him but ignored me alltogether.  Never acknowledge me and i think if he cracked a lil smile, he would've died or something.  So, I paid for my drink and left! Never again am I coming back to this unfriendly hole of a place!  The food is good but not worth the time and effort to come back just to be ignored. NO, thanks!  p.s. "Hey you, the man w/the black cowboy hat, it wouldnt hurt if you greeted ur customer w/ a smile and attend to them as appropriate.  And IF u hated your job that badly, do us all a favor and quit! "

VqmE_gzeumKr4a8w0yzQrA.review_text: Went here on the recommendation of my sister. We got there mid day on a Monday and there was no wait.
