Sat outside on the open air patio and we all had the same thing, Bloody Mary's with crab and shrimp sandwiches. Sandwiches were served with awesome fries and a generous salad on the side as well. Great place to enjoy some outdoor seafood dining on the bay. Nothing fancy just good food.

5R6q0Av_B52KAbRvMcBotQ.review_text: There were 3 of us that went there before a Giants game last Saturday after seeing it on Triple D. I was sooooooo disappointed in this place. After being seated it seemed like 30 minutes before anyone even came to our table. The price of the Ciopinno is not on the menu so when the waitress finally came to our table I asked her how much it was and she said $17. So I ordered the Ciopinno and I could have made it better blind folded. I got 3 muscles, 3 clams, and 3 shrimp and the crab wasn't even in the shell. The crab was nothing but mush mixed in with the sauce. My Son got the catch of the day which wasn't enough food even for a 2 yr old which was $17 not to mention the fish on the outside was hard as a rock! My sons girlfriend ordered the ribs/fries with a side of Mac n Cheese. The ribs were very fatty. The fries were good and the best thing on our entire table was the Mac n Cheese, so we all took our forks to the Mac n Cheese and Fries. Anything that was seen on Triple D wasn't even on the menu, so that was a GREAT disappointment also. To top it off when our bill came, my Cioppino was $28!!! What???? i called the waitress over and asked her, "remember when I asked you how much the Cioppino was and you said $17???" She said, "oh I'm sorry maybe I misunderstood what you asked me" Seriously??? how could you misunderstand when I was pointing right at it when I asked her and she was looking at it??? OH WELL, She still got a 20% tip. Live and learn..................

5Jji5kFu7Eloe9O-99FD3g.review_text: Good food, good beer. Had po boy. Very tasty. Expensive alcohol. Good ambience. Nice patio

bJwNf-yjs8rkwhCFqSF3IQ.review_text: Awesome! They ran out of sourdough bread at 8pm on a Saturday (whaaaaat???) but other than that, totally awesome. Great service - delicious food. My boyfirend was in love with his roasted crab!

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: Ay, you like the bottle and the beverage and the munchin' outside? Yes. yes this is a great outdoor cafe and bar. From Pier 23 Cafe you can see the bay in industrial love and you can enjoy the outdoors. The indoor section is smaller but still nice. The prices are made for tourists so be prepared to shell it out.

VLMsIitSWs2rfzXBGIQ14g.review_text: I went here on a date a few months ago, and always meant to write a review just about the waitress Ariana, the atmosphere was nice a little pricey but the food was good. The waitress was a dingbat I was a little upset at the fact that I had a tab at the bar and asked her to close it out since I was having dinner there with a date/friend it only made sense to me to pay for my drinks separately, she brushed me off and said no worries she would transfer my tab to my table and proceeded to inform me they included tip and when I asked again for my card she ignored me and said she had it. ok I thought a little perplexed, finally when the bill came she informed so should I place this on your card being a cheap skate that my date was he excused himself to the restroom. and I paid the entire bill because this inconsiderate waitress Ariana could not be nice enough to follow through with a customers request, I do not mind treating friends, I do it all the time but I think as a paying customer I should be given an option not put in a corner so to speak. If I ever come back I will remember this girl and make sure she is not my server. I will probably also speak up about the last experience.

nLOF2qXMJfTbbcVtDo8oZA.review_text: Pretty dumpy joint but I can't complain because they have outside seating right on the water with a beautiful view. Food is not great, so stay safe with a quesidilla and calamari. I didn't like that my wine was served in a shot glass (?!). However, the staff was very accommodating when people kept showing up and we had to combine tables so every could sit down.

KjRbiUzhl08mc0GjGbX5cQ.review_text: Went there for lunch on a Friday. It was pretty crowded but the waitress was nice and offered us a small table for the three of us. Which wasn't the most comfortable but at least, we didn't have to wait and were in a hurry. Anyway, we got drinks pretty quickly and the service is super fast too. Got the tuna sandwich that was tasty. My parents got fish and chips and the crab sandwich. Fries are good as well and the crab sandwich comes with some chips + salad on the side and that always a good thing. As my parents said, "it gets really loud in there" but hey, they're quiet people from a small town in France! So for any other person who's used to SF, it is OK.

ApDvc0kn6Eb_-MI1R4zElQ.review_text: In exchange for the best fish and chips, we received the worst service from the waitress and the mouth breather behind the bar with the leather black cowboy hat, your typical underachieving barmen with a bitter outlook on the public who provides him with a paycheck. 15 minutes after being seated I was able to flag down our waitress so we could order and that was the last of her until we had to flag her down for the tab. Besides the staff its a great place for good seafood and cool atmosphere.

HkNOA6pgIpasnbQfs7cMdw.review_text: Good food.  Roasted crab was fantastic...good portion of crab meat and the sauce was fantastic. So was the duck lettuce wraps and steamed mussels and clams.  Sauces were really good!

eSlOI3GhroEtcbaD_nFXJQ.review_text: The fish tacos were very good.  The fish portion was good and had great flavor.  The fish and chips were also pretty good.  The coleslaw was tasty and the fries crispy.  The fish was a little too breaded.  The patio area is nice as the restaurant is quite loud, not that the patio is quiet and intimate by any means.  You have a little bit of a view at least from the patio.

MuKKwD_DLD-D3Jm66N74Ww.review_text: The fish tacos were fresh and the mussels and clams were delicious.  The service was pleasant and a perfect atmosphere after a day spent in SF.

283owBnVfGAJi0vngjoBRA.review_text: I wanted to give this place another opportunity but once again, very disappointed.  This time not with the lack of service onsite but instead with the website menu.  The download looks like someone typed it out on word pad.   I'm sure some schmo thought it would add to the "charm" or "theme" of the restaurant.  Get with the times.    Food is mediocre too.    I'm sure I'll be here again, not by choice but instead to show face at some business function.    I don't recommend this place, especially with all the other great choices in sf.

_bSNOiyPbmD2Ty3N28MESQ.review_text: Plenty of tables Tuesdays around 8pm however they were just out of  crab which means the famous crab and shrimp sandwich which we came for was not available so boohoo and only 2 stars

7XvUlAuIRF9IhWAvlr5U7Q.review_text: This was a fun stop between the ferry building and the wharf.  Its on the water so it was great on a warm February day.  I could imagine that it gets cold and windy pretty often so bring a jacket.  There are heated tents with clear vinyl windows if it gets cold.  You're paying a bit of a premium for the view here.  A bbq shrimp po' boy was $13 and beers were six bucks.  The fries were nice and shoe-stringy and the BBQ shrimp sandwich was surprisingly spicy and tasty.

2GgfNlYw84QInLy2HoNuYg.review_text: The service here is awful!!  I've been here twice, and the last time was even worse than the first.  It was a Sunday afternoon & semi-busy, but there were plenty of servers to go around who didn't do much more than hang out near the drink station chatting it up and drinking their own drinks seemingly oblivious to the many customers, including us, who sat waiting for service.    When our ice teas needed re-fills, a guy who wasn't our server took my friend's cup, but not mine, to the drink station to fill it up.  I watched him as he re-filled the cup & delivered it to the table next to us-- with the used straw and all!!  Those poor people had no idea.  Who knows how many times that happens every day!  A different server told me that he would refill my cup, but never returned with the iced tea pitcher.  Instead my jaw dropped as he walked by us drinking his own drink while smoking a CIGARETTE and didn't help anyone!    Who is managing these people?  I cannot believe how poor the customer service is at this place.  The only nice part is the big open patio on the water when the weather is nice.  I warn anyone who goes here to expect poor and unsanitary service.

1RgglFIcvBwR7b9Q4RRnrQ.review_text: I was wanting it to be awesome cuz I'm a sucker for a waterfront dive. The fish tacos were tasty but I think they had to wait for the fish to throw itself up on the wharf or something because it sure took a while. I notice another guy seated after me eating while I was still waiting. Fair or not, that is massive pet peeve of mine. The server/bartender definitely wanted to be elsewhere and it showed.  A tourist joint will always be a tourist joint.

o_Gw69Tga-mjgjwdG3dFpA.review_text: Four "claws up" for the roasted crabs at Pier 23, an "only-in-SF-landmark"!  I've known about Pier 23, on the Embarcadero, in SF, for over 9 years. I just had the opportunity to eat there on Sunday.  I knew about the music from Joseph, the lead guitar player from the Native Elements who play there regularly. But, I didn't know they had great food and it has a very interesting history -- a special ambiance, enriched with famous photos of one of SF's favorite strippers, Sally Rand and her "Posse de Pussy".    The vibe is sexy, salty, cool, and funky, all at the same time. it's the kinda place you see a mash-up of city culture, urban couture, hippy and cool. Feel/hear it as the bassman digs a deep bottom thumpy beat and the band hits the mark changes and the vocalist is getting the call and response with the audience just right and everything keeps you, the dance-mob on the dance floor, and the staff, shakin', shiftin' and movin', nothing stands still, ever.   But I digress, there was plenty of room on the sunny deck for our whole group as we waited for our table to be prepared in "the Annex" for dinner. The house drinks and a long list of special libations awaits. The compact seating arrangements, made it easy to meet friendly table neighbors learning how to enjoy Tequila shots and other intake methods.  We were all enjoying the 70+ degree warmth and ambiance by the bay. Our waitperson, Tracy, was cordial, in good spirits, helpful, talented and creative. When we moved inside to our dinner seating, it gets even better. Tracy sat us at our "Red and White gingham oil cloth covered, "big-night" dinner table (perfect for eight), and got us settled with wine and three orders of Sweet Potato fries to share. Timing was such that we were immediately served water, bread, salad and our crab. Our group happened have a local who knew to order our three oven roasted crabs, and all the dinner stuff while we were still basking in the patio sunshine.  It was terrific! The best oven-roasted crabs; sweet, perfectly cooked, drenched in bread-sopping garlic butter, and seasoned just right for keen and discerning palates. We paired it with a buttery Sauvignon Blanc. The fresh romaine lettuce hearts salad was satisfying. And, I topped it off with a couple of BBQ ribs. Others said they enjoyed their sliders. No room for desert.  So, when you want something special, start cracking oven-roasted crabs along the sea shore at Pier 23!

AWuTSbGKI2RKWa7oYdPIbA.review_text: 2 big reasons to come here. The crab and shrimp sando! And Aaron as your server. The view is not bad also.

-lBMY2Q71l8TYKo56Muf_g.review_text: This place is amazing! I don't understand why it is not 5 stars. Food was delicious try the fish tacos and Chorizo firecracker!

_aSs5dSAabuwnXUGBPzASw.review_text: Date & Time:  Weekend Brunches Company:  Michael & Friends Crowd:  Diverse Mix and Young Hipsters in the Back Patio Vibe:  Chill Decor:  Casual Woodsy and Roomy Patio in the Back Service:  Personable and Efficient Imbibe:  Beer Devour: Tacos Notes:  During The Kentucky Derby, The Pac Heights/Marina Crowd Decked out in Lily Pulitzer with The Gals in Dresses and Hats and The Boys in Pastel Shirts and Ties, Sport Coats with Khakis Watch the Races Sipping Mint Julips from The Tented Bar Area Next to the Back Patio.  Quite the Scene!

GABWrw5Et9jubriKwMUDbw.review_text: Hello Pier 23 Cafe, aren't you a welcome sight on the nicest SF day in February! I decided to bring my parents here after picking them up from the airport for a view of the bay.   I couldn't really tell what kind of crowd it attracts... definitely lots of visiting FiDi businessmen and tourists but didn't seem to be many locals.    Onto the food...  We started with calamari which was average. I liked that they included jalapenos so you could make your calamari spicier if you wanted.  For my entree I had their shrimp & crab louie salad. I wasn't super impressed. It was shredded iceberg lettuce with tiny shrimps and some big pieces of crab. It really needed more lemon!  What my Dad had looked the best - shrimp & crab sandwich - basically my salad on a bun. It was HUGE. Plus half a plate of seasoned thick cut fries. That's what I'd order here.  Mom had a bowl of mussels and clams. I tried the white wine sauce with the complimentary bread. I've had better (like at Plouf) but she seemed to enjoy it.   The service was extremely slow. We noticed tables around us getting food before us even though they were seated after us. Don't come here if you are in a rush.

GXOqBmw9XuSWXSgknf3BrQ.review_text: THIS place not only has live music ,but good food as well. I had dinner out at the pier 23 and was very impressed with my order  of muscles, and crab; shrimp & avocado salad. Since we had a party of eight at dinner also got to see a lot of there menu including there crab sandwich, fish and chips, and two specials of the day. With no  complaints about the food and empty plates  I would say its fair to assume everyone enjoyed their meals. Very Good spot if your near by to eat at or want to plan dinner or brunch.

kzkAXy9mJS6gMljzC4xGXw.review_text: Why the hell does everybody rave about this place? Ugh. It barely pulled off the three stars, I may change my mind later though.   Well, this was the second time I was here, and the first was better b/c it was happy hour during the week on a Thursday. Apparently it's a magnet for the Marina ilk and metrosexuals on the weekends. I was there on a Saturday for reggae night w/my gf and her friend and it was not the best experience at all.  I got there around 6:30 and the douchebags and their dumb bitches were just leaving, but not quick enough b/c you could still hear their empty conversations. Our server was pretty quick and attentive and made sure we were taken care of. Bartender has a light hand though b/c I had to send my screwdriver back twice! Food was regular beach style bar fare; burgers, fried this, boiled that, steamed these. Nothing on the menu really jumped out so I ended up splitting the fried seafood sampler. Shrimp were good size and decently fresh and calamari was pretty good too. What can I say, it was fried.  Then came the rest of the evening... The crowd was horrible! Stuck up snobby bitches in whack ass clothes w/their ugly feet jammed into high heeled shoes. Trying to dance like Betty Boop to reggae isn't cute, it's FUCKING LAME! Guys w/70's style haircuts, tight ass jeans and sunglasses on at night, really!? Where the fuck do these peeps come from!?  The saving grace of the evening was the company I was keeping and the band Iration playing their Jawaiian style music. I won't be back here during a nighttime event, but I may come back for happy hour.

rZ7nTwdLYD9B5zsfI1phhA.review_text: A casual, sunny spot for a cold beer on a warm afternoon, (which are few and far between in SF!)  Pier 23 is a grungy little shack from the front, with a huge outdoor deck on the back, perfect for group happy hours that stride well into the night. There is usually a live band that kicks off every night, sometimes performing out on the deck under the fairy lights. On a beautiful night, there is nothing more chill, than to enjoy a drink on the water, watching people dance, chat and laugh away.  Be warned though, the service is pretty poor here-- so only go if you are with a bunch of friends who can distract you from your empty bottle! The food is pretty mediocre too, and I definitely wouldn't eat here again. Everything is bland and overpriced, and you can tell by the taste that the guy serving you water could possibly be the chef there as well.  Don't you hate it when you have finally found a cute spot and it has shitty service.. or great service and no outdoor deck?! Argh, it kills me!

O68JpOGWfjUUQvB7ONhNlg.review_text: We went on a beautiful Wednesday and sat outside.  We got there at Noon and the place had a steady flow of people.  The only bad part of the meal was at the beginning, when the server took what seemed like 10 minutes to get our drink order.  The fish tacos were excellent!  The fish was so fresh, and all the accompaniments that come with it are perfect. My dad really enjoyed his burger.  The French fries were perfect too.  I'll be back!

6v-LnZtHBf6VZFH0NjhHWw.review_text: I'm a native San Franciscan living in enemy territory (LA).  Every time I go home the one place I HAVE to go is Pier 23.  Great place for lunch- get the crab and shrimp sandwich on fresh sourdough.  Go ahead- let them put the horseradish on and get an Anchor Steam.  Complete San Francisco experience.  My mouth is watering....

b3gQ0iwBgcFBjB9p-MKLow.review_text: Was here on a Saturday night.  Native Elements played that night, very cool and dancing too! Get there before 10 and no cover i believe.  I had a few drinks and some food while we waited.  A bit pricey and touristy than I wanted but not terrible.  Stick with sides like mac, bac, and cheese or any of the sliders if you want to save money...they are tasty too.

a8wKua129w25q4wtP26p2g.review_text: This is tough. I really wanted to love this place (as Guy Fieri did), but I found that I'd rather go elsewhere for cheaper.  Came here for a gathering of friends. We bought a bunch of food and shared it all (but not what I really wanted to try ... the crab). The food was good. The sweet potato fries weren't too soggy, the regular fries had a nice kick to them, and the steak sliders were okay. The calimari was pretty greasy, and bland.  They've got a decent selection of beer, though kinda pricey. Not really wanting to pay $3.50 for a PBR.  We were on the patio during a very windy day, and we were kept warm by their plastic canopy that zipped up. Though the amount it shook and the noise it made was scary! Don't worry, it seemed like it was pretty stable and not going to collapse.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  You can't beat the view and a good time with friends, and that's why you should go. Not for the $3.50 PBR's.

mtUQrf6AJxW_L4CP8nuVEg.review_text: Great place for good food, I had The fish tacos. Fun and on the water. Love the hats they loan you as we were there on a sunny day and it was needed.

RSQGN_R9y4worbpGudFTHA.review_text: A great place to wet your whistle while walking along the Embarcadero. They have very limited and cramped seating inside, but their outside seating is awesome. They have a decent selection of beers on tap. Great views of the bay make this a must when your in the area.

Qev3ZA_7U1XUr8jXpQmFZA.review_text: Martinis and crab. Time to be Happy Happy Happy. Saw the restaurant on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. This place rocks. It was a cold night but the beer, food and company along with the area heaters made for a real fun night.

DThXvHtrFojsBr6hIiVK4A.review_text: [Review is for atmosphere and experience. The sliders here aren't bad either!]  What a great place to make a pitstop on the way to Fisherman's Wharf or the Ferry Building! I can't believe I've always walked past this place every time I've been in the bay area and never gave it a chance. But the boy and I finally decided to give it a try one Saturday afternoon because we needed to refuel. We walked in and immediately found two seats at the bar. We ordered some beers, which at $6 a pint isn't a great deal. But hey, we were thirsty. We also ordered a cup of clam chowder and the beef and cod/shrimp sliders to snack on. I wasn't too thrilled about the clam chowder as it was watery and somewhat bland. I suppose I should have waited until I got to Fisherman's Wharf. However, the sliders weren't bad at all! The meat wasn't overcooked and there was some good flavor to it. The cod/shrimp slider was especially tasty! The sliders were the perfect afternoon snack.   What really makes this place awesome though is the atmosphere. The bartenders were so nice and made conversation with the people sitting at the bar. It's also a great place to chat it up with other out-of-town folks. The boy and I had such a great time meeting random people. I've realized that I always have the most fun at the most unassuming places. Next time, I definitely won't overlook Pier 23.

qzDsm_hKogII5g3qM9XilA.review_text: If you wants to have beer on a pier come here.

Ba-k-kg2zkLk5JNNEMzkgg.review_text: Giving my review based on my one visit for a sunday brunch/lunch. We were a group of 7 and sat on the patio for a fabulous ambiance overlooking the water. The server (Max) was funny, fresh, and helpful. The food was awesome - had the fish and chips, chicken bacon avocado sandwich, and some brunch items. I will say everything is a bit more spicy than I cared for but they were accommodating. Great pick for restaurants in the area!

v0SIp6JfkoD1-FB-hbIYOA.review_text: My Daughter and I stopped by this place while walking around SF. when were promptly seated which was great the plaice wasn't really all that packed. But we waited 10 minutes before a server even came up to us and asked if we wanted a drink. I asked for Coffee & my daughter asked for a hot chocolate. The server informed us that she would have to go check to see if they even had any. We wanted another 5 minutes for her to at least tell us that they had it & that she would bring it out as soon as it was made but nothing, a few minutes later she finally came back to our table with my daughters hot chocolate. We placed our order. I asked for the clam chowder & my daughter asked for a shrimp & cod slider. We informed the waitress that this would be our appetizer, & that we wanted to split the shrimp & crab sandwich. My clam chowder came out first, and when the sandwich came out with my daughter's slider. The place is decent but our waitress really needs some more training on how to serve customers.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: I am giving 4 stars for the bucket of beers, and waterside location.  I know the line on a hot day for the bathroom is murder, and the food really isn't all that tasty, and it can get overwhelmingly packed, but early on a weekend this is a great place to come and just chill...before moving on to another place.  Also a great happy hour spot.

tj2GPWuaJsTbR2YwP6Yd7Q.review_text: Review:  3.5 stars  My friend and I decided to play tourist and stopped here on a very warm weekend afternoon for brunch.  It was a beautiful and sunny day, with a slight breeze blowing.  Perfect weather for dining on the water.  I ordered the SF crab and shrimp sandwich, which came with a side of french fries. This sandwich had a very generous portion of seafood stuff in between two slices of SF sourdough bread.  Some reviews here mention that there wasn't enough seafood and some mention there was too much (how can you EVER have too much???) but I thought it was a decent, healthy serving.  I could definitely taste the fresh seafood and was worried about it being drenched in some mayo-based dressing but it was not.  The fries were hot and crisp and well seasoned.  It was hard not to eat them all.  A very cold hard apple cider accompanied my meal.  My friend had some oysters and the tuna poke tostadas and found them to be to her satisfaction.  I noticed quite a few people ordering the tostadas, so they must be quite good.    Overall service was okay.  As you can imagine it was very crowded out on the patio but we were served in a reasonable amount of time.  Our waiter came by a couple of times to check on us and our water glasses were refilled a few times.    Prices are a tad high, but that's to be expected when taking into consideration the "view" tax.  Hats are available for anyone to use to provide some much needed shade.  Word of advice:  if you don't want to become as red as a lobster, sit in the shaded area of the patio.  It can get really hot out there!  The view from the patio is spectacular!    At the time of my visit I would say the crowd was a good mix of locals and tourists.  The vibe is laid back and relaxed.  Everyone was there to have a good time, enjoy the view and soak in the sun.  Oh, and to eat some fresh seafood.  There is live music in the late afternoon and evenings.  Pier 23 is good for small and large groups.  I have recommended Pier 23 to some friends and co-workers and will continue to do so.

6L-VcXwxYtXjmyKKRTNLkA.review_text: "Nice dinner spot" The service hit and miss but the food was v good. We had the fish taco, tuna burger and crab shrimp sandwich. They were simply presented but nice flavours. sweet potato fries really good. Beer selection v good with mix of craft beers which was one of the reasons we picked here. Outside seating available. This is a dive bar so don't expect fine dining and judge accordingly. Give it a try as it's easy accessed via the F line tram (stops outside

42eL8VosYFbOqlHhMjiSOA.review_text: food is okay. had the crap sandwich and clam chowder.

oSmTKe2bI1iL9bPL5UbKDg.review_text: This is my favorite place in the city and has been a regular spot for me for 5 years now! Service is always excellent and food is fantastic!

IQZ9ec9kPf76ASBhazXC2w.review_text: I ate here ONCE last month and I can't stop talking about it. I live in Denver and I'm flying back next week to have some more. The oven roasted garlic butter dungeness crab is one of the most sensational flavors EVER - in the history of EVER.  I'm usually fairly detailed on these reviews, and if anything a little harsh. But TRULY, Believe me - Believe Guy Fieri - this place is SOOOOOOOOOOOOO legit. Fresh dungeness on the pier soaking in the sun and fare? Literally unbeatable.   I also had their fish tacos which were ok, but their mastering of the multiple sauces served with those tacos really made it a "grade A" worthy dish. The crab though? Jeebuz, that shiz is AMAZING. AMAZING.   I can't rave enough. I'm flying back solely for this crab. That should speak for itself.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text:
Had some good Bloody Mary's on a nice Saturday afternoon. The outdoor patio has a great view of the pier. I hear the food is good as well, however, I have yet to try it. The music was good and the staff was very friendly...
  Update: Came back for Cinco De Mayo. Patio was packed with people as the sun was finally shining. Even though the wind was strong and a little chilly, the $3 Tecate and Margarita's made me happy...

yzgBE5Hj_OBtXsy3T9K4Wg.review_text: I loved our early dinner we had here before walking down to the park for a Giant's game. We lucked out and got a table by the water. The whole roasted garlic crab was amazing, paired with crusty bread and a couple pilsners, yum!

sOQcAssKn_OpYVfCUffY1g.review_text: Yet another great Reggae spot to get your Marley on.  The fact that the party is all pretty much outside and you can get your groove on on their patio is awesome for me, especially on the 3 nights that it's actually hot here, even when it's cold, the booze and the dancing fires you up so it's nice to be in a cool, non stuffy place. Crowd here is cool, very mixed, older generation, new generation, all people who want to come out and have a good time. After 11pm, enter at your own risk.  Bar gets PACKED here, but the bartenders know how to work the crowd quick here and make some great Vodka Redbulls. The bathrooms here I warn you get NASTY, I wish they had more than what they have because the wait is long and they get dirty quick.

oT0wVaQ_0yCnWFBkJLMJ6w.review_text: I have been coming here for years and it has come such a long way. I used to come here for beer and crappy nachos, but now I genuinely enjoy the food. Since they switched chefs I find myself coming a lot more. The seared tuna sandwich is amazing! Also if you are there just for beers the burrata bruschetta and the tuna poke tostada awesome. LOVE IT! There is nothing better than leaving work early on a sunny day, grabbing a drink, some appetizers and watching the boats go by.

K2tK3VYPGpsg7UQfOxmHXQ.review_text: Pier 23 Cafe was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  I visited Pier 23 on a Saturday morning around 10:30am. When I walked in I thought they were closed, as there was no other customers in the restaurant. The server was very friendly and because there were no other customers, I got a seat right away. Even though it was a little bit chili, I decided to sit out on the deck next to the bay.   Pier 23 has a good beer selection, because I was in San Fran, I went with an Anchor Steam. They had featured the grilled fish tacos on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, so I decided to go with those.   The food came out really quick and looked amazing. The order came with three grilled fish tacos with some guacamole and salsa on the side. I decided to have one taco with guacamole, one taco with salsa, and one taco with both. All three were good, with the best being the taco with guacamole.   Friendly and quick service, great atmosphere, good beer selection, and very tasty food, give Pier 23 Cafe five stars.

Gu9l3L9-NdLhXs_fjytdxg.review_text: Best lunch on a weekend!! Tomato bisque and the steamed mussels and clams with a view of the bay :)

MsbIFptSdbUIBng23wFhbw.review_text: 40 minutes before they took our order.  Food was okay.  I ordered the shrimp and crab salad.  sure there were lots of  shrimp and crab on a  bed of lettuce that was finely chopped and what seemed to be old iceberg lettuce.  As the location on the water is nice,  it was a beautiful day.  The guy filling the water did great.  Our server however...was terrible...she gave us no forks, no knives, no napkins...I went and got it myself.  We ordered the deep fried oysters wrapped in bacon.  Very tasty but three for 12 bucks?...really?  Maybe a place for a drink and burger.  They charge 20% gratuity for parties of 6 of more and don't tell the customers.  This is what I overheard at the other table.   Sure, it is their right to do so....however, a rat move.   They also make sure to stick you with that san francisco medical tax that most restaurants pocket for themselves.

CVVtiXlqYYStQe8lGaChGw.review_text: 1. Excellent Crab & Shrimp sandwich. 2. Fantastic fries! 3. Nice outdoor seating by water.  Bottom Line: I'll go back.

jrjWfptXQF-HCEXi_xM9Fw.review_text: Nice that you are over the water and protected by the adjacent pier buildings from the wind.  Outside of that, the food is nothing to recommend.  Went for lunch and had Prawn and Crab Cocktail and a Shrimp/Crab Cocktail, both of which were seved Louis style and were just nothing to write home about.  Perfunctory preparation, at least the fish was fresh.  Also had some calamari that was overly breaded and fried too long in oil that was too hot...hence it was way too heavy and the calamari taste was overwhelmed by the breading. If you go here, go to drink and enjoy the music at night....avoid the dishes we had.

iTGeOnb-wU5v9NnhKV5nMA.review_text: I feel out of my chair. 3 times!  The first time was when I asked the market price of the dung crab 32 dollars. We are right on the water you would think it is where you find the deals.  The second time I fell was when I tasted the steamed clams. I have to admit i'm not a sea food guy I love cow and pig, but this was one of the best tasting things I have ever had in my mouth!!!!!!!! Wow it was so well seasoned and savory, we dipped our bread in the juice and left the bowel totaly clean. I SAY THIS ITEM IS A MUST TRY   The third time was as I leaned back im my plastic chair outch  Our servise was great compaired to other review we read but we got there a 3 pm on a Tuesday so it was empty.

3gu_pDfu9Qnml-Wyj16t9Q.review_text: Well...poor service...I must look like the servers ex. Too bad cause the foods alright

JPvLtPVgBtehPbVpBSH7vg.review_text: This is a cool spot.  A bit out of the way from the tourist stops but worth the trek.  We split the shrimp and crab sandwich which was top notch and the garlic fries that came with were potent but tasty.  The large patio is covered and heated but I'm guessing it is amazing in the summer months because the view is great and it's right off if the water.  Fun place to eat I recommend it!

09_Mk4Mdr6cqw0TYP6FHXg.review_text: One of the few affordable places on the Embarcadero for a full meal, I sat down here after getting a oyster craving attack. It happens.  I like the fact that they try to source locally and sustainably for their seafood. The miyagi oysters on hand were medium sized. I'm not the world's biggest miyagi fan and the meats were shriveled, but it's personal preference.  I really liked the cod and shrimp slider with fries. For $5 this is a great deal and the fries were seasoned with a red dusting of pepper that was delicious.   Pier 23 Cafe is a great hidden gem if you want the waterfront view without the waterfront prices. It can get noisy in the front of the bar but make reservations for the back. The service was a bit slow after we finished, but in general the atmosphere was fun and casual.

gOBemMfKRfpvJkz9OIw6aw.review_text: AWESOME location along the Embarcadero with a variety of great beers and some food. The patio offers plenty of opportunity to enjoy the sunshine in nice weather.  We went here on a lazy Saturday afternoon after walking through the farmer's market.   They have about 10 beers on tap, so I tried the Scrimshaw, which was pretty delicious. My friend got the Anchor Steam, which is a local favorite.  We sat in the beer garden and got some snack later, which ended up coming out wrong, but they made it right by giving us one on the house.  I would go here again and recommend it to friends.

Sqk1SP4mcDdwm9ZnyDhuDA.review_text: Great hole in the wall/dive bar with interesting seafood appetizers.  They also have live jazz music and a great view. The potatoe fries are really good!

Z93LTc0Zoxo8UhQTPDZRNw.review_text: Great view by the Pier, decent seafood, good ambiance, and great service. Would bring out of town friends here again. Great for tourists.

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: lunch review only.  its close to work and a "go to" spot for team outings or to get some outdoor exposure when the weather is nice. it'd describe it as a "divey" place - food is definitely NOT amazing, and rather expensive for how mediocre it tastes.  you'd be paying for the view of the bay, really.  i will say though, their sweet potato fries were a nice surprise.   if you're in the area on a nice day, wont be a bad idea to go in for a beer and an order of sweet potato fries. NOT worth going out of your way to come here.

JnJ_hXrsemsYafolOJa4Rg.review_text: This place was a joke!!     Their fish tacos where catfish! Catfish!  Their fish and chips were catfish! Catfish! Who serves catfish for tacos and fish and chips??    We waited 20 minutes to be seated and the place wasn't even busy!  It was 30 minutes before someone came to take our order.   The specials that were posted was from the day before and we didn't show up until 2:30!     The place was very expensive for the product that was served.   We went there because of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.   The food that was served on the show wasn't even on the menu!    If I had the option I would not give them a star.

QM9bRogGOTK8mo45bQ6dtQ.review_text: Had the best dinner I've had in a long time.  I was probably a combination of a beautiful day, a table next to the water, wonderful food and excellent service.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  We ordered and split crab, mussels & clams and a shrimp quesadilla. All of it was fantastic.  About mid-meal, I asked the waitress to suggest a white wine.  Her recommendation was right on.  I will definitely go back here when I get the chance.  Thanks Guy for featuring this on Triple D!

-0mCB5ap8xjsL9VuTv8E7Q.review_text: Favorite after-work hangout. The people are nice, the atmosphere is fun, and the drinks are good. I come here on my lunch break sometimes for a pick-me-up and it's always worth it. Thank you Pier 23 for giving me joy when I hate everything and everyone.

HVjLUH8nY_4bdJJLmBlmJQ.review_text: The draw was "Guy Spinale and The Rattle Cans."  Perfect Sunday for Pier 23 ... shimmering sunlight, rock and roll and the Giants were winning on the flatscreen above the bar.   $5 cover, okay, worth it ... the check came it was like $80+ ... "BBB I think they made a mistake on the check ?"  "No, Patron (could you put the mark over the "o" please?) is $12 a shot ..."  Okay 2 shots + 2 margaritas + burger and fries + clam chowder + seafood louie salad ... burger was good, quite tall and a little difficult to maneuver but worth the effort ... fries nice and hot and the service was friendly and due diligent ... Aw, you're on the water so it's Wharf Pricing:  Get used to it.   Guy and the Rattle Cans Band were in excellent form and P23 is an great place to be on a sunny day.   Small bar inside with a sizable, semi-covered patio for eating, drinking and cheering on the band.  You're on the water and view is lovely ... I'd go again.

LlgZ54wIgIXcgBtAbysaDw.review_text: -review for night life -nice outdoor patio, come here on sat nights when they have live bands/reggae playing out on the outdoor patio when the weather is warm -drink quality sucks -hallways going in out of outdoor/indoor areas are tight, hold on to your drink before you spill it on someone

_Y1_MtGXZbNxWqHqLhob_A.review_text: Strictly a tourist who was hungry after walking from pier to pier for over 2 hours review.  I wasn't looking for gourmet, I was looking for a seat by the water, a cold beer and some seafood.   Extra bonus - they had complimentary hats on loan for shade.  I only ordered a cup of soup and a beer.  Waitress didn't gripe. They also had a clean bathroom (weird side note: the women's bathroom had an X rated vending machine.)  Bottom line: Fueled this tourist well enough to keep walking.

uNAI8oSiOJ10aOz21AU1bQ.review_text: I'm fine paying 20% gratuity and I'm fine having awful service. I'm not fine doing both. I don't go on yelp often (see my previous one review) but the service (visited our table one time to deliver our food) was the worst I've had in a very long while. Not worth it is an understatement. I wish there was a zero rating on yelp. I would go out of my way to discourage friends from going.

wHAxtj5Gbk9xywIJRrzcKQ.review_text: Eh.  It's ok.  Not bad for a hangout, they have alcohol, a nice view and somewhat reasonable food.  But nothing special that makes me say that it was great or awesome.  The service was a major issue.  The lady who was serving me kept saying that she was just coming back after being gone for "too long"... yeah, not to be harsh, but I don't really care.  I am hiring you to take care of me and if you can't do it, then put someone else on it.  Of course, I say that here, but I didn't say a word there.  After about 30 minutes of waiting for my beer I ordered, another one of the waitresses came out and started serving the patio with a very nice and friendly attitude... and there I was wishing I had her as my waitress instead.  I'm willing to wait when I have good friendly service.  So finally my beer shows up... and then another 15 minutes later, my fried calamari shows up.  The calamari was good...  not seasoned in the breading, but still good.  They give you this jalapeno sauce and also a ranch sauce... and I love calamari, so bring that on.  Another 15 minutes later, I finally get my fish tacos.  I was a bit disappointed.  They tasted like they had bits of dirt in them... dusty.  Very weird.  No seasoning in the catfish breading and just had some cabbage tucked in the corn tortilla.  There was guacamole on the side and some salsa.  I put all on top of the tacos and some of the rice and black beans that came with it... and it made them ok.  Rice is absolutely tasteless.  Now... keep in mind... I come from Phoenix.  I am used to latino foods that have an abundance of seasonings and spices.  The beans were great tho.  I did like those.  All in all... it was ok.  The food wasn't good enough to overshadow the service issues for me to want to come back.

9Jsy3twDOrkOg9H6A-e0jQ.review_text: We will give this place one more chance only because I will be going back to see a friends band play.   But we were very disappointed with our first experience.... walked in around 9pm of a Saturday night to a very empty front of house (but everyone was on the patio getting ready for the band)... seated ourselves, and after the hostess spent 15 minutes BSing with some people finally brought us menus and took our drink order... 10 minutes later our waitress brought is the drinks, asked if we where ordering food, said not sure and that's the last we saw of her until 20 minutes later when she said the check on our table said thanks and walked away ... didn't ask if we where finished or anything. So we moved over to the bar and told the bartender and ordered another drink (he was very nice and friendly)... he even took care of a round of drinks for us, asked to order some food and would told they had to check with the kitchen because they close at 10pm so just said forget it ( only to discover it was 20 minutes to 10pm - guess they just didn't feel like cooking anymore)...   Oh the band playing was a joke.... it was a Reggie band... heard maybe half a song then it seemed like dead air for a long time like they had disappeared.   Oh don't ask about getting a cab, they said they could or wouldn't come there to go across the street to the diner of the corner... forget that they wont help with a cab either... suggest you add the cab company number to your cell before you go to the city or leave your hotel (or see if the hotel has arrangements with a service for guest pick ups).

BCcozpMUq9UGTkz_pyc2gA.review_text: I think this is one of the best spot in San Francisco to spend a sunny afternoon. I personally love the food and the atmosphere at this restaurant. I would say that it caters to everyones favorite in some way or another.  They have a full bar, imports, drafts and my favorite beer Blue Moon on tap. They also have live bands at night that change weekly. Not to mention the cover on the weekend is only about ten dollars which is a great price. I would recommend the Fish & Chips at this restaurant, they are probably the best that I have had in the city.  So if you want a great place to spend a Sunday afternoon; or a great night spot on a pier to look at the beautiful moon on a clear night in the city with live music, check out Pier 23!

iNDhsy94_VkqdgmcU7B-EA.review_text: Expensive for the food it is, small portions, and I'm not a big eater, nothing vegan on the menu and the side I ordered came with a non vegan sauce. Kids menu is $8, small salmon fillet. $7 for fries. Gorgeous view, nice staff.

bozvcy7kl2kJ2mBdKVxyUg.review_text: My client took me to his hang out. We both had the soggy fish tacos, which were good but the tortilla just fell apart so we both had to use the fork. Most places would easily remedy this with a second layer or not make it so soggy to begin with. Hopefully, they will too.

XM-gFClJcrRsUYO9Voto6A.review_text: Great place for an early lunch. Our go to place in the city. Love the patio area and the service is excellent. Don't understand the negative comments about the service. Had lunch yesterday and the food was great as usual but portion size seemed to be a bit smaller. My wife ordered the fish tacos and that was all that came with the order. No fries or salad. She said they were good and that 2 tacos were enough but also proceded to eat half my sweet potato fries! Guys, you know how that goes! Still, a great "local" place along the Embarcadero.

52oH4DrRvzzl8wh5UXyU0A.review_text: THE place to be every last Saturday of the month!!! I swear you will not be disappointed! It's live reggae by a band called Native Elements and there's a great, diverse, chill crowd that comes out. They play on the back patio overlooking the water. It's GORGEOUS on warm nights! It goe on weather rain or shine. When it rains, they put a tarp over the patio and lots of people still come out, but I'd suggest going on a warm night. The down side is the bathroom for sure! There's always a long ass line for the women's bathroom! It's a little wait to get drinks at the small bar, but it's not too bad and the bartenders are nice. The bouncers are way sweet too. There's SOOOO much free parking which is unheard of in SF! Awesome! In the daytime, it looks like a crappy little dive bar, but that's what makes it charming. =) Hope to see you guys there the last saturday of every month!

xupIYrEgJHC7hkEx8KDQCw.review_text: We had a great time here yesterday. About 75% o fthe space is the back deck, so yes the weather will have a lot to say about your experience. But i've here on a rainy night and they know how to put a tarp up. On a sunny weekend day, Pier 23 was the perfect place to:  watch a pretty Asian woman chair dance next to her much older date look out across the water at Alcatraz soak in the sun listen to the tight 70s cover band drain a couple of cocktails  The casual setting makes mingling easy, we even struck up a conversation with the ladies behind us.   -1 star for being out of WIld Turkey

lU_aNRWw8edBmIi5_NARmg.review_text: Boo! What a horrible experience at this place. We were seated, and then ignored for about a half an hour. We tried to get anyone's attention, but it was like we were being intentionally shut out. The few times a staff member would venture near us, they would almost go out of their way NOT to make eye contact. It all seemed very deliberate, like their message was, "you are not welcome here." To this day none of my party of 5 can understand why.  I brought all of this up in an email to the owner Flicka, but his ultimate resolution to the matter: ".....once again, don't be a stranger....we are a fun place with great food and encourage you to come by again.....ever since the guy fieri show we have had  a great mix of clientele and in spite of the lousy summer weather in san francisco,  we are having a good season.....once again please accept our apologies....."  I don't doubt the sincerity of his apology, but "don't be a stranger....we are a fun place...." Really? Would he return to an establishment that had mistreated him with such an invitation? I think not.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: This is the amazing-view-of the-water, great-sunny-outside-tables, see-everyone-you-know-in-San-Francisco, hard-to-find-a-table, wait-in-line-for-the-bathrooms, occasionally-deals-on-buckets-of-Miller-chill (weird taste but I kind of like it...), expensive-drinks, good-but-overpriced-appetizers BAR. Check it out on a nice day!

iQhuapjBn0RlVc_1TAPZlg.review_text: 5 star for the food.  The fish and chips, the clam chowder, and the salads are 5 star. However, there were 2 of us and we waited while 5 groups were seated before us as the hostess said we needed to wait for a "duce".  There are NO tables for 2. All seat 4 or more.  Our 15 minute wait was 45 minutes and we were still seated at a table for 4. Next time we will say we have 3 and we will be seated in a timely manner. We do love the food!!!

TwjiWvK0ZP15lzGC049oIQ.review_text: When the weather is nice and sunny expect a wait.  I suggest making reservations.  I came here to try some seafood and my bf and I had the Crab, a slider starter, and the fish tacos.  The view is amazing, the people are really friendly, and the food is fresh as can be.  I'd love to come back here again.

sZdy2AQD0gn7RMAJcu48yg.review_text: Pier 23 is a great place to kick back in the sun, share some beer and catch some luve music.  Food is your basic bar food, so it's best to stick to the basics. Nachos, quesadilla, skins! Stay away from the fish. Excellent hangover destination.  Great service. Bring your sunglasses.

LP9mGIWvtGYZW1n09xpPDQ.review_text: I hate giving a bad review but this is one place that you should probably stay away from unless you are only going there for drinks.  Came in with a party of 10 for lunch all co-workers, at the end of lunch rush, 1:15ish. Place is busy but not full by any means as we were a walk up group. Our waiter seems OK at first but then things go down hill.  Long story short we catch him saying under his breath (but loud enough that most of us can hear him) that he thought our table would be bigger and you can tell he must have won the game of Rock-scissor-paper with his co-worker and expected more. He forgets 1 of our parties drink order, then after 1 hr of waiting for our food we ask him to put everything in boxes as we have to leave soon.  Sounded Good on paper except for the fact that it took 20 more mins to get our food BUT we did get the 1 appetizer we ordered about 10mins before our food. Good to know that they are classy enough to give you the appetizer before your meal.  This whole time I'm watching other people that came in later then us get there food.  What was the Cheery on top for this great experience you ask?   Well I walk right across the street to where I work and wouldn't you know it my food was cold, yeah I love cold Fries and hard twice cooked bread!  Like I said drinks and happy hour are fun there but expecting anything else is like expecting for a politician to believe what he/she is saying.  Cheers, Tim

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: Upscale dive (as another reviewer said it) describes this place perfectly.  A great place to sit outside and enjoy the sunshine close to work - meaning it's good for lay off parties.  However, the food is not worth eating,  the beers are all cheap (as in bad quality), and the mixed drinks are pretty terrible.  Good thing I wasn't paying.  Go to Zeitgist or sit in Dolores Park instead.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Oh man. Tourist trap combined with a stuffy crowd. Oye. However, it is okay for being one of the few outdoor drinking spots in the city.

PQqVOxyOdl2i0mvj-vdLqA.review_text: Fun, wonderfully San Francisco place!  First timer, quick bite and a drink--drink was kick ASS; could not even finish!  My fried oyster slider was Yummmee!   Great staff--great view!   I especially liked their courtesy post card of all the girl butts! Cute and SO SF!  I will be baaaaack.

ei7TBYg6hVy2FlQVIKS42A.review_text: What a great way to wrap up a trip to Alcatraz. We have had not so good results when we have tired out places that we saw on Diners drive in and dives. But in this case it was a true winner. We started off with the Fried Calamari. What I think makes the difference in Calamari, which I love, is the dipping sauce they give you. the jalapeño aioli is phenomenal, we then jumped in and both had the whole Dungeness Crab. How they roast the crab and the broth they cook it is make is some of the best crab you will have.   Also if you like Crab cakes theirs won't disappoint.  Enjoy!

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: LUNCH ON THE PIER!! (3.75stars)  Before I start my review... I'd like to tell whoever owns this place they need to get rid of an older (perhaps the oldest) Brunette lady that works there who has the SHITTIEST ATTITUDE towards customers and employees. I SWEAR SHE WAS ON HER RAG or something. I would love to return and tell her she's a dumb bitch. If you hate your job, quit. She cuts customers at half sentence, she makes no eye contact, she is not polite, I saw her treat her employees rudely when they were trying to help her out. Besides that... my lunch experience was fine. The other employees who seem to work under the bitch were great employees. Polite, fast service, and attended to our needs. The 6 of us sure tipped our server pretty nice.  Came here with a group of friends on a Saturday early afternoon to have lunch. I kept my order simple because I had a light appetite.   HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.  CHICKEN PARMESAN SLIDER w/ FRIES ($5) - that simple! I didn't expect the slider to be that tasty or of that size. It was just right for my small figure. I wasn't that hungry but it was better then eating a boring salad. Slider was the size of my palm and a plate of shoe string fries. I love shoe string fries. They were very tasty shoe string fries.  My friends enjoyed their lunches too... some had the clam chowder, fish & chips, sliders, sandwich, etc.  Will I be back? YUP.  Until the next review...

-Gnu_2uozedUI_NDUdSf4g.review_text: Great local SF spot for seafood.  Right on the water - worth checking out.

Os7XnHJYLsHFhOsiMLQ6mA.review_text: nothing like celebrating short-lived winter sunshine in SF by sitting along the pier. Pier 23 is a great place to enjoy the sea and enjoy the variety of seafood sandwiches that they offer. there's outdoor seating which I def enjoyed, otherwise you can sit inside, where the decor is a bit funky.  I ordered the Marinated Ahi Tuna sandwich and it was delicious! The meat was extremely tender for ahi, and all the fixin's that came with the sandwich really intensified the flavor (pickled something, I forget). It also comes with a side of mixed greens tossed in some standard house dressing.

BgWaJDXga_iqOqxIYaxrrw.review_text: I come here for the drinks and the music.  Food is average a little pricey.  Cannot beat a sunny day on the patio that's for sure.  Service has always been good.  It does get rowdy at night.

1v9vpiCEoEPi4MrlGja7gA.review_text: Visited after a Giants game.....Crowded but good service.   Shrimp Crab Sandwich was excellent. I think one of the best sandwiches I have enjoyed. View was excellent....I will put this one on my short "When my friends and Family from other areas come to visit" list.  Margarita was strong and perfect!!!!!!

9xi0QUx4e-HCMO1FifqDgg.review_text: I love bringing  out-of-town guests to Pier 23 because it looks like such a dump on the outside but the outdoor patio is fabulous!   Brunch is the best. They do a great job with the eggs. Always awesome service.   Here's the best part .... dog friendly patio! Woo!

Ge8eOiuyuTKDJq81VzPvLA.review_text: Came here after watching diners drive ins and dives......  Sorry Guy, the food was just ok and the service was mediocre.  Had the burger, it's just a burger and the young lady had the fish taco's.... She was very disappointed. Parking was almost impossible

dAPmvtgc8WHLv6AXkrtCRw.review_text: I heard about this place from a friend who saw it in the food channel.  I've past by this place many times, but I never thought about trying it until now.  So, my wife and I ordered the mediterranean salad, fish n chips, and seared tuna sandwich.  Let me just say, "Wow!"  I was pleasantly surprised how good the food were.  The fish and chips is the not your "ordinary" fish that I normally get at seafood places.  They must either make the batter themselves or use a different brand.  Their fries are seasoned and are thin, so it has that nice robust crunch with each bite. Yum! The salad was also really good.  I wasn't expecting to be "wowed" by the salad, but I was.  The dressing is not overpowering and the cheese was delish.  My wife's tuna seared sandwich was also good.  It was cooked correctly (not over or under cooked), complemented with an aioli dressing.  What a superb combination.   What can I say, great view, great service, and great food.  Now I understand why this place was feature in the Food Channel.  It's worth eating here!

ktrQRrA4FfFrIwh0n9NO_Q.review_text: Lunch review: I went to pier 23 on a whim yesterday morning just as they opened @ 11:30am.  A beautiful Monday morning beckoned me to sit outside with a view of treasure island and order up some seafood & a beer for lunch.  I was apprehensive that the quality of food would reflect the divey aspects of Pier 23 and not the beauty of the day... but luckily that wasn't the case! I ordered up muscles & clams followed by fish tacos.  The steamers had plenty of morsels for two and the broth was buttery, not too garlicky and had a nice spice.  Just as I finished mopping up every wonderful flavor, the fish tacos arrived.  Wow!  Mexican style big chunks of fish with string peppers, onions & lettuce... just amazing flavors.  The mahi mahi had a mild spice and a caramelized flavor that put all the fish tacos I've had in Hawaii to shame!  I was expecting much less from the food but it was soooo good I had to tell you about it! Pier 23 rocks even at 11:30AM!   - just saw this online as I was writing the review: youtube.com/watch?v=IGc9…

7UAROWm9EPRb9xcCD-KqIg.review_text: We were anxious to try this place since it was featured on Anthony Bourdain's new show, LAYOVER (San Fran episode). While it was a chilly day, they still had semi-outdoor seating that offered a gorgeous view and was covered and heated. We were hoping for clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, but they only offered the bread on the side. Nonetheless, it was tasty chowder. We also tried the fish & chips which came with spicy seasoned fries and coleslaw. The shoestring fries were excellently seasoned, but the coleslaw was a bit overdressed and bland. Overall, worth the visit for the view.

XvKdp9PB4rKJKwI798mJgg.review_text: This is a cute little place on the Embarcadero that I've seen a thousand times but never been to before. We came to kill time and grab a bite before a tour of the Tcho factory nearby. We split an order of calamari and sat at the bar. I also had a Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary wasn't that good but I really liked the calamari. The bar tender was super friendly. I loved the "outdoor" seating area with the cover right on the water, although we didn't sit there this time.

pB2k7SlOIg24HUb-2dewIg.review_text: Loved this spot! Right on the water, this fun low key spot was serving up great margaritas while my friend and I sat by the water taking in the views.  We ordered the fish tacos and ahi sandwich and split it so it was a win win! The garlic fries are a must! Also if the sun gets too bright for you, they'll give you a fun cowboy hat to wear, I did!  Can't wait to go back to this spot!

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: It was fine! Not awesome. Like an average sports bar, with lots of tourists (which brings it down), on the Bay (which brings it up). Caesar salad w prawns was respectable.

vaQPHmzVAxOGNEtG3YLqjQ.review_text: So I went back and this place is not how I remembered it....it is small, dirty and crowded...not to mention way overpriced. I know it's not the servers fault but $5 for ONE mini hamburger is a little rediculous!! My Dad got attitude for asking for a new glass because his was dirty. WTF? One of the waiters was nice and trying to make up for the other shitty service....I like the view but that is the only good thing about this place.

oGgl5QykGSFhv67Tx0TN9g.review_text: Great vibe! Delicious eats!  Here's what I ate: Dungeness Linguini: Great! It had just enough crab.  Surprisingly sweeter than it looks, but still very savory, too.  The portion seemed to be on the smaller side...or was it just a really deep bowl?  Then again, how much pasta can a guy eat?!  Mussels & Clams: EXCELLENT!  The sauce that this is in tastes soooo good that I'm drooling right now thinking about it!  Excellent portion of freshness!  You'll want extra bread to dip into the delicious sauce.  Matter of fact, you'll find yourself dipping everything into the sauce, i.e. french fries, linguini, fingers, etc...  Crab& Shrimp Roll: Great lunch dish!  It's a cold sandwich that's packed with more mini-shrimp than crab pieces. It tastes very refreshing and I could imagine eating it on a warm summer day.   Warning: It's very large! As a bonus, it comes with an EXCELLENT side salad that complements the sandwich perfectly.  Don't forget to squeeze the lemon on your sandwich!  We got there at 6 and was seated at 7 on a Wednesday night, but it was worth the wait.  The place is pretty small, especially if you want indoor seating.  So, go early.   Also, it's pricey, located near Pier 39, but I do appreciate how it's not too close to that tourist trap.   This is #32 on my quest to eat at all the Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives in America! (or at least in California).

bjRCXVX2J7BlekuyN_Hrrw.review_text: San Franciscan Pro Tip: this is where you take your parents when they come to visit. They will love the waterfront, appreciate the reasonable prices and casual dress code, and try delicious local seafood. When we went at 8pm on a Friday night, we were seated immediately and there was a great live jazz band playing in the bar. It's now my father's favorite spot.

3syzIf7C5LjCmk522qB1UA.review_text: Should be a dope spot. Beer garden... Patio... And nude cowgirls in the logo. But mean & sh!tty bartender (dude w leather cowboy hat who hates customers & life). Also, asked hostess if I could eat while I wait for friends and was told no, I'd need to wait... But all the tables are open & waiters doing nothing but standing around?! So this place can suck on my popcicle.

D9mgcl6MFE3vRKTVadFFdQ.review_text: It's a cute lil spot to hang out with some friends on a nice day/night. Good beer selection but a lil ghetto the one time I went. Would it be my first choice for a place to chill? Nope but I wouldn't knock stoppin' by for a quick min...

yhW5dZR4R7sjOEMGdv8rKw.review_text: Loved the food, all of it was good.  I am from Idaho and I tasted some of the best fries I have ever eaten at this place.  I also had the crab sandwitch and it was pretty good.  But oddly enough the mac and cheese is where its all.  Hands down the best I have ever tasted, I was blown away.  Service was crap but they were busy and may have been short handed it was worth the wait.  Ate with four people and everyone loved their meal price was worth the quality of food served here.

Dm6CKWzuiZvIhUj9feJYDw.review_text: Nom nom!!  So glad we stopped here to eat on our way walking to Pier39.  The service was great, the food was delicious, and came out very fast, even though the place was packed.  I had calamari (which was delicious) and clam chowder with sourdough bread.. my fav.  And the bf had oysters (ew but whatev lol) Very impressed and cant wait to go back!

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: I have been by this place a hundred times and never stopped. My best recollection was that it is some kind of biker bar (but I think that may be lawyers with Harleys). I'm giving them a little extra love just because I can see it would be a really cool spot with the right group of folks. Right now, there is a rotten view of the former Teatro Zinzanni but I'm sure that will be some spiffy boat race stuff really soon. My friend had a couple of sliders and I got the burger. That's not really fair, when I compare all burgers to Marlowe/4505/Spruce, but it was okay. The sliders were pretty tiny for five bucks, but I feel this is basically a drinking establishment that happens to have some food. The staff all appear to be from different eras on different continents, but they were pretty friendly and efficient. Will likely be back as race time approaches...

d8zp3ILsDnjx986RsC3R1g.review_text: Fish and chips had a lil kick to them and were delicious!  Chowder... It was chowder.  Beers were great and service was awesome!!!!   Kids menu for my nieces was super good!   Avi was a terrific server and Alex was supper funny and fun.

zwLq4aVDSH7HyMbVjKfkRg.review_text: I don't venture down to the Embarcadero much, however, now I will! Pier 23 is a fabulous setting on the water, an incredible menu, and lovely servers. I enjoyed the Crab & Shrimp Louie. Mounds of seafood sitting on a bed of iceberg. Table mates enjoyed Steamed Mussels and Fish & Chips. I eyeballed the table next to us and saw the Fish Tacos and Flat Iron Steak Sandwich.   Oh, I wanted a pint of beer (great selections on tap), but it was a business lunch so instead, I had the Peach Tart  A La Mode.  I understand that on Monday nights, there is a talented guy on the piano. Once I check it out, I'll update my Yelp. Meanwhile, I'm going to dream about the Cioppino.  Parking is on the street and sucks. $74 a ticket, the highest in the United States.

oUXygzOtg4Hg_hM7pPDrTw.review_text: This is a cute place right on the pier by the water with great ambiance and attentive waiters ;) Started with some fresh oysters on the half shell..mmmmm mmmm so fresh, buttery and delicious!  Being in SF we had to have clam chowder, I can't say it was the best I've ever had but it wasn't bad.  It would have been nice if the bread was complimentary instead of $1.50 for 4 little slices.  I figured I would try the Fish and Chips since they were Guy Fieri approved ;)   The Fish N Chips were so yummy you could taste the beer in the golden crust over the flaky fish, it is served with a mountain of string fries that are sprinkled with a chili type of  seasoning that definitely makes the fries memorable however the coleslaw was a bit of an after thought and kind of bland.  It is a little pricey but of course it is in a  touristy area and by the water.  Would I revisit...maybe, there are tons of other restaurants to try! Service was great, food was good and with my bill I also got a postcard showing a line up of eh hem nude ladies showing their backside!

zDfGiR43eBZjh3jtu9faVA.review_text: The crew and I will only come here on the last saturday of the month for Native Elements (Live local reggae band).   Tiny on the inside, but the band plays in the back so thats where you should be. 1 full bar inside, and 1/2 a bar in the back with a limited selection. be prepared to wait for drinks inside.  $10 cover and no strict dress code. Pier 23 isnt the fanciest place or the roomiest, but its cozy and a great place to chill and listen to good reggae played by a live band, NATIVE ELEMENTS!

glv-rSqh8Us8EH_lvlwVqA.review_text: First time here. I have to be honest I was not impressed. The clam chowder was watery and lack flavor. I also had the crab & shrimp sandwich that also lacked a lot of flavor. The menu was small and a bit expensive for the quality of the food. We did order French fries after being ask for our preference and got potatoes chips. Lol. Hmmm. They do have a good location and it always seems busy. I have to say I am not impressed more disappointed in the lack of tastefulness in the food. I will continue to explore other seafood restaurants for some quality clam chowder. How do you get clam chowder wrong in the Bay Area!? That baffles me!

SVBVkIgLScjTI6tOdeOurw.review_text: Went here on a whim after a long walk down the pier and loved finding this gem! Inexpensive beers for the view, not crowded at all on a gorgeous day, and great service. Ceviche was amazing, highly recommend on a warm day.

VqvFTuBlltncR4qvKdxR0Q.review_text: I love sitting outside on nice days here! Service can be slow, although all of the food is really good.  I recommend the nachos!!

nk-yTC9SgtC2Gxyo83E61w.review_text: Arrived on a Sunday morning at 1030 for the brunch. Brunch really only consists of an additional ten or so item menu in addition to the regular menu.  Opted for the regular menu and chose the fish tacos which were delicious. Three of them, fish cooked to perfection and the spicier reddish sauce was terrific.  Unfortunately it was a cloudy cool morning. I would go back in a heartbeat but on a nice sunny day.

ZQXwgw0OT5YiftlbuUF3Hg.review_text: I opened my yelp account to talk about this restaurant.  This place sucks!!Not a litttle,A LOT!!!I went there one saturday around noon with my girlfriend to eat enjoy the view.The view is the best thing about this place.I ordered fish and chips and she ordered nachos.  The nachos were about twenty tortilla chips with cheddar cheese-MICROWAVED.Salsa, guacamole,and sour cream all on the side.My fish and chips-salmon!Who the hell has salmon fish and chips??No mention of this in the menu.By the way-salmon and malt vineger-terrible combo.I got a bloody maria to drink with my brunch;not only was there absolutely no booze in it,it was in a rocks glass instead of a pint glass.for 10.00.I want to tell anyone who will listen-buy a couple of sandwiches and a 6er of Pabst Blue Ribbon,and sit on the pier and enjoy it.That is money well spent;and about thirty dollars cheaper than what i spent on GARBAGE at Pier 23.OH-- and by the way Guy Fieri,this place IS money- dirty stuff that you should'nt put in your mouth.

nEEDPo_Uht4OoW6A-jS1ng.review_text: While the food was good and the atmosphere was relaxed, there really wasn't any aspect that got me excited.  The atmosphere is very much beach shack, which I'm fine with sometimes.  The plastic lawn chairs and wobbly tables can be a bit too casual, if you get my drift.  While it is set on the water, your views are locked in by two pier buildings on both sides, so the view is not quite the panoramic extravaganza.  I can see how it would be fun for brunch with a band playing and lots of cocktails though.  The food is actually very good.  We had some fried calamari and fried artichoke hearts to start.  Both were very fresh and tasty with great sauces.  I had the BBQ shrimp po' boy.  It was pretty good though a bit messy.    If you're looking for a very laid back bite on the water, I wouldn't rule it out.  Though for the money, if you're craving waterside dining, I would head to Slanted Door or Waterbar.  Close in price but a little more upscale.

BtpNrj4gFDvXpzLkJISujg.review_text: I was extremely excited to go here as it was feature on DDD. Parking was surprisingly easy, and our wait (given that I was smart enough to make a reservation) was short.  The location and view from the back patio is phenomenal. It was a few days after the America's Cup and we were able to see all the buildings, banners etc left up from the event.  Our waiter seemed a bit distracted, and took a while to get our drinks, and bring us our food (and our bags to go!).  A friend of mine asked his opinion on certain dishes and even though you never like to hear staff badmouth anything from their place of work, it was refreshing  that he was so honest.  I ordered the Poke Tostadas and they were pretty delicious. They come three to a plate and I could barely finish one and a half! My friend ordered the salmon with capers, and that was pretty tasty and filling too.  The food wasn't outstanding, and I guess if you can afford the dungeoness crab (which was featured on DDD), then I guess it might be worth the hype. I guess I was just expecting more from the service and the food?

7AdDyYheTMs-Rmb2denmkA.review_text: A great place to eat in san francisco. I have been here twice now and had great experiences both times. The food is pretty decent. Nothing amazing but the view and atmosphere makes it worth it. It is usually fairly crowded especially if you want a waterfront table but they have a bar area to kill time while you wait for a table. The staff is helpful and very friendly. There is also a lot to visit around this cafe before and after your meal so I recommend a visit here!

1VenfvAt4gDV0121EHvKug.review_text: Beautiful day in San Fran, just finished volunteering for the Women's Nike Marathon. Decided to go to Pier 23 for some lunch and some cocktails... Bartenders were awesome very tentative and lots of conversation. Food was good, drinks were great, but this one server name  Jennifer was awful!!! Horrible customer services, never came back to check on us, she wasn't attentive. The employees that brought the food out was more attentive than Jennifer.. If you go there its best to sit in someone else's area!! I will revisit Pier 23 because I enjoyed the atmosphere.

n50tpqf2ohayEnuG7ZY0pg.review_text: The worst service EVER! Sometimes waiters/waitresses want to be "cool" with the guests to build a relationship and get more tips but this woman was just trying too hard to be cool and not trying at all to be a good server.   Not only did she ask like 5 times for our drink order in her 1st encounter w us (party of 2), which was 2 Bloody Maries (simple enough) but she comes back to check on us asking "where'd these fuckers go?", pointing at the empty chairs. It was only two of us from the get go and if we did have a bigger party I didn't appreciate that she was referring to them as "fuckers".   Another thing, out of nowhere she comes with a bunch of drinks. Again, its only two of us. She seemed very confused about who ordered them and at this point I was already concluding that she's drinking on the job. Oh, and she asked to take a selfie with my girlfriend and me in the middle of asking for another round of drinks, which... Yes, you guessed it, did not come, EVER!   Anyway, we ask for our check and to no surprise it was all wrong. We were being charged for 5 drinks that we did not order on top of our order. Needless to say, she did not get a tip from us.   I probably will never go to this place again. We ordered the chips and dip and fried calamari and they weren't spectacular but not terrible either. Bloody maries were also just ok.   Btw, I have the selfie of this girl and I will post it on the photos for this restaurant :D too silly.

f99sfYCDasmy1RQgb2X5ww.review_text: Made reservations for a team lunch on a Friday due to the great reviews I had gotten from other coworkers. Unfortunately, I did not have the same experience. Even though we had a reservation, we still had to wait in line to get into the back deck. It took at least 10 minutes to order our drinks and another 20 minutes to order our food. It was ridiculous! I can definitely understand if the restaurant was incredibly busy, but it was not and our table was ignored most of the lunch. The tuna poke was good, but it was not worth the money and the Fish & Chips which the majority of my coworkers had, appeared very greasy. The views and back deck could be great during a warm day, but if I ordered and picked up my food myself, it might be worth the wait.

YFnFvVNAiyEbioZ6xLpSkA.review_text: A for location  A for circuses A for menu creativity  I came in for the Chioppino, but since it was brunch, there were a couple other items I could not pass up.  With the endless choices for great seafood spots in the area, I do not know how this one stacks up, but since I saw them on DDD, I felt I was in store for a great experience, and I was not disappointed ....  A for Everything!

vZSm2ZFO0ryY1kh4EvNQig.review_text: Okay, so truth be told I have never actually consumed food here lol but I have heard it is good. However I am here most last Saturdays of every month :)   On the last Saturday of the month (on most months) a band called Native Elements plays at Pier 23 and they are amazing! Drinks are pretty cheap, and the crowd is super chill, a major plus is parking is free and the music is absolutely fabulous! They are a mix between reggae, funk, and even some Latin rhythms thrown in there. Great vibe and a wonderful way to spend a Saturday night!

R7i5b-1KCbYml1zVrJGr3g.review_text: Awesome spot! Crab cakes, cheese plate, crab legs, CRAB CAKES! Everything was wonderful. Def recommend.

l5LptwI5jwWLLnTLoCMBPA.review_text: Favorite new place to eat on the Embarcadero! We are fans of Diners Drive Ins and Dives. We try and hit at least one of those places whenever we travel to a city where they are. This one ranks up there with some of the best finds ever.  Sure, parking is a crap shoot. But it's the Embarcadero and that's just the way it is. Once you get inside the hostess will take you to the huge back patio you didn't think was there from the front (they have live music in the front bar area in the evenings and it's likely loud and cozy) and ask if you want to sit in the "sun or shade". There's a mix of tourists and locals and that's always a good sign. You sit right on the water...not a fancy view but pleasant and fun.  Fantastic bloody Mary's! Okay beer and wine selection. Home made lemonade. Fast wait service once you sit down. Nice so far.  The oysters were ok...not too small and really fresh. But for $2.50 EACH I wish I had ordered the steamed mussels and clams my sister did. They were fantastic! Probably the best of anything we all ordered that afternoon. I'm not sure what they were thinking with the odd vinegar dip for the oysters. I love vinegar and it was so not a match for the oysters...so not.  The clam chowder was plenty warm in the cool San Francisco weather. Lots of nice clams and flavor. The bowl was well worth the $7. They will charge you extra for bread but there is enough to share in the $1.50 side order.  Another highlight was the Agave Nectar Scallop Ceviche at 14.5. With grilled corn, avocado, red onion with roasted poblano mole it was a very unique and tasty ceviche. The grilled corn was a brilliant addition to the usual ceviche.  The hostess was very friendly and helped us buy some of their really cute t-shirts. The waitress was not very friendly but brought everything quickly and correctly.

pn0uS2Q7rzjKQMCBsIO83A.review_text: So after stuffing our faces with goodies from the Ghirardelli Square chocolate festival, we were craving some real/non-chocolate food. Knowing that there would be massive crowds all around Pier 39 we decided to walk down the Embarcadero where we eventually found this place. Overall, everything was just okay. I shared their chicken, bacon, and avocado sandwich with a friend. It was pretty good and pretty satisfying. My other friends said the stuff they ordered was nothing special. One had their baby back ribs and she said they were kind of dry.  The service started out okay. Our waitress came to see if we had any questions, but we weren't ready yet so she gave us another five minutes or so. But after we ordered, that was the last we saw of her. My friend wanted to add something to her order but we didn't see her anywhere and after about fifteen minutes, we had to ask someone else to get her for us.

jX52sZoojxyYV2viWNyO7A.review_text: Maaaaannnn have I gotten bombed at Pier 23.   I can't count how many times I've come here and stumbled out some 5 or 6 hours later after drinking some 15 or 20 beers or vodka tonics.  The view is amazing, but bring a sweater cuz you can seriously freeze your ass off if you come here and the breeze kicks in, which it pretty much does from August through May...  Basically, if it's June or July, you might be able to get away with a t-shirt and no jacket, but the rest of the time, beware.  Then again, you can just up the alcohol content and drink shots instead of beers, and you'll get warm enough that way.

kbtWpV_hc9U7LWdDhDqu7Q.review_text: GREAT crab/shrimp sandwich and mussels.  Service not the fastest during a gorgeous sunny day in SF during midweek lunch rush....but the food was so good it didn't matter.

9_A5L81vBpjBRSlTjeWKZw.review_text: Great place to enjoys a few drinks and a meal right on the waterfront. If you're on the Embarcadero but what to avoid some if the tourist mayhem, this is a good bet. I work nearby and come here often; the food and drinks are solid, always good, if a bit pricey.
