Fish tacos, fish and chips, and the bowl of mussels and clams are favorites. The strawberry shortcake was huge and fantastic, with real whipped cream! Nice ambiance. I'm usually here for weekday lunch or early dinner, but later in the evening (weekends?) they've often got live music.

gTxigDuZ9BIKmkRsjQ5vMA.review_text: This spot was once the place to go.  Local groups played some good jazz, blues, soul, and reggae on week nights. Plus, they served stiff jack and cokes.  I started going here in the early nineties as a kid and I loved it.  It was a sweet little dive bar where you could enjoy your whisky buzz on the back deck with a bay breeze while listening to live sf jazz.     When I worked downtown we were there all the time for after work cocktails.  They had amazing crab sandwiches and it always a party having lunch on the back deck.  So, two stars for the way it was back in the day.  Pier 23 must have changed ownership or something since then.  I took a friend of mine who is from New Orleans there for a drink.  He said he had never been.  So, I hyped it up, telling him how this is a classic bar, one of the city essentials, etc.   When we got there it felt like I just stepped into a bar in San Ramon.  The crowd projected a "not from SF" vibe. Then as we patiently waited to order some drinks the bartender completely ignored us and continued his knuckle head banter with his co-worker. We stood there sort of dumbstruck, for five to ten minutes, as we waited for him to finish his conversation.   Ummm, "Two beers please, hello." Nothing. Then finally he turned to us and made some strange remark, and gave us attitude about our order of two Anchor Steams.  I just looked it him thinking, "are you f*uking kidding me, dude."  We quickly drank the beers and took a b-line out of there.  And on the way out I was showing my friend some of the cool old photographs they have of bluesmen, and some guy coming in made some weird racist remark about the photo. Lame bartenders and a worse crowd...  It is incredibly disappointing when one of my old haunts completely fails me.  Bummer.

uTLFg078Dnkp54BZUXznhw.review_text: I wish I had had the full crab, but instead I opted for the cheaper (although still $18 crab and shrimp sandwich). The sandwich itself was ok. The sweet potato fries and regular fries were awesome. You can't beat the view, and I think it's probably one of the cheaper establishments along the Embarcadero, which has its perks and downsides.

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: If you want the outdoors, sun and booze on a nice SF day and to gaze upon the bay, hit up Pier 23.    I want a Pier 23 t-shirt just cuz it has old school cowgirl asses all over it.

Dc4iTRQD3kPDUqhY6H7_Ew.review_text: Went here for lunch with team. We sat outside in the back of the restaurant and had a nice view of the bay and Treasure Island.  For starters, we had the calamari - a little spicy, but very well cooked. Chorizo Firecrackers - Spicy wrapped chorizo goodness in cheese sauce with sour cream and chipotle (smoked) on the side. Probably would not get this again, but definitely worth a try or to share. Crab bisque - delicious crab bisque goodness. It's exactly what you would expect from crab bisque.  Clam Chowder - San Francisco staple. If you are craving clam chowder, you should get it.  Shrimp & Crab Louie salad - lots of crab & shrimp, definitely a good choice. Shrimp & Crab Sandwich - always a favorite. Steamed Mussels & Clams - recommended by our waitress and 3 people got this. They weren't disappointed and nobody was complaining. It looked delicious and was a very good portion of clams & muscles plus there was plenty of bread for the broth.    If you like mussels, clams, crab, and shrimp this is a good place to go.

BCDZA-vLGy4rS7GAHejMlQ.review_text: The place for reggae.  On nights when local band Native Elements is playing this is the place to be.  Good drinks, good music, good crowd, good time.

KkFqi-CGPArDPfXsMXQfBQ.review_text: Loved it!!!  Great spot, great view, great beer. Chances are, if you're walking to the wharf you'll pass this place.  Get yourself a drink and then walk out back and enjoy the view and the breeze for 10 mins.

LIJyH-dZO7SERCOPjvRIGA.review_text: As I'm getting off of work on Friday night, I realize how beautiful Of a night it will be in San Francisco. I quickly hop on the muni and get off at embarcadero to take a leisurely stroll. As my tummy begins to rumble and as my feet begin to get tired, I stop in to Pier 23 w the bf.   A lady approaches us and we get seated outdoors, right away. I have been here before and have always liked to sit outside because the view of the bay is one of a kind. Also, they have a great beer garden for those great SF giants nights!   Food: (see photos)  I ordered the fish and chips. I have ordered fish and chips at MANY places and besides London, this is probably some of the best I've had. Ask for extra of the spicy aioli sauce! The coke flaw was surprisingly delicious, the cod was perfectly fried and the fries were also perfect, not too greasy. We finished the entire plate and I highly recommend it!  Bf ordered the chopped fresca salad and also, enjoyed it. However, he had half oft meal... So who knows ;)  Ambiance: Perfect! Sit outside and enjoy the view or sit inside and enjoy the live music!  The only reason why I can't give this place 5 stars is the service. The women that work there are running around like maniacs, even breaking glasses of beer because they are so rushed. Honestly, there's just not enough people working there. They really should hire at least 2 more people!  I will definitely be back and highly recommend this place!

41nlHIIkh19ENWF8X2_CRA.review_text: I had the fich tacos and they were really good.  I also tried some of my husbands fish and chips and they were also quite good.  It gets busy, so a reservation is a good idea.

w7yLf32CcJbi8or4wAiUTQ.review_text: There are only 3 good reasons to go here, drinks, view and if lucky the right hostess. Aside from that, the bar tender staff are oblivious to you, the wait staff almost seem mad at you or someone near you and the food is LOUSY. All and all with the right company and enough drinks, this is a great spot, just expect to spend too much for less than quality food.

t6sUS5CZrFV9Ujwfbkv2jg.review_text: I ordered the crab and shrimp sandwich on helpers advise and I thought it was blah.  Not a lot of taste.  My son's fish and chips was better.  Portions were nice and large though.  The patio is comfortable in void weather.  They made us wait 45 min to eat when they told us 15.  I get that that can be unpredictable, but when we were seated there were a million empty tables.  Maybe they didn't have staff capable of covering?

sAqu1ueoTR-eK8rQiFkO0w.review_text: Great outdoor seating. Right by the water. The outside doesn't look all good fancy but don't nudge the book by its cover. Delicious shrimp and crab sandwich! Absolutely amazing. Large portion enough to make too small meals too! Really grab shrimp and crab mixed in with mayo and absolutely sinful with a squeeze of lemon juice over it.  Highly recommended!

pBOj2TPkpyhcaIOnogCGUg.review_text: I like to come here on a sunny day and sit in the back and watch the Bay.  The food is good, the staff friendly.  Evenings there is usually a wait,especially in tourist season, or when a cruise ship has docked a wharf or two away. Better to come lunchtime!

kk2oFTBSU9C2XshIVU7tXQ.review_text: Came here for drinks with a friend the other day.  It was a gorgeous warm San Francisco day (YES THERE ARE SUCH THINGS!) and we were able to get a table on the patio overlooking the bay.  Any place on the water is worth going to for the atmosphere and ambiance.  Since it was Labour day weekend, the place was packed and a live band was setting up.  I think we were lucky with getting the patio table (although my poor sunburned back and shoulders didn't think they were lucky after a few hours!)  We saw a seal, the waiter service was perfect (she came to refill drinks regularly and didn't bother us about ordering anything else), the band, while a bit loud, provided a nice bit of background music.  Prices for drinks were more than decent and the cocktail list had some great options.  Definitely a nice place to hang out for some sun, drinks, and fresh air on the bay!  Will happily go back for the fun of it.

SuMBnQQ7G1dKAP7ciIC82w.review_text: You go to Pier 23 for the seafood, sunlight and beer. If the service is off- who cares? Everything else makes up for it! Whenever I crave crab- like off the shore, no bs crab - I come to Pier 23.

yV2lkkxL9GeadnB-939xWw.review_text: Very bad experience!!  Will never go back.  Spent a lot to $ and time there in the past.  Crappy service and rude bartenders.  If they were working for me, I'd of fired them on the spot.  Good luck if you choose this place.  With all the places in the city.  I would never give this a thumbs up.

Ev_amBB89kBOEkEWgnXBHA.review_text: this place is AWESOME for seafood - expensive... but AWESOME -  to address the negative reviews: 1) make a reservation and you wont have to wait; you'll also get a table outside if you request it; 2) do not complain if fresh, made to order seafood takes 25 minutes to come; 3) enjoy the view; 4) do not complain about paying top $ for great food on the water - you wont find better food + views along the piers - trust me - Ive tried - this place is bomb; 5) smile and thank the staff - they work really hard here; I thought the service was great; 6) go for brunch/lunch when you can take in the view/enjoy the sun;   the following dishes were A-ONE:   * butter lettuce salad $14!!!! so it had better be great - and it was; not your typical salad - huge portion (3 of us shared), tons of watermelon radish slices and  ripe mango; YUM dressing  * cajun peel/eat shrimp $15 when you get at least 15 shrimp, perfectly cooked and deliciously spiced, that takes you back to NOLA, along with fries... well worth it  * fish tacos $15 3 tacos, perfectly cooked snapper, delicious sauces - great  * tuna sandy $14.5 another home run; recommended by server - lived up to her hype  * fish and chips - $14.5 subbed sweet tater fries  * side of Kale w/ garlic $6 - smallish serving but so good its a positive  SERVICE (Kelly you are awesome); I am a SF native... place is kinda touristy; not your typical tourist trap - seemed like we were wanted back  negatives -   * oysters $2.5 each; nothing special here - move along  * a little pricey, but so worth it

z61JzFsvd98b2C2EHyYh5g.review_text: Great for outside seating and a beer watching the bay. Very busy on the weekends or any sunny day.

ksluAttirSzKOxUt4jyAbg.review_text: Food was decent. Service was agonizingly slow!  This place was on the Travel Channel??? I'm confused, but not amused.

2qc0uWaSRWDXMxVTtfNr-g.review_text: Go there! Have a beer on the patio. Get some snacks or a burger! Life is good!!! Don't expect something fancy - it's about beer and snacks! Good thing: not too many tourist!!!

0_RGrj4qF1CyqVGGn1lTSA.review_text: If you love seafood then this is the place for you!  Casual dining waterside while listening to live classic jazz is just the icing on the cake ;))). My faves on the menu:  clam chowder, steamed mussels & clams, calamari, & seared tuna steak sandwich = heaven!

X32XE4ueUSKnVAOqRatkrw.review_text: Went here on a casual date and I really enjoyed this place. If you are the type of person who wants a fine dining seafood experience, then this place is not for you, BUT if you are more concerned with tasty food at reasonable prices, with a great view of the bay - look no further. We sat on the back patio around sunset time and it was a really fantastic place to be.  The clam chowder here was very good. Not the best I've had in SF but still rich and thick and full of clams and not to salty. We got the Mussells with Chorizo and coconut milk and the fish and chips. I was skeptical about the mix of mussells chorizo and coconut flavors - but I was totally wrong, it was unbelievably delicious. Big portion too we weren't able to finish it all. The fish & chips were good, but nothing spectacular. The mussells were definitely the highlight of the meal if you go here I really recommend you try them.

CryTytqLBWKjoC12OTe0kA.review_text: I brought an out-of-town guest here for Saturday lunch, after seeing it on Food TV.  It was quite a disappointment.  The menu was quite limited. THE DUCK POPPER IS NO LONGER SERVED. They said they had a change of chef, and that might explain why the rest of the food did not meet the high expectations set by the Food TV show.  The oven baked dungeness crab seemed kind of undersized and over cooked.  The fish taco was nothing special.  I am afraid to say that this now feels more like a joint geared toward tourists than the great dinner that was featured on the Food TV show.  The food was also fairy expensive.  Parking was difficult also.  Definitely would not repeat.

cGHufrIhHqxNLfhqyrbNkA.review_text: We stopped here for lunch on a Saturday.  It was around 2pm, and there was a 20 min wait for a table of 4, but a bunch of open tables in the front area inside the restaurant, but they had signs they were not with food service or something.  The place looked a little run down and I have no idea where people would park, but we were taking a break from the Exploratorium and were drawn in by their convenient location and the kids menu.  They had the standard fare for kids: mini hamburgers, chicken stripes, grilled cheese, hot dog, pasta with butter, etc for $8).  I was pleasantly surprised by the food quality, it was much better than I expected.  My kids had the grilled cheese and mini hamburgers and they were good!  The mini hamburgers looked freshly made, it actually came out on a hot dog bun (1) with a long oval patty, but my DD wasn't particular and really liked it.  So nice it wasn't the frozen little sliders patties!  The regular fries were delicious, there is some seasoning on it, but not too salty or spicy.  My crab/seafood sandwich was SO fresh and yummy.   My DH didn't really care for it (I think he would have liked more seasoning), but it was generously piled with seafood.  We dined on the patio outside in the back and had a lovely view.  Glad we brought a jacket, we needed it.  I was really disappointed by the service.  After sitting there for about 10-15 minutes with still no waitress (and everyone avoiding our eye contact), we flagged the hostess down and asked who out waitress was, and she wasn't sure, but said she'd send someone.  She did and our waitress finally introduced herself.  She did apologize for the wait, but it would have been nice of her to offer to bring some bread or something (she didn't).    We didn't see her again until after we were eating food and then much later when I wanted to pay and still hadn't received our check.

AfKiTL7jvMOWlSqfDjkZ_A.review_text: In my travels to the Bay area, I have passed this place many times.  I ignored it's beckoning call, the sound of blues and drunken foolishness heard from blocks away.  I could hold out no longer.  And besides, my Petite Red Headed Passion flower was not impressed with the menu down the street at Taylor's .  Surprisingly enough, we found a table outside.  The place was packed with Giants fans and it was quite a loud bunch.  No, not loud.  Deafening would best describe it. An even bigger surprise is the server was timely.  This pace is packed to the gills keep in mind.  I ordered a Fat Tire Ale, my wife a glass of red and we ordered the Linguine Carbonera.    Again we were surprised by how quickly our food came out.  Almost simultaneously, my wife and I took one look at the soup bowls our food came in and bemoaned the teeny, tiny serving.  It was hot and very delicious.  It all came together nicely.  A great cream sauce with pancetta & shrimp over the pasta.  No veggies, just the way I like it.  The garlic bread was great for mopping up the sauce when we finished.  This is truly fives stars for the service, the view and the food.  Minus two for the microscopic portions.  Seriously folks.  If you're gonna drop 50 bucks for a pasta dinner, you better be walking out with some to-go boxes.

OWy2HL_zzATR97fKuRb53g.review_text: Pier 23 was a nice surprise for me and my family a month ago.  After extensive walk and passage through Fisherman's Wharf where seating and eating was not an option, we decided to give a chance to this unassuming place as it attracted us with its  rustic and charmingly " historic" look. We were also attracted with the information at the window about live jazz every evening and off course (in our case)  kid -friendly menu. The place is really good ol' times charming. Tented area where we were seated was was warm nice and gave us a privileged view of the Ocean.  We had Clam Chowder ( very good) Sour Dough Bread,  Fish and Chips, Seared Tuna Sandwich and pasta w butter for the Kiddo. Food was  good and portions were substantial. Service was so-so. Our order was taken and partially served by one server and completed by another. Nothing wrong was done by them,  but we didn't feel that warmly welcomed either.  Unfortunately we didn't make it till the music started but atmosphere was lively and cheerful anyway. It got really crowded by the time we were about to leave.   I anticipate this is how the entire FW used to look like years ago. I hope Pier 23 keeps its authenticity for many years.

BefauiX1HdzvdGySHJIhVA.review_text: Dear Pier 23 Cafe -   Your nachos look un-appetizing, but by the time I got to the bottom of my 1st glass of Macallan 12 on the rocks it turned into one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten.  Including the jalapenos from the can.  With the sun on my face, a chicken sandwich on my plate, and a Corona in my hand, I had a lovely lunch at your establishment.  With enough Coronas, I really didn't mind the surrounding brown water from the bay...but that's not really your fault.  I have also come here for a Native Elements performance.  With such a packed house that night your bartenders were super fast.  I'm not sure if they were so fast that their hands were blurring, or because I had too much to drink.  In either case, I had a wonderful time.  Thank you for many lushy lunches and boozy evenings.  Also, thank you for accommodating my large group the last time I was here.  We started the afternoon with 6 people, which kept growing to 20+ people, then back down to 5.  You and the tourist family next to us wearing San Francisco sweatshirts were great.  I will visit again soon.  Kind Regards, One Pickle Martini

WFJS_L9iLKsKphSyh44a9A.review_text: This place was JUST what the Dr. ordered on warm summer day for 2 tourists walking around Fishermans wharf all afternoon. We were promptly sat at a table outside, but the hostess put us on the far side of the place at a deserted table, near the bus boy stand and trash cans. Um, really? So we asked to move, which they happily obliged.   Take two. We were sat at a perfect table outside with a gorgeous view of the ocean. We were hungry but not starving and wanted something fresh and light to share. We settled on the grilled artichoke to start and the Pier 23 Cafe special- the whole garlic dungeness crab.   The artichoke was light and yummy, the perfect appetizer, served grilled with some yummy red sauce and hummus. Nice, light, nothing to scream about from the rooftops but enjoyable.  The crab though...omg. It was beautifully presented, with the claws stacked neatly and the head of the crab cracked open and filled with yummy buttery, garlic, crabby sauce. Served with a loaf of bread to lap up the sauce, it tasted like the ocean and heaven. I could have just eaten the sauce and bread and been happy. But alas, I dug into the crab legs too. Light and tender, but crab is never filling enough. Yummy though....   So why 3 stars? Well, the crab was $38!!!!! Are you kidding? A little pricier than it was worth when I can go to Joe's crab shack and get WAY more food for less...but the quality was better... I would have loved some live music or some music at all while enjoying the breeze and sunshine. We asked our server repeatedly for more napkins to clean our crabby hands, the napkins never came. Final thing: they have straw hats you can borrow to shade yourself from the sun. Gross. Someone else's sweat and lice is less than appealing.   I did enjoy my meal here as a tourist, but would probably not come here again as there are so many amazing restaurants in the city.

TGh4j0v0_5tZEp0dE2QffA.review_text: Good Fish & Chips with a spicy spin! Definitely different, but tasty! Great view and good cocktails, perfect for a stop after the Alcatraz cruise.

VSNMx8ijh-oGXSXHQfTVLg.review_text: Has beautiful views and great for drinks.  Wish they served Mojitos though!  It's a lively bar and ok food.  Nice place to stop in before going to the Embarcadero or after a sporting event.  Please add Mojitos to the menu!!

wkklbFK50TTkd1GJXXAntA.review_text: I like this place.  They were out of the crab special so we went with the cioppino, which was very good.  I forgot our other entree, but the Clam Chowder was absolutely delicious.  I want to go back for their crab special!!

Wk7MEOGGmexpwpQFxXKvYg.review_text: I love this place for Reggae on the Pier every Saturday night, live music and enjoying the pier on warm nights, this is definitely the place to be. The beer selection is great!   Finally decided to try their food on a sunny day. Outdoor seating is a plus and the fried calamari is a great start. I opted for the slow cooked pork ribs, which were tender and the cole slaw was a great side. As a side I ordered the Mac, Bac & Cheese, yummy! It was cheesy and nicely seasoned.   My friend ordered the fish tacos and said they were ok, but needed more salt. He was a slightly disappointed that a side didn't come with the dish. Another friend ordered the crab and shrimp salad. The crab and shrimp were fresh, however, it needed some salt. Sweet Potato Fries were delish, and overall we enjoyed the food and the outside patio.   The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. While the food wasn't amazing, I can say I'll be back to check out other dishes on the menu and enjoy the outdoor patio!

11gYVIsGtqGzIjVOrDuybw.review_text: Very rude place. My family and I sit and wait 30 minutes to be seated when some guy that know the manager Mcgurrin walks in and sweet talks his buddy into let him come in and be seated with out any wait. When the manager is called out on it he's surprised he got caught. Very disrespectful of the manager to seat his "buddy" before all the other waiting customers.  Instead my family and I went to enjoy our meals else where.

VDcbwMVX9mYgrGHwVkhEVQ.review_text: So good the 1st time we came again. The crab is killer and worth the work. Be prepared to get down and dirty with each piece of the crab :) they give u a very hot towel/lemon water at the end to clean urself up.   Very chill spot on the water. Love sitting outside. Good times, food, music and beer.

s5WDEgmqZZ8OVZe2SeJmzA.review_text: Sal saw this restaurant on triple D and we have to say that it's overall a 3.5/5.  The outdoor seating is fun with a beautiful bay view.. My Bloody Mary was excellent & the shrimp crab sandwich was yummy!  The steamed mussels& clams were average.  And the grilled fish tacos were phenomenal!  Service is great for a family of 8.  I made reservations on yelp 15 mins prior to walking in and we were seated right away!  My husband was excited about that!

MAUU-3Gw4l6CAHixf6nPsA.review_text: Decent food, nice view and good service. Live music sometimes which is nice. Nothing really to rave about and nothing to really complain about either.

OjVekgtY193OFO7EBztD7w.review_text: The food was really good. Only problem, our waitress spilled the lemonade on my husband.

lU5qkrFbxZwI6gCQKoPrDA.review_text: What a fun place! Absolutely a hole in the wall, but great atmosphere. We were here during Fleet Week, so things were a bit crazy, but they seemed to handle it well. They opened a second bar outside so that we didn't have to fight our way to the inside bar.  And I was impressed that they were pouring premium alcohol outside. Some places would have resorted to canned beer only since it was so crowded.   Can't wait to go back and order some food!

5Ve0E0atNc6NT2bs4AS5ww.review_text: We didn't eat here. We just drank Manhattans. They were okay - neither the worst nor the best I've had. Nice outdoor seating area, with heat lamps. Large TVs featuring Giants game and NBA playoffs.

bw7N8G2wneOY7pJbWv5dLg.review_text: Went to Pier 23 with my daughter on November 4, 2014. We our tourist and since the pictures and reviews were pretty killer I thought we would try it. We both order a bowl of Clam Chowder with a side of sourdough. Its hard to mess up chowder but they did.  Both chowders had these 1 x 1 inch cubes that were brown and and had dark edges that were very questionable.The texture and brown edges were scary. I pulled all of them out of chowder and set on a plate to ask my waiter what they were. He didn't know either thought maybe mushrooms or breadcrumbs after he asked the cook he was told there were pieces of baked potatoes. Which met they were a day or two OLD baked potatoes that they added as a filler to the chowder. HOW SAD Won't be back.

QIZ6hhFj31xaLnSSZeNM6g.review_text: We saw this place on Diners Drive-ins and Dives and thought...'Hey! Let's take a road trip!" This place was not really everything that I had expected. There were raves about the view...which was the construction of the building next door when we were there. True the patio was on the water...but not a great view. Not to mention that it wasn't very clean. The clam chowder was really good. Lots of clams, not at all fishy, very fresh. The decor/furniture was tacky with white plastic lawn chairs on a dirty patio. In my opinion the place was over-hyped and over-priced. I would not waste my time or money or gas to eat there again.

j0QzHCYxlOp_8KqSqopyHg.review_text: Absolutely love this place. The seafood was fantastic. The patio has amazing views of the bay. However, in my opinion, the best part was... and always will be... the live music.

WVBf8ushkTGY6tq_DWOO2g.review_text: Great casual restaurant along the Embarcadero.  Good atmosphere and down to earth, especially considering the fact that you are in tourist territory.  We went on a Sunday afternoon, wasn't too busy, but that might have been due to the BART strike.  Got a seat along the plexiglass rails so we were able to enjoy sights of the bay as well as Coit Tower.  Service was very good, food was good albeit common which is not necessarily a bad thing - fish and chips, burger, tuna sandwich, shrimp sandwich, etc.  Got Guinness so that's always a plus! -W wingsdomain.com

hzdRsbXJBcniGOue-4S77Q.review_text: Mussels and clams are unique (in a good way). The seafood was very fresh! I got the crab, which was awesome!!!! The price tag on the crab was not awesome. The peel-and-eat shrimp was also very good. I suggest sticking to the menu items you don't need silverware for.

TJMgOTcm2ShyOpablSYbXA.review_text: Lovin' what Pier 23 is offerin' I can't attest to the food, but if you're on the hunt for a bayside beverage with friends, whilst basking in the sun on a nice day.... well shucks! It doesn't get any better than this!  It was packed when I visited during a Friday happy hour and I'm sure the beautiful weather only encouraged more people to set up shop (just as we did.) The draft selection wasn't vast but they did have a few IPAs that we enjoyed. And even though the servers/bartenders were crazy busy, the service was fantastic, chipper and attentive.  I could've sat here for hours just kicking back and taking it all in, but alas, all things must come to an end.

cobDxWUVyfKdxmhBDaaKVg.review_text: I loved the atmosphere here on the water. This was the perfect spot to eat seafood with friends. They had great sharing options like tuna and watermelon, smoked salmon and mussels. We also tried the Calamari and crab bisque. The Calamari was average, but the soup was great. They also had a great list of cocktails.

9u3EuYht0CJReCySC05tIA.review_text: I probably wouldn't have picked this place -- too "touristy" -- but we met some friends here for a Saturday lunch. We were a group of 9, so we made a reservation, they included an automatic gratuity on the bill: a fair trade.   The weather was perfect, warm and breezy, so sitting on their semi-enclosed deck in lightweight plastic chairs was comfy enough and appropriate for the ambiance.  Although our arrival times were uncoordinated and the place overflowing with customers, the hostess and servers were pleasant and patient, as well as attentive once we assembled. Meanwhile, we ordered Chips (fresh, slightly on the heavy side), Black Bean Dip (tasty, not quite spicy enough for me), a couple of beers, & a couple bottles of wine (decent selection, reasonably-priced, mostly $30-45 range), and at least one Bloody Mary.  One couple had been here before, so we ordered 5 Shrimp & Crab sandwiches (generous portions on toasted sliced French bread), based on their recommendation. There were also orders of Fish Tacos (grilled, good, fresh-tasting) and Corned Beef Hash & Eggs (also reportedly good). The sides of Fries and Slaw were respectively average and above-average in quality.  Overall, a pleasant experience, a fair value, and worth repeating.

RSwbWmJSrmOPYLP3P41dow.review_text: A great place to go if you want outdoor seating, also really good selection of beer and great fish tacos.  One star off for prices on some of the items.

Q0qo1Gi99LihNjitnpfCAw.review_text: Wow. I always considered Pier 23 to be somewhat of a dive bar. I never thought of it as a place to eat. If I were to eat there (and I had not prior to this visit), I would have just expected typical bar fare. Boy was I surprised!  My friends who were visiting from LA selected this restaurant. Well, my friend's husband did, because they wanted seafood. (When my friend, the wife, saw pictures of the place and heard that most of the tables were outdoor, she wasn't so thrilled). In the end, we seated in a covered patio area (and outdoor tables have heat lamps) so the weather wasn't really an issue. But who would have thought that this bar would be known for their seafood? Well, don't be too quick to judge. As soon as we sat at our table, I asked our server about which dishes were popular. She mentioned: *Calamari (to share) *Crab Cakes *SF Crab & Shrimp Sandwich *Fish Tacos *Baby Back Ribs  Do any of those sound like typical bar food to you? Not really. So I decided to get the SF CRAB & SHRIMP SANDWICH, which was amazing! Incredibly fresh and sweet seafood. Huge portion. Not richly covered in dressing. Great deal! My friends also ordered the Calamari for the table, and several bowls of Clam Chowder. The chowder is good, especially if you like chowder. It's not the best that I've had, but it's good enough. Someone also ordered the BABY BACK RIBS, which were fall off the bone tender. Someone else ordered the whole Roasted Dungeness Crab (2lbs @ $45) and was incredibly happy with each bite of his meal.  If you're just looking for a place to grab a drink, go out and enjoy their Beer Garden. Great patio on a nice day! Plenty of seating and bay view!  All in all, good choice.

5Q5aeMq_dgomcVaSuvN5Lg.review_text: Rude rude rude!  Sat outside wanting drinks for husband and me plus 3 granddaughters. Told we had to go inside to order drinks..by the waiter who served drinks to the table next to us!  Bar tenders ignored us as they finished their chat and a drink!!!    Terrible place...sure didn't want to order food now; especially after seeing the over fried fish and chips delivered to the table next to us.

vji-UxenjllkxlxxaQbHcg.review_text: I have come to this Cafe many, many times over the many years, the food is very good for local fair, nothing to jump over the bridge about (my fave is the SF Crab & Shrimp Sandwich $19), but all around good food and a large menu, there is music nearly every night and it is VERY GOOD music.  Drink are drinks, being a new Bloody Mary fanatic it is now my measure of standard in all brunch drinks, theirs is OK, not great but ok, the one thing I do like is that they will use string green beans instead of the traditional stalk of celery, nice change up to the standard, the base could use a little more HR to spice it up though. The actual bar is small. The deck view is nice, it does not have a lot of "view" unless the bay has some active sailing going on, it is nicely nestled between the piers with a large wedge of the bay viewable.  Pier 23 is all about the music and dancing after 6pm.  Great night spot to party on the wharf and pier 39 is about 1/4 mile down so a nice stroll alo ng the Embarcadero can be had. This is not a late night spot, Kitchen closes @10PM, Bar closes at midnight. The wait staff needs some better management.  If you are going to work in customer service, especially wait staff service you better like what you do and be able to do it well, Wait service is demanding, (been there done it) You must be ubber attentive, slap happy to be there and willing to hustle til your feet bleed and no hanging out at the bar chatting with the hot bar tender and his friends. Wait staff here can be slow and forgetful, but again the place gets packed and this can in and of it's self slow things down.   Pier 23 is a nice place to go on a sunny afternoon or a warm night anytime to hear good music and dance a little, weekdays the business crowd comes in full strength and seating can be tough.  Parking can be had on the street (metered) no lot parking, All in all a good place to come with good food.

4x3x0oGs9gcHCoQpqoI9hw.review_text: Another restaurant featured on "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives".  I loved the whole waterfront casual atmosphere.  Excellent location.  Sat outside on the back patio next to the water on a gorgeous day and had THE best calamari.  It was perfectly seasoned and lightly breaded in panko.  Not greasy.  Delicious.  Also had the tuna poke tostadas.  I didn't like that as much.  It was tossed in mayo, which ruined the whole fresh tuna thing.  Drinks were strong & tasty but very expensive.  After a couple hours on the Rock, we decided to come back and have more drinks.  This time we chose to sit in the bar up front.  You get to people watch the sidewalk (like I mentioned, excellent location), and a live band was setting up. The downside was that by this time (around 3ish) the teeny little bar was getting filled to capacity and the bartender looked like he was having trouble mulit-tasking.  Our mixed drinks weren't good this time around and still expensive.  We had better service when we were seated in the restaurant part.    I would definitely visit again, on a sunny day, sit by the water, and have a pint and the calamari.  Mmmmmmmm!

kitAOxUSgFGhR3JLPrDCvg.review_text: This place can great pretty crowded during lunch, but it's great to eat outside when it's nice and sunny. I like ordering beers and nachos for lunch. It's pretty satisfying...   Watch out for goop in your water though, I think that's from the wind though and not actually dirty water...

Y2OV9WKA-cIOCRSfNrPCJQ.review_text: First time here sat outside and ordered clam chowder and mussells and clams - delicious nice and fresh the broth was so good we mopped it all up with the bread good portions very nice friendly staff I will be coming again ! Nice views also

m4e2fs8BObN0Cd69stfo9A.review_text: Only waited 15 minutes to get a pier-front table; food was good, menu was simple. I would recommend this place for a casual lunch.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Had not been here in a long time and never during that day, so hadn't enjoyed the setting as much as I did today where I could take in the view of the bay and the East Bay hills.  Great setting and the food is very good.  I had the seared tuna sandwich, which was excellent and nice roll.  Good fries.  Nice beer selection.  A bit pricey, but the quality was good and portion was generous.  I like that they have some outdoor seating in the glass, so you get a feel of eating outside, but protected from the wind, which is almost always going to make it a bit chilly there.

-xNjrvzq02pRnaZsLaDokw.review_text: The locals love this place and rightfully so.  Very cool decorations and feeling to the place, you can sit outside and enjoy a great view of the bay, the food is delicious and not ridiculously over priced.  If you are taking the day to visit Telegraph Hill or walk down the piers, I suggest you stop for a drink and a bite to eat at Pier 23.

iGrcQ3G0n6nxhsprV2FG_w.review_text: Pros: - Great location - Great views and atmosphere - Good band  Cons: - Slow service (but not a big issue really) - Crab and shrimp sandwich not the "best" of SF like they said on TV.  The shrimp is the tiny crappy shrimp and the crab is not lump it's the shredded crappy kind.  The whole mess is WAY too wet.   The sandwich is 16 bucks and it should be about 7.  Not worth it.    - Over priced.  If you're going for the crab and shrimp sandwich you saw on TV go home!  If you going for a beer and to hang out - come down!

mnfS3F9OkI8uC9orKLjsug.review_text: Nice little cafe at the Pier.  Went there for some drinks on a sunny afternoon with a friend and enjoyed my time there.  We sat outside and the view was GORGEOUS. The waitress was helpful and attentive enough. Drinks were just okay though and the cups felt kinda dirty.   I am hoping that the restaurant puts some effort into improving the drinks and the cleanliness of the business! Other than these two areas, I love the cafe!!!

ZQ1_dxBH350CYKID66wzTQ.review_text: This was a nice place for food and drinks. The drinks and food were ok.  I think it was more of a social place if you have the occasion.  We had the calamari and black and pepper chicken wings which were not a bad choice.

wfx6AY9cbjFjDiuXrOnv5Q.review_text: We stopped in one night after a stroll along the Embarcadero for a drink and ended up staying a while.  We didn't end up eating, sadly, based on the reviews.  We did really enjoy ourselves while we were there.  Our service was outstanding - both the morning and night guys were great (we were there for shift change) and our drinks never went empty.  We would definitely go back and, next time, to eat too.

_zjJkD0iXeO2vAfh-jCubA.review_text: Really poor service.. our name on the waiting list... ..finally our kids asked the hostess and they said we've been looking for you PAUL... that was a lie .. we were sitting outside  and they never walkewd out and called my name..  we finally got seated.. 15 minutes before the server got to us... we orderded.. she left before I could ask for a iced tea... ,,, our food was excellent.. our kids kept saying too bad the service sucks because the food is really good.. we had clam chowder , sour dough bread , fish tacos , and peel n eat shrimp...  our server dropped the checdk on our table without saying a word... our bill was  $55 ... my wife left her 15%...    I would have left her a 10% tip...  I won't go back .

1qMauBxHBVnIQ8Ecm96Dmw.review_text: Pier 23 is a cute little dive along the Embarcadero. Its a bar/restaurant. I've been there for happy hour, raggae night, and just for dinner.   Service: Its busy especially on the weekends but we were able to walk around the Embarcadero and when we got back our table was ready.   Food: The food was hit or miss. The ribs and shrimp and crab sandwich were both great although I didn't understand why they would put the sweet potato fries beneath the ribs which made them soggy. The fish and chips were not as crispy as expected. Then again I think this place was more meant to be a good watering hole for happy hour with a great view of the bay.  Just check it out and you be the judge. I'd still go back.

wiGTEivWeiV7xckCSVWMSQ.review_text: I won't be coming back here until the management fires the A-HOLE BARTENDER with the lame Magnum P.I mustache. Yes...you know who I'm talking about! He was working on Sat. night, 9/27/08.  What a total jerk! He selectively decides to help whomever he wants...nevermind that people have been standing in front of his face waving their $20 bill for 15+ minutes. Then when he does decide to serve you he does it with so much attitude and hate. Look dude...I'm sorry you hate your job - don't take it out on us.  If you read the other reviews for this place, more than once this bartender is called out for being an asshole.   Other than that, its an ok location and good outdoor space for a live band.

QIy3iLXjBUBqRzwd2lnWGQ.review_text: I learned about this place by watching DDD on the food network. I've been wanting to try it out for months now and I finally had the chance to try it out this past weekend.  Parking: Parking can be a little difficult. There's a parking lot located across the street. I'm not sure how much they charge for parking.   Service: The staff is very friendly.   Food:       Roasted garlic crab: 4 stars. The crab was savory and delicious! They drown it in butter, white wine and garlic. The favors explode in your mouth and a squeeze of lemon is always good. $38 (market price)  Pier 23 definitely lived up to my expectations. They a decent sized bar with numerous beers on tap. When I visit SF again I'll for sure come back to Pier 23!

MiDD3-ZWVAbEAa8wGThfbQ.review_text: I think it was the atmosphere.  Very manly- sports bar type place.  I like a dive....but this was just more a sports bar.  It had a nice chicken sandwich....for 13 bucks (you did get fries with that right???)- I waited 25 minutes to have my order taken...but whatever, what is time to me- I have all the time in the world.  It had some nice live music...I think most live music lends itself to at least an amusing time.  All in all- I have had better, I am just not a sports bar type of gal.

2BKVmDmrEh7I8ukHTqZ7EQ.review_text: Loved my late lunch here. Sat on the patio facing a gorgeous view, received excellent service, and noshed on some very fresh oysters and a delicious tuna poke dish. I found the prices extremely reasonable given the location, outdoor seating, and view. The adjoining outdoor beer garden was filling up and getting rowdy just as I was leaving. It seemed a fun place to have a few drinks, plus it's a completely separate space from the dining patio, in case you're looking for a quieter experience. Would recommend this place to anyone! Oh and the restroom was surprisingly clean.

VsaBOw2okk40K5S1sNRBjw.review_text: Amazing Chowder and calamari. Now just wait till you try the shrimp n crab sandwich. It's is so flavorful, and melts in your mouth

BbNAQfg_BdVMRxTiSlxVxA.review_text: Outdoor place at the seaside. Free wi-fi and perfect place for a snack and a cold beer!

xe6zLW8nQrO_RqB30bygMQ.review_text: For my Austin friends who will one day make it out to SF....  Bring a warm jacket and sunglasses.  Grab a draft beer while you wait for your table and, weather ask to sit near the water so you can enjoy the total experience.  Order the Chorizo Firecrackers ($11 - thai chili & chipotle cheese) and the  Bacon Fried Oysters ($12) and the 2lb oven Roasted Dungeness Crab (in a white wine garlic sauce) and feast.  The crab is big enough for two but I finished one myself.  And the remaining claws from my friend Andy.  And the last two bodies from my friend Brent.  Awesome.  Service was friendly, beer was good, food was great.

Ve0LUwcrzxL7w0RYgY4Aaw.review_text: This place is great, Especially if the weather is nice! I sat outside on the patio and enjoyed a great family brunch. Expect hearty, simple, but well cooked foods here. Local fare, classics (burgers) and good beers.   I had the corned beef hash with poached eggs, DELISH! My Dad tried the Steak and eggs. After badgering him for a bite he finally let me dig in - I think I liked that even more than my own dish!   It's a pretty casual atmosphere and the corned beef hash was quite possibly the best I've ever had. The portions were great and it was very tasty. I think what actually stood out the most though was the service. Our server was incredibly friendly. I was most impressed when she asked if I wanted a separate chair to rest my purse on. OF COURSE! (did you know that the bottom of a woman's purse is one of the dirtiest things around? ICK! I avoid putting mine on the ground at all times.)   I'd say overall the experience here was good. I'd go back again!

XLM7kZu5itQYXYL7j-gArw.review_text: This restaurant is awesome, we found it off the D.D.D episode, have been back twice, and really enjoy eating here. Two things, make a reservation (even if you don't think you need one, make one) and enjoy the view off the water with all the delicious food you are about to trap in your tummy. I tried something new, the fish tacos, and enjoyed them, especially with the dipping salsas they brought. You can never go wrong with the crab sandwich they have on the menu... it's ginormous, tasty, and the salad & fries are a great compliment! Go, enjoy, and eat!

BrRXPBAF_FjfiX75nB7hVA.review_text: Butter lettuce salad and the ribs is bomb!

iPcvY_6wdMgQXwyuq6ZAAA.review_text: By far the best and freshest seafood I have had in the city. Little mom and pops place with friendly people and tv at the bar to watch the game. Love the atmosphere

K7-zOceF1slgqJTZSKe7YQ.review_text: Can't beat food and drinks on the bay on a sunny day!  This place was great- minus the wait. I think the buzz around this place centers around it being featured on the food network.  I've grown to be weary of these features, and i was right.  The place wasn't bad, but wasn't amazing.  I went here last month around lunch time and had to wait an hour get seated.  The food was great but not amazing.  The fried calamari was good, as was the crab sandwich.  They also have amazing fries!  If you just want a taste of SF and seafood, I recommend going to fishermans wharf, however, if you want a view and want to relax,  just being able to sit on the bay with a drink and good food is reason enough to go to this humble restaurant.

BcovypoLnNk7LGsnBEN9_A.review_text: A friend took us here as the first place to go to in San Francisco and I'm glad we had the chance. The view is great and the food was delicious. I had the crab pasta, which had A LOT of crab (and no shell!). My boyfriend also had the shrimp and crab sandwich was was very, very good as well. It was mostly all seafood and not much "filler." If I lived in the city I'd be a regular here- reminded me of Baltimore, too!

F_J9z24SR5iuWBy92nCiWg.review_text: This place is horrible for vegetarians and the service is slow. Also, there's always a loud group of people with flailing limbs at the bar.  However, I'll give it two stars for Wednesday jazz night, and one star for the amazing ginger beer and sweet potato fries.

xbJHKUURTfuVnE4mdKdRKA.review_text: This place was not the best place to eat. I ordered the Fish n Chips and didn't get what I expected. For being right on the on the pier the amount of fish I was given for the price was not worth a damn. I have had bigger portions of fish in the mid west for a cheaper price and tasted much better. Had a bowl of their clam chowder also was bland and not that great. If you have to option to skip this place, the do so. If not then good luck having a waitress come to your seat because service here sucks as well.

67hc4VfV8WtZOA6U3MzM5A.review_text: Had the opportunity to do a Friday happy hour here.   It was very busy, good ratio of guys:girls, drinks were reasonably priced (3 beers and a vodka cocktail for $24), HUGE outdoor patio, plenty of seating/tables, good mix of people - generally pretty friendly.  Bartender tended to be a bit rude (tall, shaved head, cowboy hat), still left him a tip (so he could save up for some etiquette lessons). Rest of the staff/security was really cool !  Overall, a great place for happy hour drinks...

51qAUEpBm23k4CX_uGZcMA.review_text: Fun, sun and good times.  Can you really ask for anything more on a Friday afternoon? This was my time at Pier 23.   I had a Mahi Mahi and fries. The special ranch sauce was great. The service was a little slow but it was crowded in there. They lost a star for letting my beer get empty on a great day...sorry there are some things that are unacceptable.

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: First, a story about Pier 23:  I'm sitting at the bar, with a friend's birthday going on around me. My back is to the street and a buddy walks up to me, leans in.  The following conversation commences:  Him: "Dude, don't look now, but a cable car full of clowns just pulled up."  Me: "Oh man I hate those cable car tours. You're right they always are a bunch of clowns."   Him: "No, seriously. A cable car FULL OF @#$%ing CLOWNS just pulled up."  I whip around to see 50 fully dressed clowns flood into the bar.  Hilarity ensued.   Pier 23 is a nice little bar / cafe which is one of those spots where you can sit out by the water and drink. They've got a pretty respectable bar and serve food as well.   People always seem to throw group events here, and they handle it really well. You can get a big group for dinner out on the water and they manage to keep the place pretty warm on the cold nights.   Turned out the clowns were there for a birthday party too, so if you need a bar venue on the water that hosts clown birthdays, I know they've done at least one.

-K2Tcgh2EKX6e6HqqIrBIQ.review_text: You know what?  I don't come here often, but whenever I do, I have an amazing time and wind up getting totally hammered.  This is the place where friends and former colleagues like to have good-bye parties, birthday parties - you name it parties.  We have some munchies, start on beers and quickly progress to doing shots.  Erp...  I've staggered out of here more times that I like to remember.  And there was something really embarrassing one time involving the bathroom and the reggae band on a Wednesday...I wish I knew exactly what happened, but my friends stop talking to me whenever I bring it up....

ECySt0sD2C18bbOuXNyUHQ.review_text: Greatest outdoor restaurant in SF.  The food here is great, the drinks are stiff and the staff is amazing.  This place definitely has its share of drinkers, but the staff handles everyone well and is very professional.  I have never seen bad food being served.  I think the one reviewer is crazy when she talks about bad hamburgers and french friends.  Sounds like her husband probably just drank too much.

vXZ2SOdRF8YtKcRyzEnx-g.review_text: Perfect day on the patio on the bay! Awesome service! ORDER the crab/shrimp sandwhich! You won't be disappointed....NO MAYO HERE, just 2" high of meat .

D7xvTPCuU4mkRhA4CWKnkw.review_text: A Favorite Place! Great place on a sunny day.... Nights at Pier 23 are so much fun....where the musical acts are awesome! And the people that come here....are always so friendly.

8YDJraW_cg5IPTPisPfB-A.review_text: This place was our choice for a Saturday afternoon lunch. When we arrived we were told it would be 30 minutes for a table so we headed to the bar. This place got packed and the number of people waiting in line for a table just multiplied. I am sooo glad we got here when we did! The drinks were good and the table was ready when they said it would be. We sat in the back part of the restaurant and the view was very nice. Its a beautiful day so I am loving this atmosphere.   For lunch we chose the Fish N Chips, Grilled Scallops, Bacon Fried Oysters and Fried Calamari. The food was delicious. It was definitely a lot of fried items but who cares.. so worth it. This stuff was good! We ate all the food and left very satisfied people. The service was good. If you dont like seafood at all this is probably not your place. Other than that, I have no idea why everyone wouldn't enjoy the food here.

L8nb-fqdNyXY70zUi1xETg.review_text: Saw this on DDD.  The show headlined Duck Poppers.  They looked and sounded unbelievable.  What is unbelievable is that they no longer serve Duck Poppers.  THEY TOOK IT OFF THE MENU!!!  Wow!  They got free international advertising through DDD and the waitress said everyone asks for those but we don't serve them anymore.  Hmmmm... if everyone is asking for them maybe you should go with it?  Although I was shocked, I didn't leave.  The clam chowder and fish and chips were very average and the prices were very high.  The view is beautiful.  The furniture is plastic.  I gave one star for stupidity.  Does McDonalds discontinue the Big Mac?  Unbelievable...

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Since Pier 23 is an SF institution, and it was my last week in SF, my friends decided it would be fitting to come for dinner.   I had a dark and stormy which was delicious, although my friends thought it was too tart. Personally, I love tart things.  Then we shared a bunch of appetizers including calamari, breads (which used to be called breads and spreads.. .way better name), chips + dip, and something else I can't recall.  Food was good overall, although the dips and spreads definitely could have used a little something extra. Calamari was great. Seafood is their thing.  It's a little pricey for the quality but you get great water views, friendly service, and a fun atmosphere with live music sometimes! It can get touristy but make a reservation if you can and you'll skip right by the line!

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: This used to be a good place to drink in on a rare hot SF day. You knew you were getting ripped off with the $6 Coronas, but being right on the Bay made it worth it.  Also went here for Brunch- place was 1/2 empty,  unlike the good old days where every table was taken. The food was definitely good for brunch, no complaints there. They need to shut this place down and start all over again. It is now a dump with plastic chairs and bird shit everyplace.   How do you justify a cover and then charge NYC prices here?

CWqDAelZ3QVNfaseopdPtw.review_text: Good seafood and a great view!  It's a nice place for a casual dinner with friends.

nClCedp69Dt162vZeLbM1A.review_text: Was so excited to be eating here, arrived around 9 pm on a Friday night after sightseeing all day. My husband ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the Shrimp and Crab Sandwich..for a $20 sandwich I really expected it to blow my socks off..but NOPE..it was horrible, all I tasted was lemon!  If i was blindfolded I would have thought I was eating a lemon sandwich there was no taste of Shrimp or crab. The bread wasn't even toasted.  Now I understand that it was a hour before the close and maybe some cook didn't want to work anymore but come on don't you taste the food before it goes out.  My husbands Fish and Chips were Ok, we have had better....but I will say their Clam Chowder was good or it may have been that I was staving when we arrived and it was the first thing I had.  With so many places to eat in SF I can honestly say we will not be eating here again.

HOw3-kmLpqT-FTpPsOkiaA.review_text: location, location, location  I find the best and worst part of this joint is the location. Gorgeous waterfront view that lets in tons of sun while blocking the sun. Perfect for a sunny but freezingly breezy (thats all SF has) day in the City.  However the location forces you to go to the Embarcadero and oush your way through hords of tourists.  The food and beer selection are 4 out of 5 stars for what they offer up but completely overpriced. I attribute this to the fact that they have to pay the waterfront rent.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: The atmosphere is worth the price and a return visit in my opinion.   I enjoy sitting outside and when you add sitting to the left of the bay bridge along the water you boost it even more. We had a few favorite places on the East coast where we sat on the water (eg The Ferry Building) and this reminded me of that. Only thing missing was the tug boats.  If you have never been, you must go.   The food wasn't bad, not spectacular, but I will go again. It was a bit pricey but the atmosphere is what your paying for.

vhk2v137bqJyd9nyG3XSRg.review_text: The best place for drinks and seafood at reasonable prices along the embarcadero. Has a bar with live music. And an outdoor deck that is heated, and they put up windbreaks when it kicks up from the bay. Try the whole crab.Or the seafood sandwiches. Friday afternoon into happy hour is the better time to go there. A shout out to Jaime,one of the wonderful service staff there. On top of things, and a good sense of humor.

89D3HIzMwXSvJ43D1C9uAg.review_text: Here is one of the better restaurants along the Embarcadero.  With breathtaking views, moderate prices, good food, and all that jazz.  Great place to drink beer and enjoy the waterfront on a beautiful day.  This review is long overdue.  My wife and I came here and we enjoyed everything.  The moment we entered the restaurant, the hostess greeted us immediatley.  The waitstaff was friendly and attentive.  Our glasses of water was always full.  My wife and I sat outside.  My wife and I stared our meal with a half cup of clam chower and sourdough bread.  My wife ordered the fish tacos and I ordered the fish and chips.  I was dissappointed with the fish and chips.  They were good, but I've tasted better.  The fish was fresh and flaky, but the batter was soggy and not crunchy.  The fries were so-so.  However, my wife's tacos were very good and full of flavor.  I wish they had more selection when it comes to drinks.  My wife was dissappointed that they don't serve mojitos.    We love the atmosphere here and it's full of high energy.  The food is good and the views of the bay are amazing.  My wife and I would definitely come back.

tClCuqYjoPk_Q9U_u2owoA.review_text: Meh.  Guy Fieri's reputation just keeps going down in my book.  This place is not good.    My sister had the shrimp and crab salad, which she said "tastes like nothing".  And indeed, it did taste like nothing.  The textures are all correct, and so your brain thinks it is eating crab, but if you didn't know what you were eating, you wouldn't know it was actually crab.  They need to add some sort of flavoring.  I had the seared tuna salad that was ok, but not outstanding.    The service was slow and unfriendly too.  She didn't smile the entire time and even though it was clear we were hungry and sort of in a rush, she pretended like she didn't notice.    Next time you are looking for food in the area, go to the exploratorium cafe.  It has a better view and probably better options.    And it's probably cheaper as well.  With tip and tax, it came out to about 25 dollars per person.

dWe4qfWT_urGY8spxucAUg.review_text: I keep going back to this place, particularly when sunny in SF.  Its divey, its fun, great food, by the water and awesome service...how can you ask for more?  They even have live music after 4pm.  Last week our server, Caleb, went way beyond the call of duty...as I was sitting on the back patio and getting hit by a hot sun in the middle of the day, he offered some sunblock and within minutes, I had it delivered to the table...way to go Caleb.  I love this place and will keep going back way pass the days I start collecting social security checks...I will be the sassy great-great-grandma on the back...bopping to the music while sipping on Long Island Iced Teas...see you then!

elMekVOtLXd4yVFf5P33Ag.review_text: Quick service great seating and views, the service was also very nice.

2wy6JCgvKgXbx_fzAu39rQ.review_text: We did not have a good experience here. Small servings and raw fish & chips. Made me sick and as a result I had to rush and foul the restroom at World Market soon there after. I am not returning, advise caution if at all.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: I do like to sit and sun myself and get a little color.  However, I feel there are nicer and less expensive places to go (Park Chalet).  Fish'n'chips and Nachos were on the menu- totally overpriced for what it was.  Service was ok.    Maybe I just went on the wrong day or time.  I'm sure I'll give Pier 23 another chance.

fPStEkdmNeqaQ_Zt6DMh9A.review_text: Great drinks (tipsy)...beautiful view...kind of hole in the wall-ish but I actually love holes in the wall.  Food was FANTASTIC!  Ordered sliders and fish tacos.  Both of us were pleased....can't wait to go back!

YNgQ7HLKOs9QfrP21G5fBA.review_text: Shrimp and Crab sandwich was horrible,  had No flavor. .. walk 3 miles to eat here so disappointed. .. 2 thumps down. ..

G5gQt_AXRWzed5Glbtar-g.review_text: The bouncers give you the run-around for sure!  The bar itself is decent, but getting in is the hard part -- those dudes just don't seem to let people get in easily (were they too crowded inside?).  And once you're in, stay in.  My friend was out front and I tried to give her some info "$10 cover fee, but we might not stay to long so it's up to you if..." when suddenly the bouncer's hand is on my shoulder, kicks me out for coming outside.  Not allowed back in!  Not even with another $10 cover fee.  Christ!  Avoid this place if you don't want to beg bouncers all day.

B1qjqUrDcfMrJV9KoQCN5w.review_text: Strictly reviewing the restaurant part and not the bar part here. Went on MLK Day, right at lunchtime. Definitely a low-key, dive-y feel to it, but that's ok, I like that kind of stuff. Not a ton of people, but people there. We sat on the outdoor patio, which was heated, and my kids loved the disco balls hanging from the ceiling. The view is still there even though they had the awnings down to keep it warmer.   Hubby and I order a couple of Bloody Marys, which were very good. They're unique in that the garnish is a little different and they have actual horseradish in them. Very tasty, and different which was nice. Ordered a couple of cups of clam chowder which came out in about 5 minutes of us ordering. I see a lot of reviews saying the service wasn't great, but ours was stellar. They were practically falling over themselves to make sure our water was full, dishes were cleared, everything was ok, etc.   The clam chowder was excellent, as was the little sourdough crostini that came with it. We opted to share an entree, had the fish & chips. It was delicious as well, with a nice batter on the fish - not too greasy! The only thing I would say was that the portion size was a little small for the price. The kids had pasta w/butter which they shared and loved.   All in all, a great experience and I would go back!

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Amazing waterfront deck on a sunny day in SF, one of the BEST Tuna Poke on Tostada, I want some more now! Yum! And Yummy specialty cocktails. Can't go wrong, love this place but it's a bit too expensive for my blood. It was $30 for one cocktail and the tuna, hmm.

7RRd9dq9OF1PDlQaVgRWfg.review_text: The crab and shrimp sandwich was great.  Lots of seafood.  The fish tacos were also good.  The wait was a bit long, but worth it.  Try the peel shrimp as a starter!

LpVJ7DQ0K7qqIqDw_jMdTg.review_text: I like this place, but I wanted to like it even more...  A popular tourist destination with a dive atmosphere, Pier 23 cafe has limited seating inside with a vast open outdoor seating area with a great oceanside view.  On a beautiful day with a significant other or a group of friends, any restaurant is sure to do well.  I arrived late to meet a group of 5 and it took about 15 minutes for the waitress to greet me.    Albeit the initial slow service, I was itching for a bloody mary, and at $9 for a small glass, this didn't come cheap.  I was however, surprised to find a tasty green bean, cocktail onion and olive in the glass surrounding the extremely spicy liquid.  When we finally had the chance to order, the fish and chips sounded delectable and I wasn't disappointed.  @ $14 for the plate, this was about standard.    Better service + more bang for your buck would have increased my rating by another star, but I'll come back here on a nice day to have another fine tasting bloody mary and try another great tasting seafood item.

ZNRsbgpethalQnaHPOo5kg.review_text: Adorable looking place right on the water. Additional points to the 'outside' patio being heated so you can enjoy the lookout without freezing.  The menu may look sparse but each item (that my group had) was quite delicious. The sardine bruschetta was a wonderful surprise -- these sardines were not the salty little fish you expected but rather a larger, fresh piece on each slice of bread, accompanied by olive tapanada and greens. Everyone in the family happily had a segment of the appetizer.  Both mother and I had the mussels and clams. Garlicky, brothy, fantastico! Sis had cup of clam chowder and side field greens -- great salad and good (but very rich) soup. Father had the lettuce wrap -- a "piece together your own wrap" dish that was as delicious as the rest. Only bummer was they were out of crab while the surrounding Pier 39 restaurants had some. That said, we obviously walked back to Pier 23 after inspecting a few 39 places and greatly enjoyed the meal.  From the look at other patrons' dishes, the sandwiches/burgers were quite large. The sweet potato fries and sliders also looked popular with the under 10-years-old set.  If you're headed up to the City and Pier 39 to look at the sea lions with tourist friends/family, this is a good place to go. Plastic chairs, red-and-white checkered tableclothes, $1 oysters during happy hour -- good, casual, comfortable, friendly.

HkCTc4NZ9QFbAnQHdwGnsQ.review_text: After walking through the horrific, touristy Fisherman's Wharf, the Pier 23 Cafe provided a huge relief. The boobulous blond hostess who sat my boyfriend and me was super-friendly...I mean really friendly per her gaze toward my guy. Anyway, we just wanted to check the place out since it's supposed to be one of the coolest piers. The waitress seemed shocked by my request for hot tea.  "What flavors do you have?" I asked.  "I don't know, we're really not a tea kind of place," she shrugged.  While I sipped my piping Lipton, I laughed when I saw an English couple at the table beside me enjoying mugs of hot tea, too.   Live music apparently revs up Pier 23 on a regular basis; its location on the water helps, too.

RR-hNSxTUs4CSkGQZLEWyw.review_text: Friday, my employer, who normally throws a weekend-away summer party for the office, still wanted to show the employees how much we mean to them a decent summer party by treating us to free drinks and food at Pier 23.   Great place for big groups, but a no-no for people that do have kids. Sorry but when majority of the people in an office party have drinks, strong drinks (mind you), in their hand, the kiddes should be left home. The calamari, mussels, and buffalo wings were very tasty. I wasn't too impressed with their chips and salsa, because the chips tasted stale, but I needed something to munch on nontheless.   The music playing was definitely the vibe for the our group and generally sealed the deal that not only did we get the entire pre-dance floor area, but we even got all of us to dance in our intoxicated stupor. Another plus is two bathrooms for the ladies, although one is super small and requires you to practically stand on the toilet to open the door. And the promotion of having good loving sold in the vending machines in the bathroom for only 75 cents. Niiicccee.   Strong drinks. Decent food. Good music. Great location.

usJTkx8aKfKlAaIAxnJLTQ.review_text: Been here many times before, and recalled having a solid 3 star experience: pretty good food and decent service, with great views.  The line for the women's restroom is generally a problem and not managed well.  For awhile, there was only 1 working toilet (out of 2) and the line was crazy long.  So some women were using the men's restroom, as it was empty...until the bouncer bounced women out of there.  They should have had a better plan for managing, like switching the women's and men's rooms.  But I didn't use the restroom yesterday, so I don't know if that is still a problem.  Yesterday, I made a dinner reservation for the first time (by phone).  When we arrived, there was no record of our res, but thankfully we got there before it was packed.    Our server spent more time chastising us (for rotating the table so that both of us could see the water) than serving us.  She took our orders, dropped off our drinks and promptly left while I was trying to get her attention to bring me a glass for my hard cider, which she served in the bottle.  Never saw her again until she brought the check - literally.  The other server who dropped off our food, as well as the busser and a different server we flagged down were all helpful when we needed something, but I don't want to have to ask everyone else for favors because my server has disappeared.    My partner and I mentioned to our server when we ordered that we were very hungry and would like to start with some sourdough bread.  A few slices came with our appetizers, which took 20-30 mins to arrive, even though it wasn't busy.           Then there's the food.  The clam chowder was missing salt and tasted like heavy cream with clams and some sand.  I don't remember it being flavorless before.  Then I had the fish 'n chips, which had the saltiest batter I've ever tasted, and we couldn't finish it in spite of being so hungry.  The fries were good, though, so I ate those.  My husband ordered the clam/ mussel combo (which was good, as always, but not very filling), followed by the fish tacos, which were like tapas size.  So he needed to order a quesadilla to feel satiated.    No one ever asked how our food was, so I am writing this review in hopes that someone at Pier 23 reads it and rights the ship soon.  Our dining experience was disappointing from start to finish.  We still had a good time because we were happy to be out together and were glad to enjoy the view, but the $100 bill (before tip) for a bad casual meal with one beer & one hard cider (and no dessert) felt insulting.

NZwGgyT2BVjfWm6h-orOrw.review_text: Great place for drinks and/or lunch on a nice day. Primetime real estate that thankfully doesn't just rest its laurels on location. The food is very good, a little pricey but very good. I had the crab and shrimp sandwich and it was great--fresh, overstuffed, and served on soft chewy sourdough. The tuna poke appetizer was also very tasty. Would definitely recommend. Looking forward to going back and trying the fish tacos.

D3zzBdZDs4qH3sChk3k9_Q.review_text: This is one of the closest places to our work, so we head here quite often when we have visitors from our other offices. The food is delicious and they have a great variety of drinks! When the weathers nice, sit outside for beautiful views!

F4X9y6m09efUduEDCRyakw.review_text: This place is awesome!   My secret spot. Live music, good drinks, food is okay. It's always a fun and exciting time. Friday-Sunday you'll find live music, different genre every night. Check out this spot for a good time after a Giants game, bring a date, or just to stop in for a drink. Always a good time!

EcFUfOvZLQSgS-KHWKJSUg.review_text: Fun place.  Great view.  Friendly, smiley service.  Good beer.  Close to everything.  Thumbs up.

AOyj_RYlNgNUYq1r47Q0Sw.review_text: Great live jazz. Loved the food. The three of us split a bowl of chowder (the sourdough extra wasn't worth it... you don't get much), mussels and clams in pasta and fish and chips. All were great! However, I'm used to clam chowder having more chunks of potato and clams but this one didn't-- it was still good though. Saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Glad we came here!

tUyfzOVZ8L1myTmQFYfxFA.review_text: I was in town for a bachelorette weekend and after a long day of wine tasting in Sonoma, we were looking for somewhere laid back to hang out and grab a bite.    We sat on the deck over in a corner - a bit secluded from the rest of the deck, which was nice for our large party but not great in terms of the service we received.  It seems that we got forgotten about a bit.  The view is absolutely gorgeous, especially at sunset.  It's a great place to relax with a drink, but I'd recommend venturing elsewhere for dinner.  We ordered a few appetizers - the cheese plate, the smoked salmon with capers and the black bean and cheese dip, none of which were memorable.   The bean dip actually didn't even arrive at our table until after most of us had received our entrees.  I ordered the shrimp and crab sandwich for dinner, and for $19 I expected a bit more.  The bread wasn't toasted as indicated on the menu, and the mayonnaise and lemon more than overpowered the seafood.  Very disappointing.   Great location, but I doubt I'll return when I'm back in town because of the lackluster food.  Too many other options to explore!

wFP41Ni0gkfHIGV0wBf0Tg.review_text: This place makes me very, very happy!! The catfish curry dish is amazing... I want it right now, actually...  Also, the crab sandwich on sourdough... WOW!!  The calamari is also superb. And everything washes down well with a good ginger beer.  I haven't gone there for BEERS yet, but I noticed they have some good ones!! Next time...

5aCEquYmXUIsWmpUp1gqxA.review_text: I remember coming here when I turned 23 .... that was many many years ago.  I stole a hat but ended up leaving it in the back seat of some guy's car ... he had braces.   It was many years later before I came back ... but back I did come.  This time instead of just drinking (and stealing hats and making out with boys with braces), I actually had lunch here.  And hands down - without a doubt, these are the best fish and chips in San Francisco.  They are the cajun type made with cornmeal instead of batter - but so moist, so delicious so flaky is the meat .... omg, I'm drooling just thinking about it.  I like Pier 23 because it's a versatile sort of place, sort of like me.  By day, it's unassuming and chill, at night - it rocks out with live music and sexy drinks.  How can you go wrong with a place that has character and an edge?  So with the weather these days lookin' mighty fine, it's worth your time to take a stroll down the Embarcadero, grab a seat outside, smell that salty air and enjoy a glass of wine and some fish and chips.  You will not be disappointed.

estdZTTFB4X282Rmriwz8w.review_text: Tuna Poke Tostada, delicious.  French fries come coated in red pepper with jalapeño ranch dipping sauce, awesome. Fish tacos, average. Sauces that come with aforementioned taco, awesomely delicious. Beer selection for a girl like me, decent. I had fat tire and some anchor steam. Inventory of bud lights for a lady like my sister, not so good. They ran out while we're eating.  Nice view, a little chilly in the shade like the rest of San Fran.

VjywcAvzC29dxdNg9Hi2Hw.review_text: I had lunch here today and it was delicious. The ambiance of the place is completely casual. The food quality is above what you'd expect based on the atmosphere. But then again most of the best seafood places have a hole in the wall feel.   I had the crab cakes, which were excellent. More crab than anything else.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: Did God just bring me Heaven in San Francisco...???   No, but comparable, he brought me Pier 23.  On a sunny Saturday afternoon there is nothing better then to throw on your summer kicks and lounge with a Pacifico in hand while engaging in an intellectual conversation with friends while listening to the bay water brushing against the Pier of 23 with your straw hat shading your face from the cancerous sun.

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: I would give it 3 and a half stars...  I have been here 3 or 4 times... It can be lively.... Be prepared for a crowd depending on when you go..  They have a decent bar... The bartender turned me off the first time I ordered a drink, but everything worked out...  We will go back again if the situation is right..

iawJtDi3Gkx4O6OmSoEw-g.review_text: Stopped here to grab some drinks and food while out exploring with a group. It wasn't too busy when we arrived and we were taken to the back area to accommodate our large party.  The back area is large and covered. They have live bands play here on certain nights.   The service was good. They offer a variety of drinks, especially in the beer selection. There's even a beer bucket special, where you select 6 types of beer and it is served in a bucket of ice. Think of it as a beer sample. I wasn't feeling beer that night and had a sangria instead. It was alright.  The food is rather pricey. I had their special of the night - ham and cheese sandwich with a bowl of clam chowder. The soup was good, but the sandwich was extremely oily and salty. Definitely not worth $11.  I recommend stopping by here for drinks and possibly appetizers, but don't waste your money here for dinner.

ZW89naEoGiWngGSQmanOTQ.review_text: Great Fathers day lunch with my daughter, son in law and my wife. Great service and friendly staff. All of us thought the food was very good. It is nice to be able to dine outdoors on the patio at the water.

nHnNraNUct25HJJTRAGYkA.review_text: In case you didn't know, 23 is my favorite number. Not only is it my birthday (April, to be exact), but it is also Jordan's, Lebron's, and Chris Perry's (go blue!) number and the street that I live on. To top it off, my friend has a theory that the number 23 shows up in every movie. Try it, you'll get creeped out!  Anyways, when I discovered Pier 23 Cafe, I was destined to try it. On a clear, sunny day, this place's advantages probably outweigh its disadvantages. Any other time, though, don't bother and save a dolla'. Prices are outrageous. Service is mediocre. And nothing you can do can make you feel like less of a tourist. I have to give them props on one thing though. The bbq shrimp po' boy sandwich was absolutely mouth watering delicious! Don't steer towards anything else on the menu - just take my word for it.

cXOKF_ySM9ps2vBhMOkcvw.review_text: Still undecided on this fixture of the Embarcadero. It's location is superb, offering scenic views and great people watching . It's food and its sometimes mediocre quality, however, is not enough to have you disregard its tired state of decor. Perhaps, though, that is what adds to its allure? Also, an appearance on Guy Fieri's Triple D, doesn't hurt either. Good times, not great food, have been had here, especially when the Japanese Navy was on scene to celebrate Cinco De Mayo. After all these years, I'm still trying to figure you out Pier 23.

B5qFPcKFftO0gONPfjZsZQ.review_text: Dropped in here because it looked cute and the BF and I were about to collapse from the 10-mile bike ride it took to get us to the area and this place was convenient, near the water, and had an outdoor area for us to sit with our bikes. Not on the patio overhanging on the water, sadly. On some less nice area on pavement with kinda ghetto tables next to the patio, where people who bring dogs can sit. Meh, whatever we were starving so bring on the food!  I had the Cod and shrimp slider (yes one slider for $5) with a small side of fries and quinoa salad ($6 and enough to share), and he had the  crab and shrimp sandwich ($16.50! I kid you not). Overall we were both dying to eat so we devoured everything except for the copious amounts of french fries and agreed that the meal was OK. We both agreed that they did that thing that restaurants do sometimes where they don't actually know how to cook something awesomely so they just fry it or add lots of mayo, or salt and that was definitely the case here overall. As consumers of not overly processed foods, the meal left us feeling a little lethargic and bloaty.
