Also the hostess was rude and was obviously annoyed when showing us to our outdoor seats because we didn't want to leave our roadbikes alone and sit on the patio (hey, they are NOT cheap) and just gave us menus and told us to go to the bar inside when we want to order, luckily a waitress realized we were getting lunch and served us for the rest of our meal.    I would go back if I was with people who I know love heavy touristy food places and they were treating, but not again otherwise.

C8LSGSbfSdlFyoZL11Ei2g.review_text: Awesome food, great views. Cost is reasonable for it being in SF. Saw this cafe featured on TV a few years ago and I've been there about 5 times since. It's our go to spot because it's small and just down from Pier 39 which is always crowded. There is a full bar and some seating inside. Then there is a tented area outside as well as full outdoor seating. Definitely bring a coat.

RGDyPqmNLKPdZ4VBf-6UKQ.review_text: One of my fav place in SF for no-frill fresh seafood! Fresh dungenese crab daily, served whole with garlic and rosemary...SO AMAZING! I also love their fish and chips. The batter is so crispy and fish is so juicy...its not England but it sure taste amazing!   Plus, who doesn't love the great view overlooking the bay? Needless to say, I LOVE this place!

4JOSvHh4T14g2P__5nN0Mg.review_text: Been here twice! Very busy on weekends but if you can find a table on the patio it's well worth it.  The seared ahi tostadas with portabellos were so good!! I would come just for those and an ice cold beer just to people watch!

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Big fan of this place on a sunny day.  Grab a beer or 3 and sit outside and enjoy it all.

cyzjmBnbawy2FwaE0U_eQg.review_text: I definitely like Pier 23. I have a good time every time I go (several times now). Basically, this is a great place to go if you're looking to just hang out with friends casually and drink beers / eat bar food. Everything's great, don't get me wrong, but you gotta come here for the right reason. If you're expecting Gary Danko to cook for you, then you're toast!  Patio is great on a nice day. Good spot, I'd recommend it.

fGSe0ZSXCaMN0E2lYGPSSQ.review_text: Visited Pier 23 after a morning of touring Alcatraz. There were three of us in total, we sat facing the water and enjoyed a beautiful view of Americas Cup. The drinks were great, the food was wonderful, service was good. Definitely a great spot for lunch!

CivLOrB36bhEgnOQEuUzWg.review_text: i dig this rig.  This place is the perfect setting for a date, a party, heavy drinking, soaking up some rays, bringing your parents, partying with soon to be in laws, taking out of towners, sight seeing, well you get the point..   The food used to be the bomb and I didn't get a chance to taste it since they changed out menus.  They used to have this ridiculous turkey burger but I know they have taken it off.    They have live music at night and based on the day, this place could either be a biker joint, a preppy hangout, or my fav day -- filled with some  awesome people watching!!!  Think of this spot as like Sam's but with not as many stuck up pricks, prissy b*tches, or as many boats.. I dig this place way better than Sams, and it's closer too!

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: Best excuse for you and co-workers to sneak out of work early on a sunny day?  The outdoor tables at Pier 23.   Honestly, with the bay as your backdrop, nothing beats the feeling of having a cocktail in your hands, and the stresses of work floating away on the waves.   Unfortunately, most of the executive douchebags tend to have the same idea, so you often have the feeling of throwing them into the bay, along side your work stress.  On a less-sunny day, Pier 23 isn't much more than a dive bar. The inside is small and, in all honesty, hardly worth visiting. I'd much rather save it for a sunny day.

0FgbaE8Z4bnVK0utSl-Y9g.review_text: The restaurant's website says that the kitchen closes at 10 pm. We arrived a little before 9 after a long, busy day, and were told that the kitchen was closed, but we were welcome to go to the bar. Really? Since we weren't looking for a liquid meal replacement, we of course left, and we won't bother trying again.  It would be nice if Pier 23 updated their website so that people don't make unnecessary bus trips across town, thinking they might be able to get food during the posted hours.

WaQ7KcZd3wVozXiDFWIDVA.review_text: Great view.  Enjoyed the ginger beer and the lobster crab sandwich!

1HlfZir8ftR2cY6vpWy-Sw.review_text: Awesome place for an easy late lunch with friends.  My wife and I have been going to Pier 23 for the past 15 years or so, and I have to say, it hasn't gotten old at all.  I think the food has actually improved over the years and the service definitely has.  We went there last Sunday afternoon with relatives from out of town.  After doing the usual tourist sites we just wanted someplace to grab a beer and a sandwich, and take in some live tunes; but we didn't want the usual tourist destination.  10 hungry souls (including several kids), and they accommodated us less than 5 minutes with a view table.  Awesome salads and Crab sandwiches.  And the fries are yummy. Nice casual way to top off an afternoon.

VatYPF-gubOpCy_bRUpNkg.review_text: Neat discovery for a place right on the Embarcadero!  1. Biker bar  - 4 stars coz they still look awesomely hot  2. Reggae music  - 3 stars coz it makes for a perfect way to enjoy a warm SF summer night  3. $10 cover charge after 8PM  - 2 stars coz its a sad way to make money when they're sitting empty on a Saturday night  4. Calamari + fries + chicken wings + beer  - 4 stars coz it just tasted greasy and heavy and then to have it all washed down with a cool beer was close to perfection  5. Fish n Chips  - 2 stars coz they spelt G.R.E.A.S.Y. You'd think on oil well exploded on them  6. Service  - 4 stars coz we were a group of 35 and the waitress was on top of getting orders, delivering them and running around and all this, with a smile  7. Bathroom - 3 stars coz the wait was not too bad and the bathroom was clean as a whistle  8. Crowd - 3 stars coz it was a mix of yuppy, preppy, biker, rastfarian, eclectic and some times drunk people  9. The View - 4 stars for being over the water, watching Coit Tower lit up, good company and nice music  10. The Bar - 4 stars coz he was good, very friendly and helpful

SE12F7KiHtaTLxNBBsIPvg.review_text: crab cake benedict and corned beef hash was awesome.

CvLsOVrsmTsEX19jkSlutg.review_text: Nice setting, really good food and great service! I had the baked crab (a delicious entree for two) and a fabulous mojito.

koVo6OEelKgkfmd9qX-oUw.review_text: If the weather is decent this is a great place to hang out for drinks and dinner. The shrimp and crab sandwich is a must! The wait can get a little long, but they have a beer garden that you can hang it in while you wait. Also, it seems like the servers are overwhelmed and they could use more staff. It took a while for refills, but I never saw the servers just sitting around.

o1dF5mDfyH7Mzja-nBRQJw.review_text: My caesar salad consisted of iceberg lettuce and nothing else.  Oysters did not taste fresh.  Ciopino was ok nothing to brag about.  Service lousy.  Place is dirty.  Too expensive, for those prices u could of had 5 star experience.

bADntnjBXIPHzFBo0RlRGA.review_text: Don't be fooled by the exterior of this place or the relatively cheap furnishings. This is a great spot for food, of real quality for good prices. The terrace is also a great sun trap. I strongly recommend sharing a load of starters. Tina tostadas, calamari, crab cakes & tacos are my favorites

rHuVF76zh8b_nzHK3vZ9Mw.review_text: Really my bill came to $97.67!!! Let's start with the service,  Walked in lady in the front just grabbed the menus n walks with them never told us "follow me this way"! Didn't bother even looking if we were following her. It wasn't till she got to the table alone she realized obviously we weren't following her to the table.. (my first time ever coming,  nt a good impression already) Now let's get to the extra charge on "sourdough"! Really! ? Why?? When you order clam chowder it already is included!  Knowing it ws a extra charge why not let the customer know that.. for a "cafe" they sure charge as if they were a 5 star restaurant!!! Now I see why they don't have much of a great ratings!  Thanks for the rip off will not be coming here again.

pixNhhD7MstDu0Q0F9QyzA.review_text: Great bar for drinks after work on sunny Spring/Summer days.  Working in the Financial District, Pier 23 soon became a frequent happy hour location for our group.  The food and drinks are good, but it's the outdoor deck and location on the Bay that really make Pier 23 a must visit spot on those special sunny days in San Francisco.

vaJd9d_DqgSAk8Kg1DnaCA.review_text: I have a hate/like relationship with San Francisco.  I can't quite bond with the place and have had some bad things happen yet now I am looking to relocate here.  In all my times here, I had yet to find a place that make me smile and say "cool".  I stopped here with a friend and as we walked in I thought thought the place was WEIRD.  It came off to me as a local place which is where I'd rather go in order to see if I want to move here.  The crowd was very mixed-old dudes, fabulous people, families, etc... We decided to sit on the back deck have a few beers and I had the steamed mussels and clams and well...  I have finally found my first place in San Fran that I would actually want to come visit again and just chill, like a local... (well if that sounds stupid, I'm a Chicagoan.. bite me!)  It was a nice ending to an afternoon and finally started to turn my opinion around about this here, San Francisco place... Well this, and taking the ferry back to Marin with the full moon over the GG Bridge was pretty awesome too).  I won't say the food was stellar, it was okay... but the place seemed legit and comfortable and interesting and that's all I need to make me happy.

cjmj97V0ucBwI96N2QoyCQ.review_text: Celebrating mom's 80th birthday w/ a trip to San Francisco for Fleet week and Columbus day.  Had dinner here one night.  Prices were reasonable.  There was a jazz band playing in the bar with the Giants game on tv.  The clam chowder was delicious as were the clam and mussel appetizer. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his fish and chips.  Sister enjoyed her fish and chips as well.  Mom's burger was not a frozen patty and probably had almost 1/2 lb meat on it.  She really enjoyed it.  Brother's ribs were a bit strange.  The potato salad and greens were served under the ribs and the braising liquid pour over the salad and ribs and greens.  It was all good individually but weird all mixed with the braising liquid.    My sandwich was delicious but unfortunately my allergies started to act up after two bites into the sandwich....the incident was dealt with swiftly and gracefully by Caspian our waitress.    Caspian was a delight.  She gave my husband a little straw hat out of a stack they had there.  She handled my incident gracefully.  She brought mom a piece of chocolate cake with a candle for her birthday and even let her keep her champagne flute.    It was a fun evening.

fojptcVycoRhrLUU7XSSNg.review_text: Seating in the back of the restaurant is beautiful, especially on sunny San Francisco days.  My boyfriend and I decided to stop by before a game at AT&T park. It's kinda like a hole in the wall restaurant that you probably wouldn't think twice about unless you're a native.  We ordered the Crab and Shrimp sandwich and shared between the two of us.  I wished we ordered two different things because those sandwiches was so delicious.  DON'T FORGET TO SPRAY THE LEMON JUICE ON THE SANDWICH!  So worth the trip and is on the "to do list" for bfast!

e8SJJLFwLmdOu-X-Nhzjhw.review_text: This is our second time here. Last time it was a 30 minute wait but that was at night. It was worth it though. Today we were sat promptly  staff is friendly and courteous. They took our drink order right away. Then he brought our drinks and took our orders. Everything was excellent , I had the crab and shrimp sandwich. My Wife and Daughter had Fish and Chips. My other Daughter had the Chicken Club. We will be back.

XQ_JSYsiymIw51Ni042M-A.review_text: Many a Sunday Funday (drink day following drinking Saturday night) have I started dizzily at Pier 23. Honestly, until I had that first Corona out of the bucket, I was sure I was going to relive everything I took in the night before. Fortunately for me, "Hair of the dog" is not an uncommon term for Pier 23's Sunday Funday Brunch!   Walk inside straight to the covered back patio. It's larger than the inside and way more fun as all the conversations mix together into a gossip soup. Feel free to join a conversation at another table as they're probably going to do the same. But stay away from the walk of shame jokes, 50% of the people here are on it at the moment...   Go for a starter of a bucket of six Coronas at some steal of a price I can never remember because I follow it with an undisclosed number of Bloody Mary's. Then get the Huevos Rancheros. Seriously, they're the best in the city. At least I think so, who knows really...but they way I remember it, they're AWESOME!   Close it out by spilling something on your "date" and you have the perfect Sunday Funday Brunch! It really is a great place to wear your sunglasses and hide your bloodshot eyes while reliving the embarrassment of the past night. I miss it and the Heuvos Rancheros uncontrollably.   Go for a Sunday Funday and do what Moonshine likes to do, figure out if the dizziness is from the alcohol or the docks shifting. I don't know, do you?

vb81D6qIcAj98kRyHqaRjA.review_text: The view was awesome, the seating was close but not to close, the weather was perfect. Now to the service, started off pretty rocky but I think after having to ask him three times for something he made sure after that to be more attentive. I have only tried calamari a couple times...first time I didn't like it, second I was amazed,I tried it again here and no way...it's way to chewy. I didn't like the chowder my husband ordered,I didn't taste any potatoes and the broth was tasteless to me. He enjoyed everything including his crab and shrimp sandwich. I did like my fish n chips, but it was so little it felt like it was a kids meal lol....but there water was so delicious!!!! I guess I'd go back but definitely will eat before arriving.

g-f_06makc0qfm2F-JTCIQ.review_text: Came here and had a good time. Service was pretty darn good.  The fried calimari was tasty, but slightly chewy. Still tasty.  The back porch area was fantastic. It was a bit windy and chilly and so the sides were all zipped shut, which made the area nice and comfortable.   We had a big group and made a reservation so seating was a non-issue. It was also rather quiet since we were there on a Tuesday early dinner time, which probably added to the non-issue for seating.  My biggest drawback was menu. The beer menu was pretty good. They had some great on tap options. Happy to see Deshutes on tap!   The food menu really made things difficult. They had large plate and small plate listed with price ranges that were similar for both. There was quite a variety between what each member of the group ordered with some large and small plates, but they all seemed the same for portions imo. They should've priced it per category since seafood is obviously going to be more expensive than chicken.  The menu organization was also challenging and the selection was low. The appetizers were kind of odd and the sides were a bit pricey for sides and they were also a little strange too.  I ordered fish tacos. They were pretty good. Heavily topped with peppers and tomatoes. The guacamole and salsa toppings were nice to have, but the flavor of the taco, while not terrible, was a bit bland. The salsa did have some spice in it, but it didn't round out the flavor of the tacos as much as I hoped.  I'd return! Next time, I want to try something non-seafood for comparison.

mBAZvYXmrvxjUzDKUEcxEQ.review_text: Bad food, not great service. The food is pretty poor quality (like a Costco seafood) and expensive for what it is. I got the crab and shrimp Louise salad-it was cheap iceburg lettuce, light pink baby shrimp and a hardboiled egg and thousands island dressing for $20. Friend got shrimp crab sandwich and it was mostly mayonnaise. We asked for bread and it took forever to arrive. There's so much good food in SF, this spot is not worth the view.

n5NatlzIpc17OOvAFqujHA.review_text: Ehhh...  Great setup. Great water view. A cool looking spot. Very much lacking in food quality and service, though.  I asked for a Diet Coke and never got it. That was irritating as hell.  We picked up four raw oysters at $2.50 each. They were fresh but I was able to taste shells in one. The calamari was no good. I tasted more of fried flour than calamari.  There were a few highlights: the tombo tuna poke was fresh and tasty. I saw someone eating the crab and shrimp sandwich and had to put an order in for it. The sandwich is big enough to share for two so plan for leftovers if you don't have a big appetite.  This place is on the fence when it comes to being a tourist or local spot. Great spot to go when the weather is good. I'd say hit or miss on the menu items.

gpeeqIHRoKBzJACHIB9zmg.review_text: I went there on saturday evening with 7 friends. We sat outside on the terrace, which was a cool spot: nice view and a little bit of breeze. I ordered the grilled fish tacos, which were OK. I don't recommend the mac and cheese which looked awful. Service is relatively fast, without any particular flavor  though. They have 7 types of beers and one pint costs 7$ which I find a bit pricey.

Dp73YMsqLBIIw97o6ruFsQ.review_text: The crab and shrimp sandwich on toasted sourdough is generous and meaty. It could use a tad bit of spice, but overall is excellent. The fish tacos are tasty and served with two sauces for dipping or pouring. The French fries are seasoned with garlic and very good. Helpful, friendly service and a wonderful view from the back deck make it a keeper. Glasses of wine have a generous pour in low-ball glasses, the bloody Marys are good. Try the Pier Pleasure drink for a tropical change (vodka, aperol, grapefruit and lemon).

m_tBV8WXko_egVNwlSlBAQ.review_text: Service was ok. Food mediocre.  The lettuce wraps are NO longer on the menu. I seriously doubt Diners Drive inns and Dives would feature THIS restaurant on their show today. A big disappointment, a big let down.

On2FNhqedaR-f3y1RCweug.review_text: Overpriced mediocre food.   Pleasant view during the day. I suppose they stay in business off the tourist crowd...but can't imagine going back given the better alternatives.   Based on other positive reviews, perhaps we caught them on an off night.

RKfETgoe0wuZds8EMDBw0Q.review_text: I love the views and best part..its just down the street from where I work these days.  They have live music most nights.  Food is good and includes a variety seafoo or burgers.  Sweet potato fries get an A+.  The fried squid is great and the clam/mussel bowls are also fantastic.

w_la0a-F1GCgQgh3qzm_9w.review_text: Had brunch here and it was pretty good.  Great location.  The prices were a little more than expected, especially for the quality and portion size of the food.  You can sit outside on a nice or a not-so-nice day, due to the covered outside area.

suk3DMgtTj7HVCgaF4XdQA.review_text: Fantastic spot to come and chill, beautiful bay view, and good grub.  I came here with some family after a long day of driving and it was great to sit down and enjoy some good food and beautiful sights. I had their chicken sandwich and their angus burger ( I was hungry!) and both were great, fresh, and delicious. Nothing was greasy or cheap, it was quality food and it wasn't too expensive either.   Nice staff, live music, good people, bay views, what else do you need? It was a good time, I'd come back for sure.

b1Iu7lgKqMB6i-6-bXjmfQ.review_text: Had breakfast one early Sunday morning. It was good. I had the house made hash - it was very good. Probably should go back for lunch and try something.

KBNceewFFeTK-vnv6Y-s7Q.review_text: Perfect warm SF night. Native Elements was playing. sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs… Mahalo for taking me back to the shows at the Waikiki Shell, the smell of pakalolo in the air, the feel good chill vibe, and excellent jawaiian beats. The beer was flowing, the band was jammin', the crowd was dancing and had more flavor than I have seen before, and it was good.

QrUBbEzUA8OvtV9OO-zeNA.review_text: I had read the great reviews, and was looking forward to eating some food and listening to live music.  This wasn't possible.  The room where the band was setting up, and I never heard was too small.  There was a DJ playing music.  So we sat in the back, outside.  The fish tacos that I saw on Diners, Drive in's and Dives were awful.  All corn, no fish, crappy stale tortillas.  And cold!  The cup of clam chowder was cold.  The ribs plate was tiny. No bread, you have to pay for it.  Add two beers, and two glasses of wine, 70.00 seemed steep to me.  I was beyond disapointed.

LkfeciuHVdSCZncsxjav4A.review_text: Great place.   Loved the view, service was friendly and yummy food. Fish tacos excellent!

TylOr9YYTV3znqIvH7kdmQ.review_text: I am a little underwhelmed by this place. I think it could do so much better in a lot of different ways, let me expand on it.  The food was okay, I ordered the crab and shrimp sandwich which was like a crab salad and served with horseradish. Even though I love spicy food, I usually like to take a bite or two beforehand so I can gauge the flavor of it, I slathered it in horseradish after just to get some taste, it was pretty bland and if it weren't for the horseradish there would have been nothing.  Service was friendly enough but with what looked like two servers for the entire inside, enclosed patio space and the waterfront tables it was understandably hard to meet the needs of everyone involved. As a tourist I was not that impressed.

Ug2fKMs5BQRr_Ti9fvxAdA.review_text: I highly recommend this spot if you are walking the wharf. I had the lettuce wraps with duck for lunch and it was a treat. I made reservation with Yelp and we were seated right away.

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: $6 hh specials, beer garden, and greasy delicious bar bites...what's not to like!  Great spot for a casual drink or meal waterside. Definitely a dive-bar scene but the al fresco seating option is a nice touch.   The place seems to fill-up quickly and they don't always have all hands on deck when it comes to bar tending.  So go early, grab a spot outside, and soak up the lovely bay view alongside a cold one.

U4glvszQswJ3DkLdeSyLag.review_text: We spent a long weekend in San Francisco and one of our goals was to eat well! We found this place on yelp and because it was on Diners Drive-ins and Dives (one of my fiance's favorite food network shows). This place is definitely worth coming to! We ordered clam chowder, calamari, mac and cheese, the peppercorn swordfish steak, and "the cheeseburger". Everything cooked perfected, tasted amazing, and we were definitely pleased with the service. We took 2 orders of clam chowder to go, that's how good it was compared to all of the other chowders we had tried on our trip! The front of the restaurant is the bar area, while the rear is quieter and has a lot more room for tables which is where we were seated. The parking is okay, its by meters or in their tiny lot. Everyone needs to step away from the tourist-y Pier 39 and venture on over to Pier 23 to come and eat here!

JRzz9yYsoREvGbBaf22W7Q.review_text: Came here with the fam after a Thurs night at the Exploratorium. Cute atmosphere and great tee shirts with cowgirl tushes. Food was good but a little pricey for the serving size.  Would recommend this place mostly based on the amazing view of the bay from the outdoor seating area. Cheers.

CMdFQ0y0zvzBS2x6tjZcWA.review_text: Our party of 4 really enjoyed the live reggae music on the patio over the water and delicious food last night.  I'll save the best for last though and waste no time on our attitudinal waitress wearing a ball cap shoved over her eyes.  Wow, really?  How about a smile, pulling up your ball cap for some eye contact and a bit of grace to convince us you like your job.  We had to ask another server to get her to give us menus and call her back to take our orders.  The buss boy was more welcoming with smiles and kindness.   Finally, she comes back and perks up after we order up a feast with a bottle of wine.  That is all the sunshine we got from her.  Who knows where she went for the rest of the night.  We saw two other servers attending their tables and had to rely on runners or the other servers to keep our water glasses full.  -worst waitress we've experienced...can't seem to keep the baggage at the door before work or even be attentive.  Besides her unavoidable effect on our experience, the food here was delicious!  The shrimp and crab sandwich was full of fresh seafood flavors. The shrimp quesadillas were colorful and loaded with fresh ingredients.  We also enjoyed some fried calamari and absolutely loved the fresh clams and mussels.  Everything was perfectly paired with our bottle of savignon blanc.    This truly is a fun place with great food and music if you can just avoid being served on by the attitudinal, ball cap wearing waitress.

hGiUVkkdUQiNv2FT-E3j_w.review_text: I love the backdeck over the water. I recommend that you make your selection from its daily specials and that you choose the fish. From the brunch menu, the crab cakes egg Benedict are delicious. It's also fun to go when there's live music.

Vgt1at7g5wueZqYhod1xEg.review_text: Being outside is nice and cold beer is nice but the food is the worst I've had in San Francisco in my last dozen or so trips here. Definitely avoid this tourist trap if you want to eat dinner. An OK place for drinks in the bier garden, but you can still do better elsewhere.

t1rXXdLW3Rkw2QRNWjrLnQ.review_text: It's understandable why they charge so much for so little. The view is the only saving grace for this little facility.  WARNING - Stay out of the men's room, nasty to the max!  My wife and I visited Pier 23 this past Saturday afternoon. I've been passing the place for months now and have wanted to stop there.  I did and can now check that block. I also checked the block that reminds me to stay away.   Nothing out of the ordinary here ladies and gentlemen.

bWwtcaC4KdsdtewUxWMCpw.review_text: Splendid Bloody Mary's.  The food has been hit and miss.  When I'm craving a Bloody Mary while sitting in the sunshine, this is where I'll be going.

ETycDLHWHIJGJNBwHgkP6A.review_text: Definitely topped my expectations with a great view ;)   I actually stumbled upon this place by accident because my boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat before going to the Exploratorium (another great place by the way). At first I was hesitant because from the outside it looked a little small. Little did I know, once I got in, I realized they had two full bars (indoors and outdoors) with an inner room and a HUGE outer room right on the pier overlooking the sea. Guests also have the option to sit outdoors too.   What I ordered:  - Fish & Chips: 4 stars. Loved the cajun fries and the crispness and tenderness of the fish. Expected more fish though because it only came with like 2.5 pieces. I'm obviously a girl with a big appetite.   - Crab & Shrimp Sandwich: Definitely recommended! Everything was fresh and it was a good portion. You can also order fries or a salad along with it.   - Beers (Blue Moon and Speakeasy)   Overall experience:  Definitely blew me outta the water (ha ha get it? lol -_-). A restaurant right next to the ocean, with mouthwatering food, and alcohol? I'M SOLD. Will be back soon!   P.S. I love how their menus and their "logo" are naked girls from the behind.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: Humorless bartender, tasteless (but generically so, not in a fun way) interior, and too many people in hats.    Second star for having seventy-five cent cock ring vending machines in the bathrooms.

4t_ZO0Z6LXDPZ5mhdrJ7AQ.review_text: This place holds a special place in my heart. The Manpanion and I had our first date here and we often swing by to celebrate that fateful day. It's a good location with nice views (if the weather permits). Also, the creamy clam chowder is nice on a cold day. I'm a fan of the calamari. I've also had the mac and cheese which was okay. I'd avoid the bacon fried clams, as there were only three pieces in the dish (but the greens were yummy!). The food is decent enough and sometimes you can even hear a live band. Yup. We're coming back...

RARk2DjiK1CnxsSdAOB3Og.review_text: Went here last Sunday after a trip at the San Francisco Zoo! I came here because I saw the cafe on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives. Service was excellent! There was always a waiter that came by to pick up dirty plates and bring our to go boxes to us. The food here was served with a warm smile too! Seeing that the fish tacos were on the show, I ordered that first. To be honest, I found it kind of bland. Maybe I'm just not a fish taco person? Oh well! I loved their roasted crab, ordered that twice along with steamed mussels (I came with my family). My little sister got the baby back ribs which were ohhh soooo goood and don't even get me started on that cole slaw! Next time I make a trip to San Francisco, I will definitely stop by and try something else on the menu!

l_mlQJXB2ZNySfIN6istGw.review_text: Busy on a weekday even.  Maybe it was the Cup? Anyway, it was amusing to watch the body language battle between the frat boys and the stroller crowd. Things were a bit pricey, but the fish & chips were quite tasty.  The fish was juicy yet the batter was crispy. The patio is nice.  There are plastic window/windscreens, heaters and sun hats available depending on the weather. All in all OK, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

MXBCSUFRMbi8nb_r-g4sWA.review_text: Food and drinks by the water.  I had the Baja fish tacos...the fish was bland and the sauce didn't add anything to help the taste.  Refills are not free.  We ate outside and enjoyed the atmosphere at least!

mMhsMvHPagrTJVX-2gMxnA.review_text: Loved the food! Had fried calamari for a starter. Perfectly fried not chewy at all. My bf had the garlic crab and it was great! I had the fish and chips. The fish was light and fresh! Great evening sitting outside!

ZRPLaDjJJ3ebJFQL5MIO_g.review_text: RUDE staff and overpriced food--especially for the small portions. Two stars for location on the water and live music.

_EdgCbk4YCVmtVmgyF3Ong.review_text: I love Pier 23!! Can be a little "touristy" but then again, it is SF. Every time I go there two things happen. (1) I go there with money, and then when I leave i seem to leave it all there. and (2) In exchange of losing all that money, I wake up with the meanest, cruelest hangover. NO BUENO.  Then I go there again at a different time and then i repeat one and two. What the HECK is wrong with me?! Why in the world did I just type HECK? lol.   THumbs up! Bueno!! HUN HAO! I approve.  During the summer, they have some amazing bands performing in the back dock area. Great place to people watch too!!

v11Qj90pB6aLoM8FRtbbNA.review_text: 3.5 ... extra .5 for having hats to wear while in the sun food was good service was ok. Pretty pricey wouldn't have expected that from looking at the place. I had the ahi sandwich and was thoroughly impressed.

BEqWWLKguUOky6ncVihvpA.review_text: It was okay - nothing special and you can't see the light show on the Bay Bridge. It was also kind of expensive for what it is - a hamburger joint.

AIjA_jJQyAhoxtYd335Ekg.review_text: Came here after the Exploritorium After Dark one evening.  There was a beautiful singer playing the piano in a jazzy trio.  Lots of Cole Porter.  Great ambiance.  The prices were okay, the place is smallish, and the food was solid.  Service was on the slow side, even though it wasn't so crowded, but the server was friendly so it helped even it out.  It's a great little landmark to visit, and I'd definitely recommend it if you're looking for something along the Embarcadero with a bit of class.

-s4QStMnUyQJYDzyXJkWDg.review_text: I love this place!!! Food was great, service was fast and absolute wonderful!!! I wasn't even finished with my first glass of beer and the waitress already asked if I was ready for my 2nd, Love it!

BILkR-OKfO2yyKJtDr2N9w.review_text: Totally late review, but here goes....  Was pleasantly surprised by this place. Looks like a dive and it was, but not that dirty feel dive where the furniture is sticky and gross.     We wanted to try a casual place after work for dinner and this hit the spot. Great outdoor seating in the back. The front is a bit cramped, but festive.   There were 8 of us, we were seated in the outdoorish area in the back.  We ordered yam fries...a LOT of them because they were that good. Here's the rest of what we ordered: Mussels/clams, Calamari, Cioppino, crab and some fish tacos. It doesn't sound like much, but when you order 2-3 orders of each, it adds up and we were pretty stuffed.  Loved the ambiance, staff were very attentive (surprisingly since they were so packed), fun vibe, casual crowd, and they had a live band. Gotta love that.   Definitely coming back.

ik5XVZy4vhKyInFTp542Wg.review_text: We came here for a late lunch on a Sunday.  Served is average seafood and bar food at prices a tad high for what you get.  They have cool t-shirts though!  Pros:  Friendly staff, easy to get a table and it's on the water.  Good selection of small/share-able plates.  Good for groups where you can be sorta loud and even watch the game.  Cons:  The raw oysters were extremely salty and sorta small for the price which was already high.  Louisiana has larger and better oysters for less money while DC at least has better quality for those prices. My tuna sandwich contained a small, thin filet with too much bread that was dry.  I really should have given the sandwich back.

9Ufw-rdATcn-M-Ej698YwQ.review_text: Incredibly expensive mediocre food in small portions.  $80 for 2 adults and 2 children - 2 fish taco plates ala carte,  1 side fry, 1 calamari (undercooked), 1 kids fish (2 small piece), 1 kids burger (served on a cheap hotdog bun), 4 sodas.   One of the few times I've left a restaurant feeling like I've been taken. My bad for not looking at the posted menu closer.     You can walk down towards Market for many more reasonable options.

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: I saw a friend's jazz 3-piece play here recently. The service was friendly enough. It's a cozy little space. I only had beer, so can't comment on the food.  My one complaint is the ATM machine right next to the band which was kind of an eye sore.  The patio looked inviting enough for a trip back to have brunch there.

Sy7fsiPiWDD_LrXgSVp22A.review_text: I love it nice place nice people great food

bXBd6yFGTmpZ3lLZldJXxA.review_text: Food was suprisingly good. I guess I thought it was going to be all fried foods but there were several fresh and tasty selections and my friend and I had a wonderful lunch there. It can get a tad busy but nothing too crazy.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: Way overpriced and not good food. Drinks are too pricey. Nice patio on a good day. Otherwise, way...

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: It was a gorgeous San Francisco Saturday!  We stopped by for lunch after viewing the visiting Kaiwo Maru Japanese ship before it sailed off for Hawaii.  We snagged a seat outside by the water and enjoyed great conversation over a shrimp sandwich, fish n' chips (cooked just perfectly, tasty and crispy!) and drinks all around.  The food came out a bit slow as there was a back-up in the kitchen, but we didn't mind so much as we could see the ship from our table, and we enjoyed the beautiful sunny weather.  Loved it!

xj8JavlGJUShGO3ogjNowg.review_text: I'll keep it short since I was here for a short time with my girlfriend. came here during happy hour.  - Service was slow for chips and salsa ( which were decent) - The drink of the day which included orange vodka, orange juice, and seltzer water was weak and tasted medicinal. - We could only order food on the happy hour menu if we sat at the bar ( which at the time was tiny and already packed to capacity) - Regular drinks were way overpriced....a Crispin Cider and Vodka Red Bull was $18!!!!!!  This is the place for professionals, old and young, who don't care about throwing their money away to have a drink in front of the beautiful pier. Not for foodies though. Blah.

FtTN2gURkXsl6YAvTpKHKQ.review_text: We had lunch here today. It's right next to the new cruise ship terminal yet to be opened.   They told us 20 minute wait. 20 minutes later we are seated.  Blue moon on tap and bloody Mary. Taps are good and the Mary was nice! w/ olive, onion and spicy green bean.  We had the Smoked salmon plate and the shrimp/crab sandwich. It was very good/fresh. Sandwich was very large on sourdough. It came with garlic fries.  Excellent I would come back for sure!

-8SmhfAtbA56qSWdP3xCYw.review_text: this is for brunch  Service - 4 (would of been a 5 but they kind of suck up to you at the end for the extra tip.  Food - I had the french toast with cream cheese and a blueberry sauce 5++ best I have ever had!!!  Crab/Shrimp Benedict - my girl got this and we both agreed it had a fishy fume taste. would not get again.  Always come back here when I'm in town and sit outside looking out into the bay.

1JryMwGllv-QtDGBm6ICmA.review_text: Very seldom could I give a rating below a 1; I would do it now.  This is probably the worst restaurant that I have been to in San Francisco.  Save yourself some grief and go elsewhere. I herd about this place on Dinners Drive ins and Dives.  We arrived with great expectations and left looking for a place to have a real dinner.   The atmosphere is relaxed and it has a killer view of the bay.  There were three musicians playing an acoustic medley of surf tunes.  It was very cool.  We were sat in the room facing the water.  Again a relaxed atmosphere.  After the hostess left we waited for 10 minutes before our server showed up.  She had to finish her conversation with a co worker at the bar.  Vera arrived and we placed an order for two appetizers and drinks.  We ordered Chorizo Firecrackers and Chips and dipping sauces.  Both appetizers were prepared nicely.  The Chorizo had a good kick.  The drinks were another story.  Upon Vera's return she asked if we were ready to order. We ordered Fresh Pasta Ribbons and Local Crab and Shrimp Sandwich.  I asked a question about the menu.  There was no description to compare the items.  So I took her recommendation.  Big mistake.  Mentioned the drinks and there was no response, just a sorry hon and then she walked away.  Not a good sign.  Another wait staff who doesn't know her menu or doesn't care. Our meals arrived and My wife's pasta was overcooked and the short rib was mostly fatty.  She had three bites and pushed it away.  I ate 1/2 of the sandwich.  I was hungry.  I opened the other half and found that this San Francisco treat was nothing but a Crab & Shrimp Louie.  If she would have explained it, I would have been happier.  Where is Vera???  I got a bus boy to bring the manager.  He came over and we explained the problems with the pasta dish and my sandwich.  He offered to take off the Pasta dish(very nice), he didn't seem so enthusiastic about mine.  I can understand,  not.  Paying customers are critical to success.  If it isn't right 100% do the right thing.  Where is Vera??  He left and never followed up.  Looked up a few minutes later and he was at the bar eating something. Vera finally arrived.  I wanted to ask if she was out shopping or getting in a round of golf, but why mess up a good thing.  She never asked how everything was.  She asked if we wanted something else.   NO was a quick answer.  We paid and got the hell out of there.  We walked down to Fisherman's Wharf and had a few drinks and some real good chowder. It amazes me how a place can serve garbage, have an inexperienced wait staff and provide horrible service and stay in business.  If I owned the joint.  New management, new wait staff and train the chef to prepare it the right way.  Show you care. Avoid this place at all cost.  Again I would give it a zero rating if i could.

8nv4lVEHQElGmqp3SeI0kQ.review_text: Boyfriend wanted to try this as he saw it on TV and I was game.  Went for lunch on a Monday, and everyone was seated outside.  Our food was pretty damn tasty, I must say.  The boyfriend got the Shrimp and Crab sandwich which is on lightly toasted Boudin's bread.  I got the Fish Tacos.  Fish Tacos... amazing.  It came with two sauces as well, one a little on the spicy side and the other more guacamole.  It was like eating a fish fajitas in a taco, which was awesome.  I had a taste of the boyfriends sandwich and that was really tasty as well.  His sandwich came with fries and they were surprisingly good.  I'm pretty sure I ate half of his order without knowing it.  I'm not sure how they were made, but I really enjoyed them.  The only downside of our visit was that the service sucked.  I'm not even sure who our waiter was.  He might have been to hip to serve us or something.  He walked by about 4 times to help others before he stopped at our table and seemed to be surprised that we were sitting there.  Otherwise, food was very good, will go back.

emlS2cAmfOzmMNSDi3mm9Q.review_text: We went for lunch here as it was walking distance from the Exploratorium. Good food, gorgeous view, nice staff, & kid friendly!

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: They have a great happy hour menu with a beautiful view. More importantly they have Speakeasy. Go in the afternoon, sit on the patio and have a beer with a bowl of clam chowder and Chorizo Firecrackers.   Loved our waitress - don't remember her name but she was awesome, it was super busy and she was great about coming around for orders.

8qBW0hbKylElphrCHKlR9w.review_text: we love crab and mussels and this place definitely delivers! excellent service by Tracy superb good awesome atmosphere. a had one of the best Sunday brunches. our new favorite casual dining dive. Thank you!!!!

MRPgIp3c5DVSmd6EhkjXIA.review_text: This was a cool place right on the water.. More of a local dive than a tourist spot which was just what we were looking for.  The beer was cold, reasonably priced & good. The fried calamari was fresh, tasty & tender.  My fiancé had the fish tacos and really enjoyed it & I had the lobster & shrimp roll( I think that is what it was called??) and it tasted fresh and was a perfect start to a perfect day trip to SF

KXNViFN4KrYgEsQ4fPw7Jg.review_text: Pier 23 brings back many memories of drunken Sunday afternoons on the outdoors deck.  Back when I lived in SF, this was a fine place to end up on a Sunday afternoon, throwing back margaritas & bloody mary's.  I have no idea if it is still a popular joint.... I imagine so, cause on a beautiful, sunny afternoon, it doesn't get much better than this!  The food is okay, nothing to write home about.  I seem to recall eating a lot of greasy food here - probably perfect when consuming alcohol, however!  Sometimes if you stay past the afternoon, into the evening, you can catch an interesting band too!

o9Ez0unDH1XninHhs3h2Fw.review_text: So the food here is um... kinda gross. The fried oysters are disgusting. The calamari was ok, the fries were probably the best thing we ordered. Also the artichoke hearts aren't just the heart they are the whole thing almost, with the leaves and stuff. I am pretty sure that the artichokes and the oysters came from cans and were then battered and fried. Luckily I had a gift certificate to here otherwise I would have been really sad to pay that much for such terrible food. Next time I come here I need to remind myself to order a burger.   Although maybe the food doesn't stand a chance anyways because the smell coming off the bay is pretty horrific at times. Couldn't tell if it was the cruise ship emptying their septic tanks or just the bay. Either way it wasn't pleasant.   But.... the outdoor patio is soooo wonderful when it's nice out. Get here early because it fills up fast. I will definitely be back here to bask in the sun with a few beers in hand.   Also when there's a band there might be a cover. On a Sunday evening it was $5. The band was good and fun, but very loud, so don't expect long convos if you sit too close.   All in all if you like drinking outdoors, then come here for the drinks, not the food.

q02KHjBcWLwemlKHIUQHNA.review_text: if it is nice outside I would sit outside and have a beer or eat here.

azivU1jkJhPSKS6ASMegQQ.review_text: Cool place, nice location, outside seating, although the view on the water isn't as impressive as others.  Friendly service, good food - we had oysters and some sort of spicy taquito appetizer.  I liked it a lot, will definitely go back sometime

JzPDFW16B9RuRpVS_nigyA.review_text: "I'm just gonna sit on the dock of the bay... watchin' the tide roll away... I'm sittin' on the dock of the bay... wasting time." -Otis Redding  The perfect lunch spot during a beautiful day in SF.  I used to work 2 blocks away from here and on the rare day when the fog burned off before 11:45 am, I would run to Pier 23 to snag a patio table before the lunch rush.  They offer straw hats to those who burn easily or you can opt to sit on the patio for the best of both worlds--views and shade.    I'm sad they got rid of the shrimp tacos--no beans wtih extra rice--which were my go to order.  Now I order the crab and shrimp louie salad which doesn't put me in food coma for the second half of the work day.    Overall, just a fun place to hang out, grab a drink and soak up the sun.  Don't forget the sunscreen!

u869YGk7uBDmUM5mn0eh_Q.review_text: I have long enjoyed a cold beer on a sunny day at this embarcadero establishment.  Just opened the menu for the first time this weekend and was pleasantly surprised.  I can't speak for the entire menu but the crab and shrimp sandwich was loaded with fresh seafood on sliced sour dough and was awesome (I added avocado to finish it off).  I will head back on a sunny day and for this sandwich!

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: Last time I was here everything was super salty. This time it was not and everything was surprisingly really good!  Must eat: tuna poke tostada, trout rouillet, shrimp and crab sandwich (not mayoey), octopus and cod ceviche, panna cotta.

3wjqn70BkV8nXzqBDLpUvQ.review_text: A Bloody Mary sitting outside by the water - apparently I am quite the fan of this hobby. Pier 23 is a great place to get your Bloody Mary on, or whatever refreshing drink your prefer. If it is a sunny day and you are down on the Embarcadero, I highly recommend walking down towards Pier 23. The food is not bad - I have only split the appetizers. The decor is a little dive bar-ish and perfect for the location. On a beautiful San Francisco day, I could sit out on their deck until the sun sets. The drink service could be a little quicker but if you are just there for a drink - grab one at the bar first then snag a table outside. It will tide you over as the waiters get around to you.

DeP-XBTwL8pRYjfr83RWCA.review_text: Somewhat of a tourist trap, and definitely the only 'mehhhh' dining experience I had while visiting SF.  But the views were great, and the service was quite friendly and accommodating of our various seat changes.  I'd recommend Pier 23 for before/after dinner drinks.

jCVLlr4DGms1uYbUXNpkaA.review_text: I planned my vacation after seeing the Pier on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives, especially for the Duck Poppers.  After the Chocolate Festival, I went down to the Pier for their duck poppers that were featured on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives.   Guess what?  NO DUCK POPPERS!  I was told the General Manager left and the duck poppers are no longer on the menu!  I just travelled 3000 miles for something not on the menu!  Instead I ordered the fish taco which was more like a soggy fried fish burrito, if there is such a thing. Aside from the flies hovering over my table and the overrated Big Daddy IPA, this was a very disappointing Diners, Drive Ins and Dive BOMB!

InkgaUH9iMHpPxaJ5C3Gjg.review_text: Not fancy but a great place to go with friends... Staff is friendly and the live music is great. French fries are addicting!!!!

CqWdaivLQLz1fttTVmdEgA.review_text: This review is for lunch. I've never been here during Happy Hour or Dinner.  It's a little overpriced for what you get but every time I've gotten food here I was always more than satisfied. They do provide a good sized portion.  The Seared Ahi Tuna sandwich is pretty tasty. I feel like the Tuna was cooked perfectly when I got it. Their fries are also pretty good, you don't really taste the garlic until you start burping an hour later.  Overall, it's a good spot for one of those days where you want to spend a little more for lunch.

mndtZTV0LhUxLhBDpFIVSA.review_text: The ambiance is perfect for a low-key date or happy hour. They serve the usual bar food like calamari, quesadilla, chicken strips, nachos, salads and sandwiches. I always order the calamari since they've got the recipe down. The drinks are reasonable as they serve beer, wine and and yes, my pear cider.  Dining inside or out back with a beautiful view of the Bay (there are heating lamps for the cool nights). Full service bar inside and a mini bar out back. The service is awesome and the waitresses are friendly and chatty.  Last Saturday of the month it turns into a reggae show staring Native Elements with random guests and yes there is a cover but if you get there before 8pm and are already seated, ask for a stamp and you're covered.

dhsmYyhk_9vMoH2y4uThhw.review_text: My boyfriend and I love it here after watching it on diners drive ins and dives we decided to check it out. Clam chowder, fish tacos, fish and chips are so yummy!! It's affordable pricing the only silly thing I think is charging a 1.50 for 4 slices of bread but hey it was worth it. Also servers need to check up on their tables more went my whole meal without a refill on my drink. Other then that we always have a great time here!

Mzl1mW-5fLOvEyxXCxW3eA.review_text: Great food great fun great view, the perfect place for a date, or if you just want to bring the family or out of towners. So much sexy
